loans.name: Kelly Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven soltera de 19 años de edad, la cual es madre cabeza de familia, la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo, junto con su espíritu emprendedor hicieron que está joven se superara a sí misma y montara un negocio de venta de repuesto para motocicleta que es el vehículo más usado en la ciudad de Medellín.

El carácter y la disciplina laboral mostrada por esta joven hacen que su negocio marche y genere utilidades las cuales gasta en el mantenimiento de su hijo y aporta en su hogar, pero ella no quiere conformarse, sueña con tener sucursales por toda la región antioqueña.

Para seguir consolidando su negocio y ser competitiva Tatiana debe invertir en surtido, es por ello que desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos para moto, tales como: accesorios, limpiadores y repuestos.

Apoya a esta joven cabeza de familia que ha demostrado carácter y responsabilidad para salir adelante junto su hija.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a single young woman, 19 years old, who is the female head of household. The responsibility of supporting her child, along with her enterprising spirit made this woman improve herself and establish a business selling parts for motorcycles, which are the most used vehicle in the city of Medellín.

The character and work discipline shown by this young woman makes her business run and generate profits which she spends in supporting her child and contributing to her household, but she doesn't want to settle, she dreams of having branches all over Antioquia region. 

To continue strengthening her business and being competitive, Tatiana needs to invest in stock, so she wants to ask for a loan to purchase motorcycle products such as accessories, cleaners, and parts.

Support this young head of household who has shown character and responsibility to get ahead with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle products, such as accessories, cleaners and spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mística se unió para trabajar, y por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza ir mejorando su situación de pobreza, son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan mucho.
La Sra. Andreza integrante de este grupo solicita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de despensa donde además cuenta con la venta de remedios caseros miel y varios comestibles. Ella al igual que las demás integrantes del grupo lucha por poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas. Quiere comprar verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos y otros.
Andreza participa siempre de manera muy activa en las reuniones y capacitaciones del grupo que les hace la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística group got together to work and, through the poverty elimination program, to improve their poverty situation. They are determined and enterprising women who work very hard. 

Andreza, of this group, asks for this loan to invest in her business which is a store where she sells home remedies, honey and various foods. She and the other members struggle to be able to grow and improve their lives. She wants to purchase vegetables, fruits, baked goods, dairy products, and more. 

Andreza always participates actively in the meetings and group training provided by Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, baked goods, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: San Expedito 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por mujeres muy trabajadoras, que están luchando para poder mejorar sus vidas, a través de las capacitaciones y del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Son 15 mujeres muy sacrificadas.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Margarita, una humilde vendedora de carbón, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, ya que el carbón es muy utilizado por ser económico. Margarita comenta que está contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que a través de ello podrá seguir ayudando a su familia y mejorar su pequeño negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very hard-working woman, who are struggling to be able to improve their lives, through training and the poverty elimination program. They are 15 very self-sacrificing women. 

Among them, Margarita stands out, a humble charcoal saleswoman, and she says that her business is going very well for her, since charcoal is used a lot because it is inexpensive. Margarita comments that she is happy to be part of the group since, through it, she will be able to continue helping her family and to improve her small business.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase charcoal in quantity, and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal in quantity to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables.

Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

This is Mary's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret was appraised as an individual client from Buyala, a semi-arid area. She is 33 years old and married with two children.

She deals in the buying and selling of fish at a market in the city outskirts. She does this business to sustain her family but is challenged with limited stock and inadequate working capital.

She’s now looking forward to acquiring a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) in order to stabilize her working capital and stock more fish. This will help her to increase her sales and also profit.

Margaret is a resilient and hard working woman who appreciates the financial boost and Kiva's role in fighting poverty.

loans.use: to boost her fish sale trade

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Una pequeña tienda de abarrotes es la actividad que ha marcado un cambio drástico en la familia de Patricia, quien decidió convertirse en independiente y buscar una solución a los problemas económicos que se presentaban en su hogar.

Ya que Patricia logro regular un poco las condiciones en su casa, se ha permitido soñar, pensar en un proyecto grande, lo que más anhela y desea esta trabajadora mujer de 33 años de edad y madre de una pequeña de 8 años es comprar una vivienda.

Para lograr este gran sueño debe mejorar mucho su negocio, aumentar sus ventas, captar la atención del público, aumentar su inventario y variedad de productos, y a eso es lo que le apunta con un préstamo que esta diligenciando el cual tiene como objetivo surtir su tienda con productos nuevos, en aseo personal, doméstico y abarrotes, pretende tener en su tienda todo lo principal de una lista de mercado.
texts.en:
A small grocery store is the business that has made a drastic change in Patricia's family, who decided to go out on her own and look for a solution to the economic problems that they had in her household.

Since Patricia managed to stabilize the conditions a little in her house, she has allowed herself to dream, to think of large projects. What this hard-working woman, age 33 and mother of an 8-year-old little girl, most desires and wants is to purchase a house. 

To achieve this great dream she needs to improve her business a lot, increase her sales, attract the public's attention, and increase her inventory and the variety of products. For this, she is applying for a loan which she is taking the steps to obtain, which has as its objective to stock her store with new products in personal care, home cleaning, and groceries. She plans to have in her store every basic thing on a shopping list.

loans.use: to stock her store with new products, in personal care, domestic cleaning, and groceries; she plans to have in her store every basic thing on a shopping list.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a risk taker.

Stephen operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a competitive location, and his primary customers are the general public.

Stephen will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to have at least five motorbikes within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will have increased profits. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Solome

texts.en:
Solome is an individual client, aged 25 years and married with three children. She is a resident of Bubezi village and operates a retail shop there. She is a hardworking lady who works 7 days a week, 15 hours per day.

Solome started her retail shop in 2009, but has a challenge of inadequate working capital. Therefore, she’s looking forward to acquiring a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to overcome that problem. She will buy stocks of household use items such as rice, corn flour, bread, cooking oil, and stationary, among other items to sell.

Solome appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Santa Isabel” está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de las integrantes de este grupo están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, quien en su  encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de cubiertos y con su humilde trabajo  se gana la vida de una manera digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cubiertos, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel group is in the poverty elimination program, where each and every one of the members of the group is struggling to improve her life. 

One of the members is Mariela, who in her poverty elimination questionnaire showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say in extreme poverty. She works selling cutlery and with her humble work, she earns her living in a dignified way.

She asks for this loan to purchase cutlery to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase cutlery to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras, es un comité que está iniciando el 1er ciclo con mucha esperanza de que le vaya bien en este emprendimiento. Están iniciando con muchas expectativas.
Claudia es una de las personas que integra este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que viene ganándose la vida por medio de su humilde trabajo el cual es la venta de perfumes y colonias. Ella está luchando y se sacrifica por su familia para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes varios y colonias varias, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben todas de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras is a committee which is beginning its first loan cycle with a lot of hope that this undertaking will go well. They are beginning with a lot of expectations.

Claudia is a one of the people who are members of this group. She is a very hard-working woman, who earns her living through her humble work which is selling perfumes and colognes. She is struggling and self-sacrificing for her family to be able to be someone in life.

She asks for this loan to purchase a variety of perfumes and colognes, and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. They are grateful for the opportunity they are all getting to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of perfume and cologne to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be a risk taker.

Millicent operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Millicent will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will have increased profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Douglas Geovani

texts.es: Douglas de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un comedor ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, también vende frutas y verduras, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Douglas esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frijoles, verduras, frutas, arroz, carnes, pollos, mariscos y de mas ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Douglas, 36 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner. He has had an eatery in his home for the past 5 years, and also sells fruits and vegetables. With the earnings that he gets from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. Douglas is asking for a loan to purchase beans, vegetables, fruits, rice, meat, chicken, seafood, and more ingredients which he uses to to make the dishes and to be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beans, vegetables, fruit, rice, meat, chicken, seafood, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Siprosa

texts.en:
Siprosa is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

Siprosa operates a retail business where she sells bags and clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive location, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Siprosa will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes and bags.

She hopes that in the future, she will have increased profits. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia  de 47 años de edad es madre de 7 hijos tres de los cuales fallecieron y cuatro están  independizados, se dedica desde hace 06 años a la venta de ropa nueva y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Virginia necesita para la comprar ropa como blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. con las ganancias de este préstamo pretende seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y seguir mejorando su condición de vida y espera con esta inversión poder lograrlo.
Doña Virginia uno de sus  sueños es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2015
texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and is a mother of seven. Three of her children passed away and her other four live on their own. For the past six years, she has been selling new clothing in the community of San Lorenzo, where she lives in southern Honduras. 

Virginia needs to purchase clothing like blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, etc. She plans to use the profit she makes from this loan to continue increasing her working capital so that her living conditions continue to improve. She hopes this loan will enable her to achieve her goals, one of which is improving her home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo es como han podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Francisca, 61 year sold, lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With what she gets from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they have managed to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, to have more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: William Alexis

texts.es:
William, de 21 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una planta de gas, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad y en su casa vive su mamá y su hijo.

William, es empleado y tiene dos años de trabajar en la empresa, también se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado, en el negocio se involucra su esposa y su mamá. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más frutas y verduras y para mejorar su vivienda. 

Su sueño es establecer una tienda para tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
William, 21 years old, is partnered. His partner works in a gas factory. He has a 2-year-old child and his mother and his child live in the house.  

William is employed and has been working in the business for two years. He also works selling fruits and vegetables in the market. His partner and his mother are involved in his business.

The loan is needed to purchase more fruits and vegetables and to improve the house. 

His dream is to establish a store to have more income for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and to improve his house.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela, de 67 años de edad, es viuda y vive solo con 2 nietos que desde pequeños cuida.

Angela, se dedica al comercio de comida típica desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, su negocio está a 5 minutos de su casa y trabaja de 2:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos y cerdos para criarlos y luego venderlos y así podrá tener una mejor condición de vida. 

Sus sueños son terminar de construir su casa y también establecer una pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Angela, 67 years old, is a widow and lives just with 2 grandchildren who she has cared for since they were little.

Angela has worked selling traditional food for the past 4 years and also works raising and chickens for meat. Her business is 5 minutes from her house and she works from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm.

The loan is needed to purchase chickens and pigs to raise them and later sell them, and so she will be able to have a better standard of living.

Her dreams are to finish building her house and also to establish a small store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to raise them and later sell them.

loans.name: Herber Antonio

texts.es: Herber de 39 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad. Herber ha tenido una vida muy difícil, es por ello que desde muy joven tuvo que ganarse la vida y antes de cumplir su mayoría de edad ya se desempeña como ayudante de albañil, actualmente y gracias a su experiencia es albañil independiente lo que le permite obtener muy buenos ingresos económicos. Herber desea  mejorar y ampliar el techo del corredor ya que los materiales con los que está construido ya dieron su vida útil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar y ampliar el corredor protegiendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Herber is 39 years old and is a hardworking man. He lives in the house he owns alongside his wife and their two children, who are ages twelve and six.

Herber has had a very hard life and had to start earning a living when he was very young. As a minor, he was already working as a helper in construction. His experience allowed him to become a freelance contractor, which is what he is doing today. His work allows him to make a very good income. 

Herber wants to remodel the veranda in his house. He wants to make it bigger and improve the roof because the original materials have reached the end of their lifespan. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire so that he can carry out the project and protect his family.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to remodel his veranda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market more bread and improve the infrastructure in her house.

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es:
Ana, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, no continuo sus estudios porque sus padres decidieron que mejor trabaja en los oficios de la casa; está casada, su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes con su vehículo, solo una de sus hijas estudia bachillerato, porque las demás trabajan en casa. 

Ana, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 25 años, la necesidad de tener entrada de dinero para aportar a la familia, la llevo a decidirse a esta actividad, también se dedica a la venta de frutas y antes de dedicarse a esta actividad solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar y el horario de la venta de tortillas es de 10:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. y por la tarde prepara la venta de frutas.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y para comprar frutas para el negocio, con este préstamo tendrá siempre materia prima para seguir su negocio. 

Los sueños de Ana son, tener más y mejores ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos y apoyar a su hija para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and has a third grade education. She dropped out of school because her parents decided it was best for her to work in the home. She is married and her husband works as a driver. One of her daughters is attending high school and the others work at home.

Ana has been working making and selling tortillas for 25 years. Before that she only worked at home, but she wanted to make an income in order to contribute to her household, so she decided to start her own business. She also sells fruit. She sells tortillas from 10:00 am to 2:00 pm and in the evenings she sets up her fruit stand.

She needs this loan to buy corn for making the tortillas, as well as fruit for her business. This loan will allow her to always have enough ingredients to keep the business going.

Ana's goal is to make more and better income so that she can provide for her children and support her daughter so that she keeps on studying.

loans.use: to buy corn and fruit.

loans.name: Jui Sellers Group

texts.en:
Musu is a 35-year-old businesswoman and a member of Jui solidarity group. Jui solidarity group has five members--three women and two men.  Musu sells palm oil.  Musu has been in this business for the past four years.  She operates her business six days a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. 

Musu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.  See Musu (in the middle of the group picture).

Musu and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL, of which Musu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. She will use the loan to buy 40 rubbers of palm oil for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Musu is married and has four schoolgoing children. In the future, Musu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes that educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. Musu will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy 40 rubbers of palm oil for her business

loans.name: Jhonaiser

texts.es: Jhonaiser de 36 años en su día a día, recorre las calles de diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla, ofreciendo a las amas de casa pescado, aguacates y limones o frutas que se encuentren en cosecha.  Este emprendedor comerciante cuenta con diez años en este ámbito y también ofrece servicios como obrero de construcción.  Con la finalidad de surtir su negocio y responder oportunamente a sus clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar pescado y aguacates.  Jhonaiser es padre de dos hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar, lo cual es su principal motivación para continuar laborando comprometido y dedicado. Su meta a futuro es tener un local comercial y adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en: Jhonaiser is 36 years old. Day after day, he traverses the streets of different neighborhoods in the town of Barranquilla, offering the housewives fish, avocados and limes or fruits that are in season. This commercial entrepreneur has 10 years experience in this field and also works as a construction worker. In order to supply his business and respond to his customers in a timely manner, he is asking for his first CrediKiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fish and avocados. Jhonaiser is the father of two children whom he offers comfort to, which is his main motivation to continue working, committed and dedicated. His future goal is to have a commercial store and get his own home.

loans.use: to buy fish and avocados.

loans.name: San Miguel 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder crecer saliente.
Una de las Sras. Zulma quien a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de verduras que hace, se viene ganando la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Zulma  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras como lechugas, locotes, cebolla entre otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named San Miguel (Saint Micheal) is in its first program cycle of its women's committee.  They are from the city of Ita, where they all work and help each other get ahead.  They are doing an investigation on eliminating poverty, to be able to continue growing in the future.

One of the women, Zulma, who through effort and hard work continues with her business selling vegetables, goes on earning a living in a dignified and honest way.  She is a very determined woman who wants to get ahead and it is for that reason that she gives all of her effort.  

Zulma is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables like lettuce, squash, and onions among other vegetables, helping her to have a concrete business plan, which will help her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase lettuce, squash, onions, among other vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee, toothpaste, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, noodles, eggs, bath soap and gasoline

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Nueva Esperanza ya que ellas tienen la esperanza para poder mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Lidia, integrante de este grupo solicita de este préstamo para invertir en su negocio de elaboración de manufacturas de karanday. 
Ella hace artesanías en Karanday desde su casa y con ese pequeño negocio que tiene se gana la vida de una manera digna.
texts.en:
This group is called Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) because all of them have the hope of being able to improve their lives. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where two women find themselves below the poverty line, i.e. extreme poverty. 

Lidia is a member of this group and is asking for this loan to invest into her business making karanday (a plant native to Paraguay) articles. She makes crafts from karanday in her house, and with this small business that she has, she makes a living in a dignified manner.

loans.use: to buy karanday to make crafts.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, con los créditos mantiene la continuidad de su negocio, ofrece nuevas especialidades de pupusas, da un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y sus ingresos han incrementado, su familia tiene el sustento diario y todos se encuentran saludables.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar ingredientes como quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas le permitirán seguir creciendo con su negocio y ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María has been using her loans to keep her business going. She is offering new types of pupusas and providing better service to her customers. Her income has increased, she is supporting her family, and they are all in good health.

She is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients for making pupusas, such as cheese, pork rids, oil, etc. Her sales will allow her business to keep growing and providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cheese, pork rinds, oil, etc.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en: Livingstone is a married man with three children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells vegetables and fruits. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. He hopes that in the future he will have a comfortable life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
The group Yehowa No is composed of two people who live in the same district and are into cassava, plantains, rice, cooking oil, fish, jags, wine glasses, plates and drinks. The group’s representative, Christiana, is 42 years old and single with two children. She lives together with her children. 

Christiana alone ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling foodstuff like cassava, plantains, rice, cooking oil and fish at her residence for 19 years. She gets her goods from the wholesale market and sells to customers. With the goal of bolstering her business, Christiana and the other members are requesting a ninth loan from ID-Ghana. They promise to repay this loan duly and promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cassava, plantains, rice, cooking oil and fish which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María, de 39 años de edad, no estudio, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y tiene dos hijos.

María, siempre ha trabajado con ganado y en la agricultura, específicamente siembra yuca y maíz, pero también vende frutas y verduras en el mercado.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and never went to school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have two children. 

María has always worked with livestock and agriculture, more specifically cultivating yuca and corn, but also sells fruits and vegetables in the market. 

She needs this loan to buy livestock. 

She dreams that her children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and buy a cow. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and buy a cow

loans.name: Indahemuka Group

texts.en: Donatila is a group leader and is 47 years old. She is married with six children aged between 9 and 20 years old, all of whom go to school. The group is called Indahemuka, which means Great People in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to improve their future. She owns a bar and has been running a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and wine to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beer and wine to sell.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey grows vegetables in greenhouses. Due to the previous loans he increased the income and bought a truck. Andrey is an active and hardworking young man. He wants to develop his business further. Business expenses have grown more than Andrey expected. At the same time produce prices did not grow that much. Even though Andrey received less profit he is thankful he can continue taking care of his family. 

Andrey is asking for a loan of 60,000 UAH to buy fertilizers, film cover and seeds for greenhouses. Andrey wants to get ready to start the new season and get a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, film cover and seeds for greenhouses

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is in the printing business and has been in this line of work for three years. He would like to have his own business because he is living with his parents. Jose needs a loan to buy a computer that he will use for graphic design. That will be his first step to becoming an independent man. Jose is healthy; he works hard and he also helps his parents.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Brayan Ismael

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive con su madre y sus hermanos, con los cuales se lleva muy bien, en su hogar existe un buen ambiente familiar.
Vive en Antonio Ante, cerca de su domicilio está ubicada la fábrica Imbabura que es un lugar muy reconocido y visitado por turistas, además esta ciudad es conocida también por su gastronomía típica el plato más conocido es la fritada.
Brayan trabaja en Chefarina desde hace 1 año aproximadamente, él apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar, cada semana realiza compras y además paga cada mes de agua y luz. Tiene experiencia en el negocio de producción de sacos de lana ya que cuando su madre tenía el taller él le ayudaba  y lo hacía desde que tenía 15 años. Es por eso que desea iniciar nuevamente con este negocio, solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima y una plancha vaporizadora a gas. En el negocio le va ayudar su madre, que también tiene experiencia en la elaboración de sacos de lana, luego ellos realizaran la venta en la ciudad de Quito, en locales de venta de sacos de lana. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Brayan is a young entrepreneur. He is 19 years old, single and does not have any children. He lives with his mother and his brothers, who he gets along with very well. There is a good family atmosphere in his home. He lives in Antonio Ante. Close to his home is the Imbabura factory, which is a well-known and visited place by tourists. This city is also known for its traditional gastronomy. The most familiar dish is Fritada. 

Brayan has worked at Chefarina for approximately 1 year. He has experience in the business of wool coat production, because when his mother had a workshop, he helped her from the time he was 15 years old. For that reason, he wants to start up this business again. He is asking for a loan to invest into buying raw material and a gas steaming iron. In the business, his mother is going to help him because she also has experience making wool coats. They will later make sales in the city of Quito, in stores that sell wool coats. He thanks Kiva for the provided help.

loans.use: to buy raw material and a steaming iron. With these earnings, he will be able to help with his brother's schooling.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a married man and the father of two kids. Noel is a locksmith and works at a workshop. He needs a loan to pay for a medical treatment for his eyes because his job caused him a little injury. He hopes you can help him because he is the only person supporting his family. Noel pays the rent and he works a lot.

loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment

loans.name: Norma Cristina

texts.es:
Norma, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo que está estudiando bachillerato, en casa viven 2 personas  más, una nieta de ella y un bisnieto. 

Norma, tiene una tienda desde hace más de 15 años y ha sido la fuente con la cual ha sacado a delante a su familia, la tienda está en su propia casa, su hijo le ayuda a atender cuando ella no está.

Norma, necesita el préstamo para comprar  jabón, azúcar, aceite, maíz, frijoles, entre otros productos para la tienda.- El préstamo le ayudara a tener más mercadería para la venta, por lo tanto mejorara sus ingresos y podrá cubrir las necesidades que tienen como familia.

Los sueños de Norma, son tener bien surtida la tienda y sueña con que sus hijos logren terminar sus estudios, para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old and has a sixth grade education. She is a single mother, and her son is in high school. She lives with two more people: her granddaughter and great-grandson.

Norma has been running her store for over fifteen years. It has been the means by which she has been able to provide for her family. It is set up in her home and her son helps the customers when she is out.

Norma needs this loan to buy soap, sugar, oil, corn, beans, and other products for her store. This loan will help her stock up on merchandise, which in turn will boost her sales. Her income will increase and she will be able to give her family what they need.

Norma's goal is to have a well-stocked store. Her dream is for her children to manage to finish school and earn a degree.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, oil, corn, beans, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Libardo

texts.es:
Libardo ha sido  caficultor desde hace 10 años y está certificado como productor orgánico en FCC. Él vive con su esposa e  hijo. Para fortalecer la producción de café certificado orgánico Libardo necesita comprar fertilizantes orgánicos y sembrar 2500 árboles más de café, para cumplir esta meta el necesita ($ 7.500.0000) siete millones quinientos mil pesos, este préstamo le permitirá a Libardo mejorar la calidad y producción del café. Libardo sueña con hacer de su finca una agro empresa sostenible que sirva de ejemplo a la comunidad para que cada día sean más los productores orgánicos. A nivel personal desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, generar empleo dentro de su comunidad y generar conciencia dentro de los productores sobre la producción orgánica y los beneficios para el medio ambiente 

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y  Libardo ha decidido no arriesgar más su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Libardo has been a coffee grower for ten years and is a certified FCC organic producer. He lives with his wife and child. To strengthen the production of certified organic coffee Libardo needs to buy organic fertilizers and plant 2500 more coffee trees. To meet this goal he needs $7,500.000 COP (seven million five hundred thousand COP). This loan will permit Libardo to improve the quality and production of the coffee.

Libardo dreams of making his farm a sustainable agro business that serves as an example to the community so that each day there might be more organic producers. On a personal level he wants to improve the quality of life for his family, create jobs within the community and raise farmer awareness about organic production and the benefits for the environment. 

The conversion and production of organic coffee is a comprehensive process, long term, independent, healthy, balanced and friendly to the environment that represents a challenge for farmers from Colombia. Libardo has decided not to risk his health or that of his family or the consumers by continuing to use chemicals. FCC is convinced that it is worth supporting and strengthening these alternative initiatives. A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for his production, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to grow organic coffee

loans.name: Kufekisa

texts.en:
Eagle Nest School was registered in 2014 after an initial introduction of house tuition and coaching for children in primary school started by Kufekisa. Through her school, Kufekisa is providing education to children in her community with a focus on inclusive learning and an integrated school curriculum. This has also made her enthusiastic about helping to develop the potential of disabled and handicapped children as well as vulnerable children that are stigmatized and victimized due to various physical, health and socio-economic setbacks and otherwise would not have equal opportunities to receive an education.

Kufekisa believes the name of the school is meant to signify the child’s need to build their skills and soar to achieve their dreams, just as an eagle flies high and builds a nest in the highest place for security. Flying high as the eagle does is a focal point to instill a vigor in the children to seek high results in everything they do and develop characteristics just like the strong eagle’s instincts.

The aim of Eagle’s Nest is to provide a quality diverse education and vocational training to their children so that they advance to their highest level of achievement in life. 

Eagle’s requests a loan to purchase ICT educational resources to assist in their contribution to providing the diverse quality education that they strive for to the children at the school using modern education technology in the form of the ZEduPad. The ZEduPad is a revolutionary e-learning educational tablet designed for children that has preloaded content mapped to the Zambian Primary School curriculum. This educational tablet is now being used in schools throughout Zambia and many parts of Africa.

loans.use: To purchase ZEduPads for the children in her school. These are ICT educational resources that will assist in her effort to provide a diverse quality education.

loans.name: Juliya

texts.en:
Juliya is married and has two children. She has her own business. 

Juliya grows cucumbers and tomatoes in greenhouses. She has seven heated greenhouses. Juliya is a good housewife and mother. Together with her husband she plans to build a bigger house for their family.

Juliya is asking for loan of 60,000 UAH to build a new greenhouse. This year the prices for materials have increased a lot. The loan will help Juliya to buy all the materials to build a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 31 years old. She is a divorced woman and she takes care of a daughter. She pays rent and she attends a grocery store in her neighborhood. She works from Monday to Saturday. She principally sells milk, cookies and soft drinks. She needs a loan to increase her stock at her grocery store. Regina hopes you can help her. Regina is the only one that supports her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock at her grocery store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is  a married man. He is father of two kids and he works as a schoolteacher. He made a great effort and he is the owner of his house. Jose needs a loan to pay for construction work at his house. Jose hopes you can help him because he is the only person supporting his family. Jose works hard.

loans.use: to pay for construction work at his house

loans.name: Rosa Exhela

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa Exhela de 52 años de edad es casada,  tiene un  hijo  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace unos 19  años  a la venta de tortillas, leña y pescado seco, sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención.
Doña Rosa Exhela  vende las tortillas de  lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que ha salido adelante a través de este pequeño negocio, también se dedica a la venta de mariscos con el apoyo de su esposo porque el sale al mar en su lancha pesquera y le trae el producto para después venderlo.
Doña Rosa Exhela  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña, cal que son la materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento. Su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Exhela is 52 years old, married, and has a dependent son. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo to the south of Honduras, and has her own home. She has been making a living for around 19 years as a seller of tortillas, firewood, and dried fish. Her customers prefer her for her good service.

Doña Rosa Exhela sells tortillas from Monday to Sunday. She is a hardworking woman that has gotten ahead through this small business. Also, she makes a living selling seafood with the support of her husband because he goes out to sea in his fishing boat and brings back product afterwards for sale.

Doña Rosa Exhela is requesting the loan in order to purchase corn, firewood, and lime, which are the raw materials for making the tortillas. With the support of this loan, she aims to meet her financing needs. Her dream is to continue to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Hans

texts.en:
Hans has been a taxi driver in San Diego since 2013. He is originally from Amsterdam and came to the United States in 1970. After working in hospitality for many years, Hans recently decided to leave the hotel industry to drive a taxi cab with his wife.

As a taxi driver in San Diego, Hans has been paying high monthly lease payments to a cab company for the vehicle he drives. Due to a recent policy change, local taxi drivers like Hans are now able to operate and own their taxis through the release of taxi cab medallions for purchase. 

Now that Hans can own and operate his own taxi, he is in need of financing to purchase a vehicle. He will use his $5,000 Kiva loan for a down payment on a hybrid car. This down payment will make his monthly vehicle payments manageable and contribute to the success of his new venture.

loans.use: to pay for the down payment of a new taxi cab

loans.name: Janet Araceli

texts.en: Janet is a 25-year-old woman who is single and has no children or economic dependents. She lives with her family and makes a living by working for a cookie factory. She is asking for 5,000 MXN (five thousand pesos) in order to make improvements to a room in her house.

loans.use: To make improvements in her house

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se está preparando para sembrar maíz, no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para realizar de manera inmediata sus trabajos, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semilla, herbicidas e insecticidas, limpiara el terreno de la maleza y dará un buen desarrollo a su cultivo.
Con los financiamientos ha ido mejorando la producción de sus cultivos, sus nuevos ingresos le dan oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida más confortable y además puede ir disminuyendo su nivel de endeudamiento.
texts.en: José is getting ready to plant corn. He does not have the necessary materials to immediately perform his jobs. He sees a need to ask for a new loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides and insecticides. He will clear the soil of weeds and give his crops good development. With the loans, he has been improving the production of his crops. His new income gives him the opportunity to give his family a more comfortable life and he can also decrease his debt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides and insecticides. He will clear the soil of weeds and give his crops good development.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. Yahaya joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Yahaya has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize. With increased yields and income, Yahaya has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kiyawa Village. Dahiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Dahiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dahiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad.   

Elena, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace cuatro años, la necesidad de obtener dinero para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos la llevo a trabajar se esta manera, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, antes de dedicarse a eso, trabajaba como empleada doméstica en casa, la venta de tortillas la tiene en la casa y una hija le ayuda a vender.

El préstamo será para comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de las tortillas, la mejora que el préstamo hará, es que pueda continuar trabajando con su venta y no se estanque con el ingresos de dinero.

Los sueños de Elena son, poder fortalecer su negocio de ropa y tener empleadas que trabajen en la venta de tortillas.
texts.en: Elena, who is 38 years old, studied until fourth grade.  She is a single mother and has 4 children, ages 18,15, and 12 years old.  Elena has worked preparing and selling tortillas for four years.  The need to earn extra money to cover her children's needs caused her to work in this capacity, but she also works selling clothes.  Before this she worked as a domestic employee at home.  She sells tortillas from home and her daughter helps her sell.  The loan will be used to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas. The improvement that the loan will make possible is that she can continue working in sales and not stagnate with her income. Elena's dreams are to be able to strengthen her clothing business and to have employees who work selling her tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to prepare tortillas.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Doña Wendy se dedica a la venta de ropa en su propia casa , ella necesita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (₡ 600 000), esto para poder comprar más prendas, que le permitirán ofrecer más cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Doña Wendy works selling clothing out of her house. She needs a loan of six hundred thousand colones (₡ 600,000) to be able to purchase additional apparel, which will allow her to offer a higher quantity and wider variety to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: María Betina

texts.es: María Betina trabaja en su propia granja, en la cual  desarrolla la actividad de pollos de engorde, ella solicita un préstamo de seiscientos veinticinco mil colones (₡ 625 000), este dinero será utilizado en la compra de pollos, esto con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: María Betina works on her own farm, where she raises broiler chickens.  She is requesting a loan of six hundred twenty-five colones (₡ 625 000) and she will use this money to purchase broiler chickens, with the goal of growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chickens.

loans.name: Wagner Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es un hombre ecuatoriano de 52 años, nacido en la ciudad de Pujili ciudad de Cotopaxi provincia de Ecuador. Está casado con María, ella tiene 48 años y es maestra hace  27 años, juntos han formado una familia feliz. El y su familia viven en Pujili en casa propia. Desde muy pequeño ha sido muy trabajador por el mismo hecho que la situación económica de su hogar no era muy buena, salía a trabajar con sus padres, y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo terminar la primaria por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios. 
A pesar de ser chofer profesional y tener la ayuda de su esposa con los gastos económicos, sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir todos sus gastos por esto Flavio ha buscado otro trabajo que es la crianza de animales especialmente de cerdos. Pero para empezar este negocio Flavio necesita de capital para poder comprar los cerdos, con este nuevo negocio el trabaría todos los días. Flavio es una persona luchadora y  un padre responsable por esto no le importa trabajar todos los días con el fin de que su hijo pueda estudiar y algún día convertirse en un profesional para así mejorar su estilo de vida.  Con este préstamo espera que la situación económica de su familia mejore.
Flavio  agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Flavio is an Ecuadorian man, age 52. He was born in the city of Pujilí, in Cotopaxi Province, Ecuador.  He is married to María, who is 48 years old, and has been a teacher for 27 years. Together they have formed a happy family, and they live in their own house in Pujilí. 

He has been very hardworking ever since he was very young. Because the financial situation in his home was not very good, he went out to work with his parents. With great effort and sacrifice, he was able to finish primary school, but he could not continue his studies because of the lack of financial resources.

In spite of being a professional driver, and having the help of his wife with the expenses, his income is not sufficient to cover all of the expenses. For this reason, Flavio has sought other work raising animals, especially pigs. In order to start this business, Flavio needs capital to be able to purchase the pigs, and he would work at this business every day. Flavio is a person with a fighting spirit, and he is a responsible father. For this reason, he doesn't mind working every day so that his son may be able to study and become a professional someday, in order to improve his lifestyle. With this loan, he hopes that his family’s economic situation may improve.

Flavio thanks Kiva for making it possible to grow in his working and personal life.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to capitalize his business, so that he can offer his son an education.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Salamatu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay her children's schools fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see her increase her income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. Joshua joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Joshua suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Joshua will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Joshua now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Liseth Yasmin

texts.es:
Liseth, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales viven con ella y uno de ellos estudia educación básica.

Liseth, tiene una tienda desde hace 2 años, ella es una mujer emprendedora, que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, porque no estudio mucho y no le ha permitido encontrar otro trabajo que le ayude a sacar a su familia adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.- En este negocio se involucra un tía de ella, que le colabora en la venta cuando ella no está en casa o tiene que ir a comprar la mercadería.  

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar jabón, azúcar, arroz, café, gaseosa, etc. para la tienda, esto le permitirá mejorar las ventas, ya que la tienda está en la parte céntrica del cantón.

Liseth, sueña con tener un puesto de venta bien surtido, donde la gente busque lo que necesite, para su familia desea que sus hijos estudien y un día se puedan graduar de una cerrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Liseth is 26 years old and has a ninth grade education.  She is a single mother and has 2 children, who live with her and one of them is in elementary school.  

Liseth has had a store for 2 years.  She is an enterprising woman who decided to start this business because she wasn't able to study much and hasn't been able to find another job that would help her family get ahead.  It is for this reason she decided to open a general store.  In this business, her aunt has been very involved and has helped her with sales when she's not home or has to go purchase merchandise.

She needs this loan to purchase soap, sugar, rice, coffee, soda, etc. for her store.  This will allow her to improve her sales, since the store is in a central location of her town.

Liseth dreams of having a well stocked store, where people look for what they need.  For her family, she hopes that her children continue studying and one day can graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, rice, coffee, soda, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen  de 63  años de edad es casada vive con su esposo, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella y vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 11 años  a la venta de golosinas como: tacos y tajaditas de plátano, etc.
Doña María del Carmen su actividad la realiza en su casa y también de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, personas que la conocen y los que pasan por su casa, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña María del Carmen está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de leña, aceites, huevos, plátanos verde, carnes, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 63 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband.  She doesn't have children who depend on her and she lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in southern Honduras.  She has her own home and she has worked for 11 years selling food like tacos and plantain snacks, etc.  María del Carmen works from her home and also travels selling her food.  Her customers are friends, people she knows and those who pass by her house.  She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead.  María del Carmen is requesting this loan to purchase firewood, oil, eggs, green plantains, meat, etc. for her business.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to help her family get ahead.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, oil, eggs, green plantains, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ledgie

texts.en: At the early age of 23, Ledgie has one child to provide for. Her husband is a driver and can't fully take care of their needs because of the small income he earns. Ledgie decided to help her husband earn money to support the needs of her child. She is now engaged in a piggery business, raising pigs and selling them to the market. Ledgie took out a loan to buy feed for the pigs so that she can produce a good quality of pigs and supply her customers' demand, which will result in a greater income. Ledgie's plan for the future is to save money to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has been selling her prepared food in the street for many years. His husband is a laborer and can't fully provide for the family's needs, especially the educational needs of his 8 children. Lucia helps her husband by using her talents in the field of cooking. She cooks her delicious recipes and sells the food to her customers. 

Lucia has earned well from her business and has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for the business. Lucia was determined enough in sustaining her business. She recently took out a new loan to purchase ingredients for her new recipe. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the educational plans of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Siha

texts.en:
Siha, 25 years old, is a lovely father of one little child. He lives in a small community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Siha has been working as a construction worker since 2010. On average, he is able to make an income of US $6 per day. 

Siha is living in an old house and he wants to build a comfortable one for his family. Since his budget is small, he is now applying for a KIVA loan, through HKL, to buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, he hopes he can experience living in a comfortable house. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has been earning for 15 years by using her skills in making the nails of her customer beautiful and clean. This is the business she's working with, for providing for the daily needs of her children.

She gained more from the business; that's why she was able to repay her previous loan that she used in the business. She is a strong-minded person in maintaining her business more profitably.

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more equipment and beauty products to provide for and get the satisfaction of her customers for the services she offers. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and beauty products such as Cutex.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is being offered to Octavia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. Octavia will use the loan to buy some additional supplies such as rice, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, body lotion, oil, biscuits, beer and slippers. She has been involved in business activities since 2011. Octavia feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Octavia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, body lotion, oil, biscuits, beer and slippers

loans.name: Sarern

texts.en:
Sarern, 35, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has four children.

To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sugar cane and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market.

So far, she has been in this business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Pascuela

texts.en:
Pascuela is 29 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital.

She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000.

She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, candles, eggs, coffee, water, slippers, and traditional clothes.

She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, candles, eggs, coffee, water, slippers, and traditional clothes.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Her name is Maricel, 42 years old, resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a factory worker, and has four children. Living in a third world country is a struggle for most Filipinos. Parents find ways and means to meet even the most basic needs such as food and shelter. 

To help her husband make a living, Maricel went into direct selling of personal products. She buys beauty products such as lotion, whitening cream, shampoo, conditioner and body powder, toothpaste and clothing, etc. to sell directly to her customers. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries and undergarments. She has to meet the advance orders of her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking you in advance for your support. Her earnings help send her children to school and fund their daily needs.

Maricel dreams to have her own store to display her products. Her precious dream is to see all her children finish school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her direct selling of personal products such as beauty and toiletries products.

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
Living in an area frequently visited by typhoons is not that easy, especially if the sea serves as the source of family income. Tigbauan, Iloilo has a bordering sea on one side that provides a lot of benefits to the people in the community. But in November 2013 the area was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan, a super typhoon that’s famous for its ruthless wrath. Rubylyn, her fisherman husband Bobbie, and their two children were lucky to survive the harsh calamity with the grace of God. 

Rubylyn owns a fishing boat and several fishing nets. There was a time after the typhoon that these became useless due to severe damage in the sea. It was after several weeks when her husband was able to go fishing again and she had another chance to sell fish in the market. Since then their livelihood continues to stabilize but their fishing boat deteriorates as time passes by. She hopes to repair it as soon as possible. This is why she humbly requests a PHP 10,000 loan for this purpose. Aside from this, she plans to buy fish from other fishermen in order to enhance her fish selling business. Her experience during Haiyan further strengthens her resolve to boost her income and save more. She plans to acquire another fishing boat in the near future. She would like to ensure that her children will finish their schooling and gain a stable career. She’s hoping that you would be an instrument to achieve her goals. 

Rubylyn is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
The sacks in the photo contain dried fermented small shrimp known as “alamang” or “bagoong” in the Philippines. They are used as a major cooking ingredient or as a topping on green mangoes, turnips or steamed vegetables. This is the kind of business that Vilma operates in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She buys small shrimp in high volume, ferments and dries them, and prepares them for export or local selling. Her husband, Lucio, sells fish in the market. Together, they work hard to provide for the needs of their family of five children (two of them studying in college). 

Vilma’s entrepreneurial spirit drives her to further improve her business. It’s her desire to put up another processing area in another town. Another step to reach her goal is to take out a 15,000 Philippine peso loan that she can use to purchase a high volume of shrimp. This additional capital will bring her more earnings, which she can use for her family’s everyday expenses. She can also save some money for her children’s education. It’s Vilma’s dream to see her children finish their studies and have a brighter future. 

Vilma meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase a high volume of shrimp

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 49, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has six children in total; four are single and two are married.

To make a living and support her family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crops to the local dealers and customers in the market. Beside this, she also raises pigs for sale. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 10.00 a day.

So far, she has been being as a farmer for around twenty years. To accelerate her farming process, she wants to buy cows to help in plowing the land and carry many heavy farming materials. Because there is insufficient money, she would like to apply for KIVA loan via HKL to buy the cows.

She hopes that the support from this loan can help to process her farming faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman, 38 years old and has four children to provide for. She promptly put up a small sari-sari store in the front of her house. Despite the small income she earns, it brought daily income which is just what the family needed. She wants to improve the living conditions they have, and another opportunity that presented itself is to borrow a loan for buying more goods to sell to earn more, and for the benefit of her children in sending them to school.
 
Irene’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and for the education of her children when they reach college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Ma. Elena Marlyn from Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato. She is married to Nilo, a welder, and they have three children.

Ma. Elena Marlyn runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells various commodities like canned goods, repacked condiments, sachets of toiletries, packs of spices, candies, snack items, and many others. Her income from this business can help provide for her family's everyday needs but the stiff competition destabilizes her profits. She dreams of expanding her business, and she has already made the first step by adding frozen goods such as chorizo and dressed chicken to her inventory. But she still needs additional supplies in her variety store so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer to buy from a store with wide selections. She is determined to work towards converting her store into a grocery store someday. 

Ma. Elena Marlyn knocks at your kind hearts for assistance with a loan of PHP 20,000, which she can use as additional capital for her enterprise. She has already availed herself of several loans from CCT Credit Cooperative, and she has been faithful in repaying them. She aspires to be financially and spiritually strong; that’s why she meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her variety store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a strong and loving single mother who has spent much of her life caring for her family, and she also has managed to raise her daughter on her own, while working full time as a registered nurse for the past 30 years.

Elizabeth inherited her mother’s home, and is determined to keep it in her family. Raising a child and dealing with her mother’s illness and final expenses, on one income and as a single mother, caused Elizabeth’s credit to be damaged, making it impossible for her to obtain reasonable financing to replace her air conditioning unit.

Currently Elizabeth and her daughter, who suffers from multiple medical issues that are exacerbated by the high temperatures in their home, are in need of a new air conditioning unit as they are experiencing record high temperatures in the area.

Elizabeth is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her obtain an affordable loan with small payments within her budget that will allow her to install a new unit in her home. Although Elizabeth may have suffered financial distress, she is proud to share that she has never defaulted on a loan.

Elizabeth will improve her quality of life and the overall living conditions for her daughter with this Kiva loan. She will also attend the required credit counseling seminars so that she can use the Kiva loan to rebuild her credit history.

loans.use: improve her quality of life and the overall health conditions for her daughter by installing a new air conditioner in her home.

loans.name: Sounlongnoma Group

texts.fr: Djénéba est âgée de 46 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants. Vendeuses depuis des années, elle vend du divers (plats, chaussures). Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : la simplicité, l’accueil chaleureux des clients, le prix abordable et la qualité de sa marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 350 000 de sa marchandise. L’utilité du prêt de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire sa clientèle afin d’avoir un bénéfice. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 6 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Djénéba, aged 46, is a married mother of six children. A retailer for years, she sells a variety of goods (plates, shoes). What drives her business:  a plain approach, warmly welcoming her customers, affordable prices, and quality merchandise. 

Djénéba wants the loan to purchase 350,000 francs’ worth of merchandise. The loan is for stocking up with sufficient amounts of goods to satisfy her customer, so as to make a profit. She has already had six loans that were paid back as planned.

loans.use: to purchase her merchandise (plates ...)

loans.name: Nema Group
