texts.fr: Portio, âgée de 38 ans, mariée mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés dont son mari est un charpentier. Elle exerce le commerce depuis 15 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : son expérience, l’accueil et le respect des clients. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 125 000 de diverses marchandises (condiments et savon) en quantité suffisante. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux bonne dates.
texts.en:
Portio, aged 38, is a married mother of two children, both in school. Her husband is a carpenter. She has had a business for fifteen years. What drives her business: her experience, accommodations, and respect for her customers. 

Portio wants the loan to purchase 125,000 francs’ worth of variety of goods (food and soap) in sufficient amounts. The loan is for stocking up, so as to bolster her business. She has already had two loans before that were paid back on time.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods (food, soap) in quantity

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy and she's a sari-sari (variety) store owner in Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato. She's been running her store for 15 years already. Managing a business that long, she has experienced different circumstances that have really tested her faith. There were times when her capital was almost drained due to huge collectibles. Some of her neighbors pay weeks or months later for the goods they get from her store. But Daisy remained strong, because this is her way of assisting her husband, Wilfredo, a welder, in providing for their children’s needs.

Her sari-sari store is comparable to a convenience store, but it’s smaller and has limited products commonly used by an individual everyday. It’s quite advantageous for the people in the community to have an accessible variety store to buy one candy, an egg, and so on. This is the reason why sari-sari stores proliferate in the communities of the Philippines. This is also the reason why the competition becomes stiffer and stiffer. Store owners like Daisy continuously strive to make their business competitive. On her part, Daisy chose to add fruits and vegetables to her inventory in the hope that it can entice more customers. Moreover, she plans to expand the selection in her store. She appeals for your help through a loan worth PHP 40,000, which she can use to buy sacks of rice, grocery items, soft drinks and other beverages. With these, she can improve her sales and earnings. 

Daisy’s praying for a better life for her whole family. She wants her children to finish college and obtain good and stable jobs in the near future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice, grocery items, soft drinks and other beverages.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is a 53-year-old widowed mother with three grown-up children. She lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns some income from cultivating rice and has been in this work for over 35 years. All of her children are factory workers. Sopheap and her children can earn around $6 per day. Sopheap is lacking the money to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy a motorcycle for her children for better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to buy more cows and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Abigail suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, she has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Abigail can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Améyovi

texts.fr: Améyovi est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans habitant à Tokoin. Mère d’un enfant, Améyovi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qu’elle achète au marché et le revend à domicile. Améyovi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin d’en tirer profit et pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en: Améyovi is a married woman, 39 years old, living in Tokoin. A mother of one child, she is a retailer of charcoal, which she buys at the market and resells at her home. Améyovi needs this loan to order sacks of charcoal, so as to make a profit and be able to cover her child’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. He joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yakubu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This season Yakubu has grand plans to harvest 55 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yakubu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Victoria suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to purchase better inputs to improve her yield. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Victoria has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Victoria can now ensure that her children get a postsecondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Jessie is 48 years old, married, and has 1 child to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband (who is a driver) in providing for their family, she has engaged in banana production. She plants bananas and sells in the market. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays, so she decided to borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm so that she can produce a good quality of bananas and can deliver more bananas in the market that will generate more income. Jessie plans in the future to save money out of her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof of the hallway and protect her family from the rain.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla tiene una granja de pollos de engorde, ella necesita un préstamo de ciento ochenta mil colones (₡ 180 000), para la compra de pollos, esto con el fin de aumentar el número de animales y de esta manera lograr aumentar el volumen de ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla has a broiler chicken farm. 

She needs a loan of 180,0000 colones to buy chickens in order to increase the number of animals. This way, she will manage to increase the sales volume of her business.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chickens.

loans.name: Cheyenne

texts.en:
Cheyenne is 24 years old and single with one child. Cheyenne works very hard to provide for them.

Cheyenne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo and other personal care products.

Cheyenne has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purhcase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo and other presonal care products

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 50 years old and married with three children, one child still in school, Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

Pinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Pinky has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saratu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Saratu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old and has five children. Lucia is married and has one child still in school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta hopes that her variety store will improve, thus she exerts her best effort to make it stable. She lives in Davao City together with her husband Rolando and their children. They are living in a community where people are quite familiar with each other. Therefore Julieta finds it difficult to refuse her neighbors who pay late for the goods they get from her store. This practice shakes the stability of her business. It’s one of the reasons why she also ventured into the direct-selling business to augment her family’s usual expenses. She goes house to house to offer personal and hygiene products.

Lately, her store became inaccessible to consumers because the canal bridge that connects their house to the main street was broken. She also finds it difficult to bring direct-selling products to her neighbors and friends due to the steep canal. She is requesting PHP 20,000 of additional capital mainly to buy additional merchandise for her store and more items for her direct-selling business. She will also use part of the loan to repair the broken bridge so that her customers can buy from her store again. She has to sustain not only her family's everyday needs but also her child’s college expenses. In a year or two, she will be relieved of huge educational expenses and her dream to enjoy a little comfort in life will come true.

Julieta is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
In the photo, Choem, aged 35, is on the right, and his wife, Sochan, aged 27, is on the left. The couple lives in a small community in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Choem is the father of two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice, which he sells to the local dealers. So far, Choem has been in this type of business for around 10 years. On average, he is able to earn an income of 2.00 USD a day.

Choem wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is currently no latrine in his house. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, Choem can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Choem is thankful for the loan granted through HKL which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cristian Gregorio

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre muy trabajador, es soltero, tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa familiar con su madre y su hermano que estudia en un colegio fiscal y es el último de sus hermanos 
Es maestro albañil, y viene realizando este oficio desde hace algunos años, es la fuente de ingresos económicos para su hogar, él apoya a su madre con los gastos. Su madre se dedica a la crianza de pollos, patos y gansos que después sale a venderlos en las ferias de la localidad. El año pasado Cristian siguió un curso de instalación de cocinas de inducción en el SECAP y desde entonces ha ido adquiriendo experiencia instalando cocinas de inducción, por lo que quiere iniciar con su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios a personas particulares y en la empresa eléctrica EMELNORTE.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de alambre, breakers, una amoladora, un juego de desarmadores y una escalera pata de gallo y otros materiales necesarios para sus emprendimiento. 
Vive en Gangotena, en la zona las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales a la agricultura y a la albañilería, Gangotena pertenece a la parroquia de Chaltura que es un lugar muy conocido por la venta de cuy asado un plato típico del lugar.
texts.en:
Cristian is a very hard working man. He is single, 27 years old and does not have children. He lives in Gangotena. In the area, the people make a living raising agricultural animals and in masonry. Gangotena belongs to the parish of Chaltura which is a place well-known for the sale of roast guinea pig, a traditional dish from the area. He lives in a family home with his mother and a brother who attends a public high school and is the youngest of his brothers. 

Cristian is a master mason and has done this job for many years. It is the source of income for his family. He supports his mother with the expenses. His mother works raising chickens, ducks and geese and then sells them in the town fairs. 

Last year, Cristian took an induction cooktop installation course at SECAP and from then on he has been getting experience installing induction cooktops. So, he wants to start his own business offering his services to particular people and to the electrical company EMELNORTE. 

He is asking for a loan to buy wire, breakers, a grinder, a set of screwdrivers, a houndstooth ladder and other materials needed for launching the business.

loans.use: to buy tools and necessary materials to launch his business.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María es una mujer ecuatoriana de 66 años de edad,  nació  en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de cotopaxi, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo ,María es madre soltera es  muy emprendedora y trabajadora, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a trabajar duro para ser un apoyo para sus padres, quienes lo han sacrificado todo para darle educación, pero que lamentablemente por no tener recursos económicos solamente le pudieron dar la educación primaria, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ella. María tiene desde hace muchos años una tienda de abarrotes y los fines de semana se  dedica a la venta de periodicos, ella dedica diariamente a todas esta labores entre 6 y 8 horas, todo esto lo aprendió de sus padres, desde muy pequeña, quienes han sido para ella un ejemplo de lucha constante. 
Hoy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas producto y para adecuar su local ya que actualmente, la demanda  es muy buena, esto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y sustentar sus ventas para no perder sus clientes.
Vino a la Fundación por muy buenas referencias y quiere agradecer muchísimo a quienes forman parte de esta noble institución quienes le han abierto las puertas para poder cumplir con su necesidad, es por eso que agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
María is a 66-year-old Ecuadorian woman; she was born in the city of Latacunga, which is part of the province of Cotopaxi; she lives in her own home together with her son; María is a single mother. She is very entrepreneurial and hardworking; she started working hard at a very young age to help her parents, who sacrificed everything to get her an education, but unfortunately because of a lack of financial resources they were only able to put her through primary school; however, this has not been an obstacle for her. María has had a grocery store for many years and on the weekends she sells newspapers; she spends 6 to 8 hours a day doing this work, all of which she learned when she was small from her parents, who have been an example of constant determination for her.

She is now requesting a loan to buy more products and to remodel her store, as her demand is currently very good. This will help her improve her profits and maintain her sales so she does not lose customers.

She came to the Foundation thanks to very good references and she wants to thank everyone who is a part of this noble institution very much for having opened doors for her to meet her needs. For these reasons she thanks Fundación Alternative and Kiva for making possible her growth in her personal and family life.

loans.use: to buy more products and to remodel her store, which will improve her income and promote loyalty among her customers.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, aged 43, is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 13 years old while her youngest child is six years old. Thelma’s husband is a private employee. She helps her husband by selling snacks such as hot cakes, doughnuts and steamed rice cakes in the community of Batuan, Bohol. Thelma has been operating this business for three years and earns about PHP 3,000 per month. 

To continue her business, Thelma is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar. She dreams in the future of sending all her children to school so they can complete a degree.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, aged 34, is a married woman who lives with her husband in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of one son and one daughter. Nusrat does embroidery work by hand at home and is financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family: her husband’s income is very low; therefore, she decided to start embroidery work at home. Nusrat had learnt these arts in her childhood; now, she has adopted them for her occupation. She has enabled herself to become independent and to earn a sufficient income.
 
Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of items such as threads, silks, sequins and pearls of various colours for her embroidery work. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of items such as threads, silks, sequins and pearls of various colours for her embroidery work

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is living in a historical place with her parents. She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible, honest and talented woman. She is one of trustee clients at IMON that makes payments on time. 

She participated at three day training to startup clients that provided with key successful knowledge in starting a new business. She had planned to be a tailor and serve women with traditional dresses. She had not money and appealed to IMON to get a loan to buy textile and sewing machine. She is willing to be supported by Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles and a sewing machine

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita, aged 40, has four children aged 14, 12, 11 and 10 years old. Her husband is a farmer and a carpenter. Violita has been engaged in raising pigs for six years. In addition to raising pigs, she is also engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. They have been working hard to provide for all their children's needs. 

To increase their livelihood, Violita is requesting a loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will also buy grocery stocks such as soft drinks, canned goods, chips, biscuits, noodles, toiletries, laundry soap, diapers, candles, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drinks to sell in her store. 

In the future, Violita wants to increase her stocks to have better earnings. Then, she will be able to have enough money to send all her children to school so they can complete a degree.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and grocery items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Please meet Rufa, 48 years old, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Edmundo, a driver, and they have children, one of whom is still studying in high school.

Rufa is selling Filipino favorite pic-a-pica or snacks items such as chicharon, fish crackers, peanuts and balut. Chicharon is made from deep-fried pork rind or pork belly, while balut is a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in its shell. Rufa buys these products in bulk then she repacks and sells them retail. She also supplies some variety stores in their community and nearby areas. Her income combined with her husband’s income as a driver sustains their everyday needs. But they are still preparing for the college education of their child. College costs are pocket-draining and Rufa wants to prepare for them. She wants to expand her business by obtaining supplementary capital of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of chicharon, fish crackers, peanuts and balut. It will surely boost her income and savings at the same time. She dreams of renovating their house to make it more secure against typhoons and other calamities. 

Rufa is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of chicharon, fish crackers, peanuts and balut.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 61 years old and married with three children, one child still in school, Eufemia works very hard to provide for them.

Eufemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Eufemia has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc

loans.name: Lynil May

texts.en:
Lynil May is 22 years old and single.

Lynil May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Lynil May has been in this business for 1 year. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, spices, etc for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, spices, etc for her food production business

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and has two children. Judy is married and has one child still in school.

Judy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Judy has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, 38, is married and has four children who are currently in school. For the past three years she has been fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines.

Eden has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has applied for a 6000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra es una de esas personas que creen que invertir constantemente en su negocio, la llevará a mejorarlo y evolucionarlo. Anteriormente, esta emprendedora ya había solicitado un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su molino, lo que funcionó excelentemente para ofrecer un servicio de calidad y ayudó a aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le apoyaron en ese crédito.
Ahora, el tiempo ha pasado y después de haber sido una época de gran producción, Mayra solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar unas piezas que necesita el molino para seguir trabajando tan bien como lo ha hecho. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de su madre, que siempre están pendientes que todo salga bien y quienes también saldrán beneficiados, puesto que obtendrá más ingresos para su familia. En sus planes está mejorar la calidad de su casa, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mayra is one of those people who believe that constantly investing in her business will result in improving and developing it. Previously, this entrepreneur had asked for a loan to do maintenance on her mill, which worked excellently to offer a quality service and helped increase her sales. For that reason, she feels very thankful to all of the people who supported her on that loan. 

Now, time has passed and after having a large production period, Mayra is asking for a new loan to buy parts for the mill to keep it working as well as it has been. Fortunately, she can count on the support from her husband and her mother, who are always making sure that everything is alright. They will also benefit from this loan being as there will be more income for the family. Her plans are to improve the quality of her home to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy parts for the mill.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es: Inocenta es una mujer que a sus 68 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace muchos años a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia y brindar lo mejor que está en sus manos. Inocenta vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y su hija de 25 años de edad a la que han logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. La vivienda en la que habita Inocenta está hecha de adobe, actualmente el techo de esta se encuentra deteriorado, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida y proteger a su familia.
texts.en: Inocenta is a woman who, at 68, is very hardworking and has spent many years offering her cleaning services in private homes, which allows her to support her family and offer them the best she has at her disposal.  Inocenta lives in her own home with her husband and her 25-year-old daughter, whom they have been able to get ahead through a great deal of effort.  The home Inocenta lives in is made of adobe; the roof is currently in bad shape, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to redo the roof on her home and improve her quality of life and protect her family.

loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to redo the roof on her home and improve her quality of life and protect her family.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and known in the Tudela area for her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns money by repackaging misua, a type of thin Chinese noodle made from wheat flour.

Emma is an active participant in the various programs and services that Kiva's field partner PMPC offers. She is thankful that she has priority status in the cooperative, as all of her financial needs are supported by PMPC.

Emma would like to live comfortably in a decent home, so she is now applying for a 14,900 PHP loan to buy plywood, nails, and sticks for renovating her house. Her goal is to maintain her membership in good standing along with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails, and sticks for renovating her house.

loans.name: Oscar Josue

texts.es:
A las edad de quince años, Oscar decidió dejar los estudios para apoyar a su padre con el ganado y en la siembra de maíz y trigo, tiempo donde fue creciendo y aprendiendo todo lo que sabe ahora que es un hombre de 47 años casado, padre de dos hijos independientes y dueño de unas cuantas vacas heredadas de su padre. 
Oscar además de cuidar y ordeñar sus vacas, cuenta con el pago de su cuñada, por cuidar a su ganado mientras ella vive en Estados Unidos. Lo que también le ha servido de experiencia y de otros ingresos para su hogar. Sus expectativas son hacer crecer su ganado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar un ternero, limpiar el potrero y pagar a unos trabajadores. En sus metas futuras está abrir una cuenta de ahorro para cualquier emergencia.
texts.en: At the age of fifteen, Oscar decided to leave his studies to support his father with the cattle and growing corn and wheat. During this time he grew and learned everything that he knows today. He is a 47 year old man, married and father of two independent children. He owns a few inherited cows from his father. Oscar, as well as taking care of and milking his cows, counts on his sister-in-law's pay to take care of her cattle while she lives in the United States. It has served to give him experience and other income for his home. His expectations are to grow his livestock, so he is asking for a loan to buy a calf, clean the paddock and pay some workers. His future goal is to open a savings account for any emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a calf, clean the paddock and pay some workers.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca, de 56 años de edad, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos pero solo uno de ellos no vive en casa de ella.

Blanca, vende leche y queso, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 19 años, aprendió a elaborar estos productos, porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia económicamente, la venta de los lácteos la realiza en los municipios cercanos y trabaja 5 horas al día.

Blanca, solicita un préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para mejorar el negocio y mejorar la venta de  queso.- Con la compra de la vaca la producción de leche aumentara y por ende elaborara más quesos y tendrá mejores ingresos. 

Sus sueños son, colocar un puesto fijo, de manera que ya no lo distribuya de casa en casa.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 56 years old, is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They have three children, but only one of them does not live in her house.

Blanca sells milk and cheese. She has been in this business for 19 years. She learned to make these products because she couldn't find another way to help her family economically. She makes the sale of milk products in the nearby municipalities, and she works five hours a day.

Blanca is applying for a loan to buy a milk cow in order to improve the business and improve the sale of cheese. With the purchase of the cow, the production of milk will increase, and in the end she will make more cheese and have better income.

Her dreams are to set up a fixed sales stand; in this way she won't have to deliver house to house.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 57 years old, married and has three children. For the past five years she has earned an income by raising chickens in the Philippines.

Emma has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 5000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens. She is saving money to expand her operation.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania es una cuidadora de los sueños y de la felicidad de las personas, en especial de los niños y de las niñas, puesto que estudió la carrera de Psicología con la gran meta de ayudar a menores de edad desde el punto de vista de la psicología. A sus 29 años ya trabaja ya en un colegio realizándose profesionalmente, siendo un ejemplo a seguir para sus dos hijos de cuatro y seis años de edad, que en algún tiempo desean ser como su madre y padre de trabajadores y aportadores al crecimiento de las personas.
Afortunadamente, Ivania cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo, quien trabaja en una financiera. Por esta razón, se siente motivada para solicitar un préstamo para estudiar una especialización en psicología y para comprar un computadora, que será de gran ayuda para no tener obstáculos para salir adelante con su trabajo actual y con la especialización que desde hace tiempo deseaba tomar para desempeñarse en el área educativa en una universidad como docente. En sus planes está culminar esta etapa de aprendizaje y buscar un trabajo como docente en el área de educación superior.
texts.en:
Ivania is a caretaker of people's dreams and happiness, especially those of girls and boys. This is why she studied psychology with the goal of helping young children from a psychology perspective. At 29 years old she already works as a professional in a school. She is a role model for her two children who are four and six years old. They hope to one day be hardworking and supportive of others' growth like their mother and father. 

Fortunately, Ivania has her husband's economic and moral support. Her husband works at a finance company. For this reason, she feels motivated to request a loan for a psychology specialization and to buy a computer. This will be of great help since she will not have obstacles to get ahead in her current work and in the specialization that she has been wanting to take for some time so that she can work in education at a college as a teacher. Her plans are to complete this learning stage and find work as a teacher in higher education.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a degree in psychology and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Erodito

texts.es:
Erodito, tiene un taller electrónico, ofrece reparaciones de televisores, equipo de sonido, computadoras, celulares entre otros aparatos eléctricos, el oficio lo aprendió mediante cursos impartidos por una institución no gubernamental, tiene un horario de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde; Erodito vive con su pareja y dos hijos, uno de los niños ya estudia primaria, viven en casa propia, su esposa le colaborara en algunas actividades del negocio.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar diferentes aparatos electrónicos y repuestos para los mismos, al repararlos los venderá y obtendrá mejores ingresos, así mismos contara con los materiales necesarios para realizar los trabajos que sus clientes le solicitan, espera brindar calidad en sus servicios y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son tener mayores ganancias, pagar sus deudas y ayudar a su familia para que tengan mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en:
Erodito has an electronics shop where he repairs televisions, audio equipment, computers, cell phones and other electronics. He learned this trade through courses offered by a non-governmental organization. His schedule is from seven in the morning until six in the evening. 

Erodito lives with his partner and his two children. One of his children is in primary school. They live in their own home. His wife helps him with some of his work tasks. 

He needs a loan to buy different electronics and spare parts for them. He will repair them and sell them and will get a better income. He will then have the necessary materials to do the work his customers request. He hopes to provide quality in his services and attract new customers. His aspirations are to have higher earnings, pay his debts and help his family so that they have better life circumstances.

loans.use: to buy different electronics and spare parts for them.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Hace siete años, Blanca decidió emprender en el negocio de venta de refrescos naturales y comprar y venta de carne de pollo y res. Negocio que ha ido creciendo con pasos fuertes y ahora es muy bien reconocido en su vecindario. A sus 39 años esta emprendedora tiene grandes metas, como llegar a tener una pulpería completa, sin embargo, para esto necesita seguir invirtiendo en la venta de refrescos.
Por esta razón, Blanca solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas variadas, azúcar, bolsas de plástico y carne de res y pollo para vender. Con esto podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y siempre obtener productos para vender y tener más ingresos con el apoyo de su esposo. Apoya a esta emprendedora a seguir construyendo ese gran sueño de establecer su propia pulpería.
texts.en:
Seven years ago, Blanca decided to start a natural soda business as well as the purchase and sales of chicken and beef meat. Business has grown strong and it is now well known in her neighborhood. At her 39 years of age, this enterprising woman has big goals, such as having a full grocery store. However, to get there she needs to continue investing in her soda sales.

For this reason, Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of fruit, sugar, plastic bags as well as beef and chicken meat to sell. This way, she will be able to offer a larger variety to her clients and continue to acquire products to sell and increase her income, along with the support of her husband.

Back up this enterprising woman to continue building on her big dream of establishing her own grocery store.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruit, sugar, plastic bags as well as beef and chicken meat

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, juntos tienen 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando y uno de ellos participa en talleres técnicos y en escuelas de futbol.

Teresa, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 8 años, aprendió acerca del comercio gracias a su madre, quien se dedicaba a la venta y producción de pollos.- Teresa, también trabaja en la agricultura y es de ahí que obtiene los granos básicos para vender.

Teresa, necesita el crédito para comprar pan, condimentos, productos para cocinar  como aceite, salsas, etc, todo para la tienda, con el capital que recibirá invertirá en más producto para poder tener un mayor índice de ventas.

El sueño de Teresa, es que sus hijos crezcan con buenos valores morales y que aprendan un oficio respetable, también sueña con construir su propia casa, porque en donde vive por el momento es de la familia de su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa, who is 37 years old, went to school through fifth grade. She is married. Her husband works in construction. Together, they have three children who are in school, and one of them participates in technical workshops and football schools.

Teresa has had a little store for eight years. She learned about the business thanks to her mother, who works in the sale and production of chickens. Teresa also works in agriculture, and it is from there that she obtains the basic grains to sell.

Teresa needs the loan in order to buy bread, condiments, and cooking products such as oil, sauces, etc., all for the store. With the capital that she will receive, she will invest in more products in order to have a greater sales index.

Teresa's dream is that her children will grow up with good moral values and that they will learn respectable professions. She also dreams of building her own home, because the place where they live now belongs to her husband's family.

loans.use: to buy bread, condiments, and cooking products such as oil, sauces, etc., all for the store

loans.name: Wilson Fabian

texts.es:
Wilson  es un joven ecuatoriano  de 18 años, soltero, vive en un sector rural alejado de la ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi en este lugar la gente se dedica a la elaboración de bloques desde hace 6 meses , y es por esta razón que desea un crédito para hacer crecer mas su negocio,  ya que en este sector es apto por su clima favorable, la gente es muy solidaria, trabajadora, emprendedora y unida.
A pesar de su corta edad es muy dedicado a su trabajo y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante es por esta razón que solicita el crédito, por referencias de familiares vino a Fundacion Alternativa.
Wilson nacio en Pujili tierra del danzante asi es conocido este canton por su gente, tiene muchas ganas de emprender su negocio y que este crezca cada dia mas.
El y su familia  agradece a KIVA por permitirle realizar sus sueños y crecer laboralmente.
texts.en:
Wilson is a young 18 year old Ecuadorian. He was born in Pujili, the land of dancing as it is known by its people. He is single and lives in a rural area far from the city of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi. This area is suitable for its favorable climate, and the people are very supportive, hard-working, entrepreneurial and united. He has made a living making cement blocks for 6 months and he wants to ask for a loan to make his business grow more. 

Despite his young age, he is very dedicated to his job and really wants to get ahead. For this reason, he is asking for a loan. Through family references he came to the Fundacion Alternativa. He really wants to launch his business and have it grow every day. He and his family thank Kiva for allowing him to reach his dreams and to grow occupationally.

loans.use: to buy raw material of cement blocks, in order to work and grow professionally.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Luz del Mundo
La señora Maria Maribel de  34 años de edad vive en la comunidad de Patzun, Chimaltenango.  es una persona trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica y tambien tiene un trabajo fijo, ya que tiene hijos y tiene la responsabilidad  de velar por ellos, por esa razón se dedica a trabajar fuerte, ´pero debido a que el sueldo no le alcanza para invertir en su negocio, es por eso que acude a FAPE para que se le otorgue un crédito y poder así invertir en su negocio en la compra de ropa tipica para vender y obtener mejores ganancias ya que su sueño es mejorar su casa, tener su negocio mas grande y que sus hijos logren graduarse mas adelante, es por esa razón que se esfuerzan en trabajar cada dia, mientras Dios les da vida.
texts.en:
The Luz del Mundo (Light of the World) duo.

Señora Maria Maribel, who is 34 years old, lives in the community of Patzun, Chimaltenango. She is a hard-working person. She sells traditional clothing, and she also has a regular job, since she has children and has the responsibility of looking after them. For this reason, she works hard, but because her salary doesn't go far enough to invest in her business, she is turning to FAPE so that she can be granted a loan and thus be able to invest in her business by buying traditional clothing to sell and obtain better earnings. Her dream is to improve her house, have a bigger business, and see her children succeed in graduating in the future. It is for this reason that they exert themselves in working every day while God gives them life.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jambia

texts.en:
Jambia is married with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Letiana

texts.en: Letiana is a 43-year-old mother with five children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printed materials at the market to earn a living. Letiana requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Letiana will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
David, de 33 años de edad, es bachiller, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado dos hijos con su esposa, de los cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela y el otro con la mamá cuidando la casa.

David, se dedica a la carpintería desde que tenía 12 años de edad, oficio que el papá le enseño, ya que su padre se ha dedicado siempre a esta actividad de carpintería de cajas para las funerarias del municipio.- David, trabaja como empleado elaborando cajas para funeraria, pero también tiene una carpintería en la casa, en donde fábrica camas, jugueteras, sillas, mesas, etc. en su carpintería le ayuda su papá y el horario de trabajo es desde las 4:00 p.m. a las 7:00 p.m. porque el otro trabajo lo hace de las 7:00 a.m. a las 4:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una cortadora de madera eléctrica y sierras circulas, porque eso le hace falta para dejar en buen estado los muebles que fabrica, las sierras que tenía se le arruinaron y compro unas con un crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente, pero no le duraron mucho.

Los sueños de David, son tener una carpintería grande e independizare para elaborar las cajas él solo, ya que ese negocio es bastante rentable y así darle todo lo que sus hijos necesiten.
texts.en:
David, of 33 years of age, has a High School diploma, is married, his wife is a homemaker and they've had two children together, one of which goes to school, while the other stays home with mom to take care of the household. 

David has made a living as a carpenter since he was 12 years old. His father taught him the job, because he too, has always worked in the carpentry field, making caskets for the funeral homes in town. 
David works as an employee making caskets, but he also has a shop at home where he makes beds, toy chests, chairs, tables, etc. His father helps him in these tasks from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m., since the other job is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

The requested loan is to purchase a power wood saw and circular blades which he needs to give a good strong finish to the furniture he makes. The saws he had were ruined, so he purchased another set with a previous loan, however, they did not last long.

David’s dream is to have large carpentry shop and become independent to make caskets on his own, since it's a very profitable business which will allow him to give his children everything they may need.

loans.use: purchase a power wood saw and circular blades

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non, a sub-village chief of Khnar Teymok village, lives with his wife and two children. Besides his job as sub-village chief, he works on his three hectares of land and his feeding farm. Working as a sub-village chief, he needs to work on paperwork a lot, which can consume a lot of his night time. He needs reliable energy to light his house at night. However, currently he doesn't have reliable energy.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses a solar home system, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve the energy to run his business and also save the utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Khnar Teymok Village, Kraing Lvea Commune, Samaki

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 36 years of age, married and blessed with five children. She offers a variety of vegetables and frozen foods. Rosita offers her goods on a house-to-house basis and at the same time, she sells in front of the school. Now, she would like to increase the frozen foods and vegetables she offers, but her capital is not sufficient. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes to keep her business profitable to be able to support her two children who are still attending to school.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn, living with wife (both in the picture standing in front of their house) and two children, runs a food shop at Prey Sampov Village. Sophorn needs long lasting energy to run his food shop because night time is the busiest hour. However, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out without notice. Then, he has no choice but to stop business until morning, which disturbs not only his lifestyle but also his business. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to sustain his business’ energy and also his family's usage. With a solar home system, he doesn’t have to be concerned about sudden outages anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Sampov Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe E

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en: Luaiva is 29 years old and single. She runs a small business selling elei printed materials at the market to earn a living. Luaiva requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers to assist her to run the business. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, shampoo, etc.

Adela has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Doña Elsa, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, vende mercadería como ser ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta actividad la realiza hace varios años y la vende de manera ambulante o por pedidos. Para mantener su negocio ha obtenido varios préstamos y actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para comprar ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa  interior, sabanas y ropa para niños, con el fin de incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de la familia y mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Elsa is 53 years old, a single mother of two children who resides in the Azacualpa Municipality in Santa Barbara. She has her own source of income, selling items such as clothes for women, men and children. She has been doing this for several years as a street vendor or by special order.

To keep her business going, she has received several loans and she is presently requesting another one for 10,000 lempiras to purchase clothing items such as blouses, slacks, shirts, underwear, sheets and kid’s clothes, with the goal to increase her sales and profits to improve the family’s living conditions as well as her business.

loans.use: purchase clothing items such as blouses, slacks, shirts, underwear, sheets and kid’s clothes

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a widow living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 70-year-old woman with seven grown children. She earns a living by buying and selling pots made of clay and cement. To augment her income, she also sells rtw (ready-to-wear) clothing like t-shirts, shorts, pants, jeans and whole dresses.

She decided to take a loan to finance her current sources of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of pots and stock like t-shirts, blouses, jeans and whole dresses. With these, she could cater to her respective customers' orders and be able to improve her income. With these, she could pay her obligations and be able to handle her finances. Thus, she could afford to buy nutritious food which is very essential for her day to day livelihood activity.

She hopes that both her livelihoods will be productive to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pots and stock like t-shirts, blouses, jeans and whole dresses.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ezekiel suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ezekiel has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ezekiel  can now ensure that his children get a postsecondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with four grown children. She resides in Talibon, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years now. She sells a variety of items including pouch vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, assorted canned goods, soap, soft drinks, biscuits, candies and chips. In addition to that, she also engages in a gasoline retail business.

Erlinda has requested a loan to purchase stock like flour, rice and gasoline. These would help boost the content of her store and enables more customers to shop and purchase things. With these, her income will improve and she could start to settle her finances. She could set aside some savings for emergency use.

She would like to expand her business to be successful and also to extend help to her children even if they are already married.

loans.use: to  purchase stock like flour, rice and gasoline

loans.name: Gladys Olimpia

texts.es:
Gladys  una joven ecuatoriana nacida en la ciudad de Latacunga tiene 38 años de edad, es Madre soltera vive en casa de familiares junto a sus tres hijos , la casa está ubicada en la ciudad de Latacunga en un lugar muy alto de la ciudad  en una zona  urbana l de la ciudad, este sector es muy reconocido por la actividad del comercio.
Gladys  es un apoyo muy grande para su familia ya que trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio que se trata de un restaurante de comida típica el mismo que esta ubicado en el terminal terrestre esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, se dedica a este trabajo en la mañana y en la tarde, considera que lo mas difícil de esto es cuando tiene que transportar sus implementos ya que no cuenta con vehiculo , pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para salir adelante y ser una persona de éxito.
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que algún momento pueda comprarse un carro ya que esto le serviría de mucho por la distancia de ,  hoy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería y para remodelar su local , esto ayudará que sus ingresos aumenten y mejoren su vida.
Gladys  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Gladys is young Ecuadorian woman born in the city of Latacunga, she is 38 years old, a single mother who lives in a relative's home along with her three children. Her home is located in the city of Latacunga, in a very high part of the city, an urban zone in a sector well known for commerce activity.

Gladys is a big support to her family, since she has been working very hard in her small traditional food restaurant, which is located at a bus terminal.
She learned this line of work from her mother and works morning and afternoon. She believes the most difficult part of her work is when she must transport supplies, since she does not have her own vehicle; but this has not been an obstacle for her to get ahead and become successful. 

Her biggest dream in life is to purchase a vehicle, which will very much help her, due to the distances she must travel. 
Today, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise and to remodel her stall, which will help her revenue increase and quality of life improve. 

Gladys is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva, for making possible the growth of her work and personal lives.

loans.use: purchase merchandise and to remodel her stall, which will help her revenue increase and quality of life improve

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que desde hace mucho ha buscado la forma mas conveniente de hacer llegar ingresos a su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo logró estudiar en la universidad, pero no ha encontrado trabajo referente a la carrera terminada. Está soltero pero tiene un hijo a su cargo al cual aprecia mucho.


El trabajo que él realiza es la venta de equipo portátil y accesorios informáticos, teléfonos celular y atención a clientes, desde muy pequeño le gustó el área de ventas que con el paso del tiempo ha adquirido gran aprendizaje que le sirve mucho para destacarse en el puesto de trabajo, decidió dedicarse a este negocio por las capacidades que posee y la posibilidad de obtener los ingresos económicos. Tiene un pequeño negocio de igual forma en su casa pero solo trabaja por las tardes. El otro lugar de trabajo le queda a 30 minutos, se va en bus y entra a las 7:30 AM y sale a  las 4:00 PM.


José sabe muy bien de negocios por la experiencia que ha obtenido, es por eso que ha decidido, con todo su análisis que debe tener su propio punto de venta de productos y servicios, ya que tiene la capacidad de convencer fácil a sus clientes y  la zona es bastante potencial por poco competencia, por eso solicita este crédito para comprar accesorios informáticos, telefónicos, y prestará otros servicios de diseño, para algunas actividades sociales o familiares.

Él espera echar a andar sus ideas, pues tiene mucha iniciativa de salir adelante con los trabajos que realiza.
texts.en:
Jose, 27 years old, is a very hardworking person. For a long time he has sought a more convenient way to make income for his family. With great effort he obtained a university degree, but he has not found work within his professional field. He is single but has a son in his care which he greatly appreciates.

The work that he performs is selling laptops, computer accessories, and cellular phones and services to clients. From an early age he liked sales and over time he acquired great lessons that serve him well by making him stand out in the workplace. He decided to pursue this business for the capacity and possibility it possesses to obtain income. He has a similar small business at home but he only works in the evenings. He reaches the other workplace in 30 minutes going by bus. He starts at 7:30am and leaves at 4:00pm.

Jose knows this business very well from the experience he has obtained. So, with all his own analysis he has decided that he should have his own point of sale of products and services because he has the ability to easily persuade his customers and the area has very little potential of competition. Thus, he is requesting this loan in order to purchase computer accessories, phones, and he will provide other design services for some family and social activities.

He hopes to jump-start his ideas, because he has a lot of incentive to succeed with the work that he does.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories, phones, and to provide other design services for some social or family activities.

loans.name: Metala

texts.en: Metala is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Metala suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Metala has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Metala can now ensure that his children get a postsecondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetic items

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela de 40 años, reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en el municipio de Barranquilla, esta emprendedora mujer encontró una oportunidad de negocio en las ventas por catálogos de productos naturales;  su  suegra lleva muchos años ofreciendo estos productos y fue quien le recomendó incorporarse a esta actividad, en la que gracias a un capital semilla pudo comprar sus primeros pedidos de sus clientes.  Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia ofreciéndoles a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos, amigos y familiares medicinas homeopáticas, productos para el cuidado de la piel y el cabello.  Ángela espera incrementar su capital de trabajo para así poder abastecer la demanda de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes,  está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar medicinas homeopáticas y productos de belleza. Su meta a futuro tener un volumen de ventas mayor y continuar educando a sus tres hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Ángela is 40 years old, and resides with her spouse and children in the city of Barranquilla. This entrepreneurial woman found a business opportunity in natural product sales through catalogs. Her mother-in-law has been offering these products for many years and it was she who recommended engaging in this work. Thanks to seed capital, she was able to purchase her first customers’ orders.

Today she has five years of experience offering homeopathic medicines, and skin and hair care products to her customers, who are mostly her neighbors, friends and relatives. Ángela hopes to increase her working capital in order to be able to fill the orders demanded by her customers.

She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ["Mario Santo Domingo Foundation"], to purchase homeopathic medicines and cosmetics.

Her goal for the future is to have a greater sales volume and to continue educating her three minor children.

loans.use: to purchase homeopathic medicines and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yern

texts.en: YERN is 43 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farm. So far, she has been involved in this business for twenty-five years. On average, she is able to make USD 5.00 per day. She wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because she doesn't have enough money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Jeorge

texts.en: Jeorge has been growing and selling corn for many years. He is able to support his family's daily needs and has successfully paid his past loans to GDMPC. He is a determined businessman. Recently, he took out a new loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn so that he will have a bumper crop. In the future, he wants to improve his business as well as educate his children well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn, 59, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. He has four children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a small farm which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows cassava and sells his agricultural products to the local dealers. On average, he can generate an earning of USD 4.00 per day.
His current farmland is small thus, he wants to enlarge his farm. But he cannot afford to do this on his own. Therefore, now he would like to get a KIVA loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing cassava. He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living conditions. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: Maria Celebelle

texts.en:
Her name is Maria Celebelle, she is 41 and is from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Julito, she has one child who is still in Elementary Level in school. A driver's salary in the Philippines is not enough to raise a family. Though they have only one child, it still a challenge to meet their basic needs. 

Maria Celebelle wanted to assist her husband and decided to set up a small general store a month ago. She sells essential essential household and food items. She also sells fish balls and "balut" (boiled duck egg with a small embryo inside). This delicacy is nutritious and flavorful, a staple for people working late in the night or coming home in the wee hours of the morning.

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as pancakes, instant noodles, oil, toiletries and several dozens of "balut" and fish balls as snacks. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. It will be a big help to sustain their needs and send her child to school.

Maria Celebelle hopes that her store will grow and improve their quality of life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for some grocery items and buy dozens of "balut" and fish balls to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
If you explore the beautiful country of the Philippines, you’ll see one unique type of business. It’s called sari-sari store. It’s somehow similar to a convenience store however it's a smaller version. You’ll see this in every barrio, baranggay or even in the cities. You can find here variety of items that can be bought at a cheap price since they sell the items by volume, kilo or by the piece. Sari-sari stores are rampant in the Philippines since Filipinos can take care of their family while doing the business because most sari-sari store are just located in the comfort of their own home where they just put up grills or screens as a protection against theft. In front, you’ll see products hanging such as biscuits, candies, and junk foods to attract customers. 

One entrepreneur who is engaged in this type of business is Jeanie. She is a 37-year-old, who has been a partner of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2010 and is a dedicated member as well.  She has been managing her own sari-sari store business for one year already and enjoys doing it. Jeanie believes that CCT helps aspiring entrepreneurs with their businesses by granting loan requests. Since Jeanie wants to have additional capital for her business, she decided to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan to add items to the business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies and grocery items. 

Jeanie regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To add items to her business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies and grocery items.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, comparte una misma vivienda con su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos, hace 10 años inicio con capital propio el negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, para generar ingresos con los que aporta para los gastos de su hogar.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, su propósito es tener un mejor inventario en su negocio para ampliarlo y lograr una situación económica más estable para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Los sueños de la Sra. Marisol son tener un negocio más reconocido en la zona.
texts.en:
Marisol shares a home with her family, which is made up of her spouse and three children. 10 years ago she used her own capital to start the business of raising and selling pigs, in order to generate income that contributes to covering household expenses.
She needs a loan to buy pigs and concentrated animal feed. Her goal is to have a better inventory in order to grow her business and become more stable financially in order to meet her obligations. Sra. Marisol's dream is to have a business that is well-known in the area.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated animal feed. Her goal is to have a better inventory in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Dúo Buena Vista De San Martin
Este dúo lo forma Ana Luisa de 26 años de edad es originario de san Martin, Ana Luisa se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza de pollos y elaboración de tejidos y bordados típicos. Tiene un hijo de dos años y ya está esperando su segundo bebe y ese es el motivo que la impulsa a luchar en su negocio para darle lo mejor a sus bebes. Es el tercer crédito que solicita y en los anteriores han pagado muy puntual. Agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva el apoyo que le brindan y les envía bendiciones y mucha prosperidad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, concentrado y telas para bordar y asi seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Buena Vista De San Martin

This partnership was formed by Ana Luisa, who is 26 years old and from San Martin. She has earned a living for the last four years breeding chickens as well as producing fabrics and traditional embroidery. 

She has a two year old son and is expecting a second child.  Providing the best for her children is her motivation to strive and work hard in her business. This is the third loan she has applied for and she has paid back previous loans on time. 

She's thankful to Kiva lenders and the support they provide, she sends them her blessings and wishes them great prosperity.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy chickens, chicken feed and materials for embroidery which will enable her to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy base materials in order to produce and sell embroideries.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron, 29, lives in Kampong Thom Province of Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school.

She is a grocery seller and earns, on average, USD 6.00 a day. She has been in this type of business for eight years. Besides this, she is also involved in farming and grows rice for sale.

Currently, she wants to buy a cart to assist in her daily routine work. Because she lacks money, she is applying for a Kiva Loan to afford the cart. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for a cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken, cold cuts, bread, spices, and other ingredients to prepare snacks like pupusas and breads.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been always passionate about cooking. She is successful in the industry because she cares about quality as well as taste. Managing her own canteen and her own people is not easy since she is the one in charge of the biggest to smallest details.

Currently, she has food stalls located in Manila and Makati with eight employees and she still dreams of establishing a new branch and finding people she can trust to do the tasks with less supervision.

The food business that she has right now is the source of her daily income and where she also spends the day supervising and making sure that customers will be satisfied with the food and service. She aims as well to save money for their future and invest for a house and lot in their province.

Lolita decided to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan this year to buy grocery items, canteen equipment and construction materials for the improvement of her business.

Despite being busy managing the business, still she is consistent in attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10 to 15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to study religion, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, canteen equipment and construction materials for the improvement of her food business.

loans.name: Kheim

texts.en:
Kheim, 42 years old, is a lovely mother of three children. She lives in a small community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland that is located near her house. On her farmland she grows vegetables and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 4.00 per day.

She is living in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. Because she lacks sufficient money, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as timber to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Selling ready-to-wear clothes is Leila’s business. Leila is a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she is blessed that CCT granted her previous loan of PHP 25,000 that enabled her to buy additional stocks for her clothing business and food stall.

Her usual customers are her friends and neighbors. Her challenge is that she earns just enough for her day-to-day living, so when she needs to buy medicine, there may not be enough.

That is why Leila is striving her best to become successful. This year, she applied for another loan of PHP 30,000 to add stocks so that customers will have a variety of choices and there will be more profit so that she can afford her medications.

On a weekly basis, Leila regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her experience in business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion.
