A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from Bohol, Philippines. She is a 50-year-old woman with 10 children. Some are already married and some are still dependent on her.

To earn a living she is engaged in raising pigs. She has been doing this business for seven years.

Rosalina’s only dream is to make a better living so that she could provide the needs of her family. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and feed to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 59-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has two adult children. Her husband is a private employee. They work hard to make a better living.

Genara helps her husband financially by doing a hog-raising business. She has been doing this business for 10 years and it helps with their daily expenses.

She is asking a loan to buy additional piglets and feed. Genara wants to increase their livelihood to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
In the Philippines, if you want to start your own business at home one of the top picks is Direct Selling. It’s where you’ll become a reseller of a company and they will provide you with their own brochure to show to your customers. Their products include ready-to-wear clothes for men & women, footwear for all ages, make up, appliances and items for personal use. You’ll become a qualified reseller once you sign up and pay a membership fee. Most mothers who are busy with their families are engaged on this type of business since most of their customers are just their neighbors and friends. Basically their sales pitch or how they will sell the product is one of the gifts that they should possess to flourish on this kind of industry.

In every business, you should be patient and persevere to grow. Thelma is one of the partners of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) who has been in the Direct Selling business for years now. This is a business that doesn’t need to have a high capital to start. You just need to have passion and dedication to be successful. You can join or sign up with as many companies as you want since every company sells varieties or unique products so that customers will have different choices. That’s why Thelma is very grateful since CCT helped her by granting the loan that she applied previously. This year, Thelma wants to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to have additional products on display, since availability of the products is one thing that should be considered in this type of business. Thelma is anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a big help for the business.

Thelma believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have additional products on display for her Direct Selling business.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.en:
Braulio is an enthusiasic farmer. He cultivates his family's rice land in Tudela, Misamis Occidental and achieves good earnings doing this work.

Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Braulio knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Braulio hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es mecánico, tienen dos hijos que están estudiando.

Sandra, a trabajado en diferentes lugares, su primer trabajo fue como mesera durante 1 año, después trabajó 3 años como ama de casa y desde hace 10 años trabajar vendiendo frutas y verduras, su horario es de 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 2:00 de la tarde y de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar frutas y verduras para continuar con su negocio.

Sandra, sueña con tener un negocio de venta de comida y también le gustaría mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, 33 years old, went to school up to the seventh grade, is partnered and her partner is a mechanic. They have two children who are students. 

Sandra has worked in different places, her first job was as a waitress for 1 year, then she worked for 3 years as a home maker, and for the past 10 years she has worked selling fruits and vegetables. Her schedule is from 8:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon and in this way she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing fruits and vegetables to continue with her business. 

Sandra dreams of having a business selling food and also would like to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to continue with her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, beans, bread, detergents, and more, to expand her small store.

loans.name: Ariel Manuel

texts.es: Ariel es un joven empresario de 20 años con un gran espíritu de superación, hace seis años produce masivamente Pasabocas; su padre tiene el mismo negocio y él a muy temprana edad aprendió observando el proceso productivo de deditos de queso.  Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. empieza su día laboral, inicia con la preparación de la harina y la envuelve en pequeños trozos de queso, luego empaca en bandejas y quedan listos para su comercialización, así ofrece un producto listo para sofreír y consumir. Sus principales clientes son residentes del municipio de Soledad y compañeros de la universidad, puesto que se encuentra cursando estudios universitarios.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar maquina una Sobadora e insumos.  Ariel considera que con esta inversión va a poder incrementar su producción y podrá ampliar su cobertura.  Su meta a futuro es comprarle una casa a su madre, culminar sus estudios universitarios y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Ariel is a 20-year-old enterprising young man with a great spirit of self-improvement. For six years he has produced snacks in large quantity. His father has the same business and he learned it at a very young age by observing the production process for cheese sticks. Every day at 7 am he begins his work day, he begins the preparation of the flour and wraps the small pieces of cheese, later he packs them on trays and they are ready for sale. In this way he has a product ready for sauteing and eating. His primary customers are the residents of the municipality of Soledad and classmates at the university since he is a university student. Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan, through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase a dough sheeter and supplies. Ariel thinks that with this investment he will be able to increase his production and expand his coverage. His goal for the future is purchase his mother a house, finish his university degree and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase an dough sheeter and supplies.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Baigalmaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband render a transportation service to local people using their microvan. Their son just graduated from high school and successfully passed the university entrance exam. Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house and passed the wintertime without the hardship of freezing. This time she is requesting a loan of 1,600 USD to buy vacuum insulated windows in order to prevent dust coming into house. This summer was especially dry and she thinks it is wise to install vacuum insulated windows to prevent dust allergy reaching her family.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a sari-sari store owner from Bohol, Philippines. He is 26 years old and has two children aged four and seven months old. His partner also depends on him financially. That is why he works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items such as chips, biscuits, noodles, toiletries, candies, soft drinks, mosquito repellent, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, laundry soap, coffee, powdered juice, milk and chocolate drink. In the future, Jushua dreams of being successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, noodles, toiletries, candies, soft drinks, mosquito repellent, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, laundry soap, coffee, powdered juice, milk and chocolate drinks

loans.name: Edzel

texts.en:
Edzel is 21 years old and single.

Edzel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Edzel requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles, bread, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Alona

texts.en:
Ma. Alona is 45 years old and married. She has seven children and two children are currently in school. Ma. Alona works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Alona runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Ma. Alona requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and has four children. She works hard to help her husband provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, coffee, etc. to sell.

Mary has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan.

Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Marifi

texts.en:
Ma. Marifi is 42 years old and married. She has four children and two children are presently in school. Ma. Marifi works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Marifi runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Ma. Marifi requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, de 73 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, lo poco que sabe leer y escribir lo aprendió en casa gracias a un tío que le enseñaba, se caso a la edad de 18 años, su esposa con quien a vivido le ha apoyado en los trabajos que realiza, la mitad de sus hijos están en otro país, solo vive con su esposa y 2 nietos que tiene.

Santiago, se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura, ordeña y vende la leche, toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad, de la cual ha logrado mantener su familia, su padre fue quien le enseño todo lo relacionado al trabajo que realiza, donde cuida el ganado y cultiva el maíz y maicillo está a 2 kilómetros y el horario de trabajo es desde las 4:30 a.m. hasta las 8:00 a.m. luego en la tarde de 2:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m.

Santiago, necesita el préstamo para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra donde siembra maicillo para el ganado, la necesidad satisfecha porque podrá sembrar y prepararse para tener comida para el ganado.  

Santiago, a pesar de su edad mantiene sus sueños que son, seguir trabajando y darle siempre el sustento a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santiago, 73 years old, did not go to school. The little that he knows how to read and write he learned at home thanks to an uncle who taught it to him. He got married at the age of 18. His wife, with whom he has lived, has supported him in the work he does. Half of his children are in another country and he only lives with his wife and two grandchildren he has. 

Santiago works raising livestock and in agriculture. He milks the cows and sells the milk, all his life he has worked in this job, from which he has managed to support his family. His father was the one who taught him everything related to the work he does. He cares for the cattle and grows corn and sorghum at a place 2 kilometers away and his work schedule is from 4:30 am to 8:00 am then in the afternoon from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm. 

Santiago needs the loan to pay the rent on the land where he grows sorghum for the cattle, he needs it because he will plant and prepare to have food for the cattle. 

Despite his age, Santiago has dreams which are to continue working and always support his wife.

loans.use: to pay for rent on the land where he grows sorghum for the cattle.

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, junto a ella vive su hijo de 24 años de edad que está acompañado y trabaja y su nuera también.

María, vende productos de belleza por medio de revista desde hace más de cinco años, la necesidad de tener un ingreso para su hogar la obligo a tomar acciones por su propia cuenta, también una amiga le ayudo a establecer el contacto con los vendedores de los productos; cuando no está vendiendo productos de revista, se dedica a lavar ropa a personas que le buscan; la distancia que recorre cada día para salir a vender es de aproximadamente cinco kilómetros y el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 a.m.  

El prestamos será invertido para pagar un producto de revista que pidió y que tiene que cancelar en efectivo, porque en este mes aumento el pedido y el capital que tiene, no le alcanza para cubrirlo. Con este préstamo podrá seguir trabajando para el sustento de sus necesidades y las de su familia. 

María, desea seguir creciendo poco a poco con las ventas y la clientela.
texts.en:
María, 45 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She is a single mother and with her live her son, 24 years old, who is partnered and works, and  his partner as well. 

María has sold beauty products from magazines for over five years. The need to have income for her home made her take action on her part, also a friend helped her to establish contact with the product salespeople. When she isn't selling catalog products, she works washing clothes for people who seek her out. The distance that she goes each day to go out and sell is approximately five kilometers and her work schedule is from 6:00 am to 10:00 am. 

The loan will be invested in paying for products from a catalog which were ordered and she has to pay for in cash, because this month the order increased and the capital she has is not enough to cover it. With this loan, she will be able to continue working to sustain her needs and those of her family.

María wants to continue growing little by little with her sales and customer base.

loans.use: to pay for products from a catalog which were ordered and she has to pay for in cash.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, 33, lives in a community of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina who is in her late 40s is married with five children two who are still in school and two are grown up.  She has been selling crafts for seven years. She works from 07am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit
  
This will be Paulina 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the crafts stock .She has paid back all her loans successfully She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a land, loan repayment and covered household expenses.    She will use this loan to increase on her crafts.  She dreams of building her own house.

Paulina will make sure she pays her loan within the schedule

loans.use: to increase on her craft stock for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Christine is 28 years old and has one child still in school.

Christine has a buy and sell animal feeds business in the Philippines. Christine requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of feeds and vitamins to sell to her stall.

Christine has been in this business for 2 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of feeds and vitamins to sell on her stall

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalena is 52 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Magdalena has a farming flowers business in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her flowers.

Magdalena has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flowers

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 52 years old and is married with three children who are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Priscila has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 33-years old lady; she is married and passing her life with her two daughters and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She is taking loan for her husband because her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high. 

Due to high cost he is facing the shortage of material and unable to purchase expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can remove the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount her husband will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Rubina is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery shop

loans.name: Ivon Alejandra

texts.es:
Ivon, vive con su esposa y un una pequeña hija de cuatro años en casa de su suegra, tiene como negocio la venta de ropa y cosméticos, actividad que aprendió a desarrollar con ayuda de una tía, actualmente es independiente y solo ella lo atiende a sus clientes.
Para aumentar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes ha decidido solicitar un crédito con el que podrá comprar pantalones, camisas, vestidos y variedad de lociones, su principal objetivo es que sus clientes compren más y así tener nuevos ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son mantenerse trabajando para tener una fuente de ingresos que le permita sacar adelante a su hija y tener mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ivon lives with her spouse and a little daughter, four years old, in her mother-in-law's house. She has a business selling clothing and cosmetics, work she learned to do with the help of an aunt. Now she is independent and she serves her customers on her own. 

To increase the merchandise that she offers her customers, she has decided to ask for a loan, with which she will be able to purchase pants, shirts, dresses, and a variety of lotions. Her principal objective is that her customers purchase more and, so, to have new income to support the family expenses.

Her aspirations are to continue working to have a source of income which allows her to get her daughter ahead and to have a better quality of life in her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, dresses, and a variety of lotions; her primary objective is that her customers purchase more.

loans.name: Marcia Soraya

texts.es:
Marcia una mujer joven ecuatoriana de 22 años de edad  nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, vive en casa de los padres, con el sacrificio y el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria para luego dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vió obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar sus necesidades.  
Desde hace mas de un año trabaja ayudante de costura y hoy en dia desea emprender su negocio negocio el mismo que se trata de un taller de costura en donde fabricara mochilas, maletas y cartucheras escolares, siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio y en vista de que su madre siempre se dedicó a esta actividad esto motivó a Marcia para emprender en esta misma actividad, para esto ella solicita a KIVA a través de Fundación Alternativa un crédito para cumplir y poner en marcha este sueño.
Marcia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora por lo que ha sido un gran apoyo para su madre y sus hermanos. 
En esta oportunidad Marcia quiere hacer llegar un gran  agradecimiento a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Marcia is a young Ecuadorian woman, 22 years old, born in the city of Latacunga, Cotopaxi province, part of the Republic of Ecuador. She lives in her parents' house. With the sacrifice and efforts of her parents, she was able to finish primary school, to then work since, because of of the lack of resources, she had to do it to able to provide for her needs. 

For over one year she has worked as a sewing assistant and now she wants to undertake her business, which will be a sewing shop where she will make backpacks, shoulder bags, and school bags. She always dreamed of having her own business and in seeing that her mother always has worked in this job, this motivated Marcia to undertake the same work. For this, she asks Kiva through Fundación Alternativa for a loan to realize and put into place her dream.

Marcia is a very hard-working and enterprising woman for which she has been a great support for her mother and siblings.

At this time, Marcia wants to thank Kiva very much for making the growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to undertake a sewing business and with this income be of help to her mother and siblings.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 56 years old married woman with five children. She live in a urban community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She buy sea shell and make traditional money(shell money)then sell it at the market to earn living.She has been doing this for thirty years.

Helen requested a loan to buy twenty bags of different sea shell to assist her in the shell money business. She plan to use her profit to provide a better living for her family also help covers for her family's daily expenses.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services

loans.use: A loan of $7,500 helps Helen buy bags of sea shell for her shell money (Traditional money) business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 54-year-old married woman. Almost a year ago, she opened a grocery shop with home products section in an attempt to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. 
Mariam is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her region. She is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new items and products for the home products section to satisfy her customers' needs. 
Mariam hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products for the home products section

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food concentrate, vitamins and poultry to raise.

loans.name: Gaulua

texts.en: Gaulua is 50 years old with 2 children. She operates a business of cattle farm in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Gaulua requested for a loan to buy wheelbarrow, knife, cement, rope, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, knife, cement, rope, chemicals,

loans.name: Inobatjon

texts.en:
Inobatjon is a careful mother and was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in small town with her family. She is married and has two children. She works at diary factory, with four years experience in this factory. She well knows her duty and her employer is satisfied with her work. 

Her child is sick. She wants to have healthy and safe children, so she wishes her child will be treated soon. She is asking financials support from Kiva lenders to treat her child in medical clinic. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her child in medical clinic

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeriana is 59 years old, married and had four children. Her youngest is still studying. She is managing a dress shop. Aside from sewing services she offers, she also sell feed to hog raisers in their village. She had been very patient in managing her businesses in order to sustain needs of her family. Now, she wanted to avail loan of P50,000 to buy feed to sell and more fabrics to use in sewing. This will help improve capacity of sales in her business. She will also pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to sell and more fabrics to use in sewing

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
To earn a living, Zosima and her husband have been engaged in furniture making from a bamboo stand. They have been doing this business for 25 years and become proficient. She is now 50 years old and has six children. Four of them are still attending school. Zosima’s only hope is for her children to finished their degree. 

They have been working hard to increase their livelihood to have enough money for her children’s school payment. With this, Zosima is asking a loan to buy more bamboo stand for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy bamboo stands for making furniture

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz  is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luz  is 52 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Ma. Luz  has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz  requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Ma. Luz  has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from manicure and pedicure.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is 30 years old and single with four children, three children are presently in school, Rodelia works very hard to provide for them.

Rodelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs and etc.

Rodelia has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs and etc

loans.name: Mwasaro

texts.en:
Mwasaro is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Mwasaro operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase tomatoes,onions and potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes,onions and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase varnish, wood, nails, a plane, etc. he will have an well-stocked inventory to continue working for a long time and in addition will supply his customers' orders.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is a farmer living with parents and sister who works as factory worker in Chrok Sangke Village. Ean earns extra money for family with his field and also his feeding farm. He needs to get up early and work until late night to substance family condition. He needs a sustainable energy to run his business day and night. However, the car battery is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without noticed. He has no choice but stay in pitch black for 1 day until morning; which disturbs not only his living lifestyle but also his business. 

Therefore, he is applying KIVA loan to buy solar home systems for substance his business’s energy usage and also his family usage. With solar home systems, he doesn’t have to concern about sudden power off anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Chrok Sangke Village, Svay Chhouk Commune, Samaki

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 25 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a crockery store (utensils for sale) for many years and he is only responsible to feed the entire family. 

Shamim is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because her husband has to purchase different types of crockery i.e;  jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets  etc. This loan will help her husband to purchase these items for reselling purpose. So that he can earn maximum profit and increase his daily sales. He can also use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more crockery (utensils) for her husband's shop

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is the age of 43; she is mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd, butter, for sale and he sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning from milk sale.  He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients.

 He is in need of one buffalo to increase his income through milk sale business. So, Rubina demanded for loan. In this way she can support to her husband business.
She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy one buffalo for her husband's milk sale business

loans.name: Evite

texts.en:
Evite is a 35 year old mother with 3 children and had a small business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Evite requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves,to assist her run the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to replace the roof and protect his children from the rain.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano is a cheerful woman who was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a small town in her parent's house with her four children, her husband having died five years ago. She is a business lady and has been selling fruits and vegetables for about 14 years. Her family's standard of living is very poor but she works hard and tries to earn more money to provide for them. She is planning to expand her business and buy more fruits and vegetables. She awaits KIVA lenders compassion and support.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: 1 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de batidos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora que parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace nueve años, al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona, decide iniciar con este negocio por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra huevo, azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “1 DE JULIO” loan group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of eight members, and is led by officers of whom Nicolasa is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are: smoothie sales, a neighborhood store, food sales, shoe sales, and clothing sales.

The loan that they will get out will benefit the small business owners of whom Nicolasa is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a staff person from the institution. Currently she has a business selling smoothies. She says that she began this business nine years ago, seeing a lack of this business in her area, she decided to begin this business at her own initiative. 

The loan that she will get out now is to increase her capital (purchase eggs and sugar in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  
With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 45 years old and married with three children, two children still in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care product, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, bread, eggs and etc

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosario is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell at her local market.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell at her local market

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 53 years old, single and has eight children.

Susan is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her duck.

Susan has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed  times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Enaya

texts.en:
Enaya is a 50-year-old, married mother of one child. Her husband works in the aluminum business, but his income is not enough to cover their living expenses. Thus, eight years ago, she opened a convenience store in an attempt to help her husband and improve their living conditions. 
Today, Enaya is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers' needs.
Enaya hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, ha tenido un impacto positivo con el uso del crédito anterior, su negocio le ha generado estabilidad económica y puede dar un mejor bienestar a su familia.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar insecticidas, herbicidas y abono para la próxima siembra de granos básicos, además invertirá en un cerdo para continuar fortaleciendo su negocio, espera que su progreso continúe.
texts.en:
José has had a positive impact with the use of the previous loan. His business has generated economic stability and he can give a better well-being to his family. 

He needs a new loan to purchase insecticides, herbicides and manure for the next planting of basic grains, in addition he will invest in a pig to continue strengthening his business. He hopes that his progress will continue.

loans.use: to invest in insecticides, herbicides, and manure for the next planting of basic grains, in addition he will invest in a pig to continue strengthening his business.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María, es divorciada, vive con dos hijos que depende de ella, como mujer responsable de su hogar tiene que trabajar para generar los recursos económicos necesarios, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta básicos, un pequeña variedad de calzado y prendas de vestir, tiene una experiencia de 12 años y el oficio lo heredo de su familia.
Ha solicitado un crédito para que su negocio sea más competitivo, comprara chancletas, sandalias, nuevos estilos de prendas de vestir, así como también bebidas, granos básicos, jabón, pan, etc., busca atender mucho mejor a sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas y obtener buenas ganancias.
La visión de María es ampliar su negocio hasta lograr tener un minisúper y costear los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is divorced. She lives with two children who depend on her. As a woman responsible for her household, she has to work to generate the necessary resources. She is the owner of a store where she offers her customers basic pantry products, and a small variety of footwear and clothing. She has 12 years of experience and she inherited the profession from her family. 

She has asked for the loan so her business is more competitive. She will purchase sandals, shoes, new clothing styles, and also drinks, basic grains, soap, bread, etc. She seeks to serve her customers much better, increase her sales, and get good earnings.

María's vision is to expand her business until she has a mini-supermarket and to pay for her children's university education.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, shoes, new clothing styles and also drinks, basic grains, soap, bread, etc. she seeks to serve her customers much better.

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: Elfida tiene 58 años de edad, es casada tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados con familia, el esposo de doña elfida tiene su propio negocio recolección de basura, desde hace veinte años, doña elfida tiene una tienda de consumo diario, empezó vendiendo maíz y frijol pero al ver que sus clientes le pedían que ella vendiera o surtiera su negocio lo hizo ya que se caracteriza por ser una mujer ejemplar, de buen carácter, sociable, amable con sus clientes, ahora ella lleva más de 20 años también con su tienda y lo ha surtido bien, ahora necesita invertir y comprar su mercaderia por mayor lo hace para lograr  mayores ganancias, doña elfida y su esposo tienen un fondo de ahorros y ese es su sueño y poder dejarles algo a sus hijos y no dar molestias para cuando ya no puedan trabajar y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Elfida is 58 years old, married, and has four children who are now married with families. Elfida's husband has had his own business collecting trash for the past 20 years. Elfida has a store of everyday products. She began selling corn and beans but, upon seeing that her customers asked her to sell or stock things in her business, she did so because she is characterized as being a model woman, of good character, sociable, friendly with her customers. Now she has also had her store for more than 20 years and she has stocked it well, now she needs to invest and purchase her merchandise in bulk. She does it to get better earnings. Elfida and her husband have some savings and this is her dream to be able to leave something to her children and not be bothersome when they can't work anymore and help their children.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Walter Adalberto

texts.es:
Walter, es un joven soltero vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos, tiene 10 años de residir en dicho lugar, uno de su hermanos le apoya un poco económicamente, es propietario de una sala de belleza, el oficio lo aprendió mediante cursos de estilista profesional, ya con suficiente experiencia decidió abrir su propio negocio, el cual tiene desde hace un año.
Con el tiempo ha ido atrayendo nuevos clientes y su inventario no está muy surtido para ir cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes de manera inmediata, hace la solicitud de un crédito para comprar tintes, esmaltes, labiales, tratamientos para el cabello, etc., ofrecerá nuevos productos y atenderá mejor a sus clientes, espera que la afluencia de clientes se mantenga.
Sus sueños son tener un local propio y abrir otro punto de atención para irse superando.
texts.en:
Walter is a single young man who lives with his parents and two siblings. He has lived in this place for 10 years, one of his siblings supports him a little economically. He is the owner of a beauty salon, a profession he learned through courses on professional styling and, with sufficient experience, he decided to open his own business, which he has had for a year.

With time, he has been attracting new clients and his inventory isn't well stocked to meet his customers' demands immediately. He asks for a loan to purchase dyes, nail polish, lipstick, hair treatments, etc. He will offer new products and serve his customers better, he hopes that the influx of customers will continue. 

His dreams are to have his own retail space and open another service location to continue improving himself.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, nail polish, lipstick, hair treatments, etc.; he will offer new products and serve his clients better.

loans.name: Fidencio Elpidio

texts.es:
Fidencio, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar tule y corazones del mismo, para elaborar petates, yaguales y otras artesanías, además invertirá en petates y hamacas ya fabricados, fortalecer su negocio con materia prima y productos finalizados, espera que las ventas se mantengan.
Con el crédito anterior ha podido comercializar sus productos a nuevos clientes, teniendo así estabilidad en las ventas y en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fidencio needs another loan to purchase tule reeds to make sleeping mats and other crafts and in addition will invest in sleeping mats and hammocks already made, to strengthen his business with raw materials and finished products, he hopes that his sales will continue. 

With the previous loan, he was able to sell his products to new customers, and so, having stability in his sales and his income.

loans.use: To purchase tule reeds to make sleeping mats and other crafts, in addition he will invest in sleeping mats and hammocks already made.

loans.name: Dúo Ester Group

texts.es: Dúo Ester:dúo integrado por la señora Miriam de 30 años de edad, ella es una persona muy luchadora, tiene su negocio de venta de leña que gracias a apoyo de Fape y Kiva a podido seguir adelante y gracias a Dios a su negocio ha ido en aumento, con el credito anterir pudo comprar la camionada de leña que nececitaba y pudo incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias, en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para comprar una camionada de leña mas para vender y así seguir generando mejores ganancias, ya que el sueño de ella es ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en: Ester Duo: The duo was formed by Miriam, age 30. She is a very determined woman, she has a business selling firewood that, thanks to the support of Fape and Kiva, she has managed to get ahead and, thanks to God, her business has increased. With the previous loan, she was able to purchase a truckload of firewood that she needed and was able to increase her earnings a bit more. This time, she asks for a loan to purchase another truckload of wood to sell and, so, to continue generating better earnings, since her dream is to help her children in their education.

loans.use: purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, pero todos ya están casados.

Bertila, trabajo como ama de casa durante 10 años y actualmente tiene negocio de elaboración de flores artificiales, este oficio lo aprendió de una amiga; tiene 20 años de tener este negocio y de esta forma ha logrado salir adelante, luchando por sacar adelante a su familia. 

El crédito sera invertido para continuar trabajando en la elaboración de flores artificiales y comprar los materiales que necesita para su elaboración. 

El sueño de Bertila, es mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertila, 63 years old, went to school up to the first grade, is a single mother, and has 4 children, but they are all now married.

Bertila worked as a homemaker for 10 years and now has a business making artificial flowers. She learned this profession from a friend, she has had this business for 20 years, and in this way she has managed to get ahead. She struggles to get her family ahead. 

The loan will be invested in continuing to work making artificial flowers and to purchase materials that she needs to make them.

Bertila's dream is to improve her quality of life and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to continue working making artificial flowers and to purchase the materials she needs to make them.

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja cuida del hogar y tienen un hijo de 1 año de edad.

José, trabaja desde la edad de 9 años, aprendió las actividades de crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos, gracias a su padre.- Actualmente, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y tiene 4 vacas, pero además trabaja como jornalero, de esta manera obtiene ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar ganado, de esta forma aumentara sus ganancias.

José, sueña con tener casa propia y aumentar el numero de ganado que tiene.
texts.en:
José, 25 years old, went to school through secondary, is partnered, his partner takes care of the home and they have a 1-year-old child. 

José has worked since he was 9 years old, he learned the jobs of raising cattle and planting basic grains thanks to his father. Currently, he plants 7,000 square meters of corn crops and has 4 cows, but in addition he works as a day laborer, in this way he gets income to get his family ahead.

The loan will be invested in purchasing cattle, in this way he will increase his earnings.

José dreams of having his own house and increasing the number of cattle that he has.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, in this way he will increase his earnings.

loans.name: Aguilas De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE ESCOMA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de faldas de cholita, venta de arroz, venta de ganado, venta de carne, venta de pollo, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que son dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cinco años, por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago que se realizan en la institución.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DE ESCOMA” loan group will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers of whom Victoria is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are clothing sales, Andean skirt sales, rice sales, livestock sales, meat sales, chicken sales, and fruit sales. 

The loan that they will get out will benefit the small business owners, of whom Victoria is one. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a staff member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She says that she began this business five years ago at her own initiative. 

The loan that she is getting now will be to increase her capital (purchase clothing in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will later sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically since she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the payment meetings that they have at the institution.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Nancy Elvira

texts.es: Nancy de 36 años, reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en una vivienda ubicada en el municipio de Soledad y con la finalidad de ayudar en los gastos del hogar, buscó oportunidades de negocio por lo que le pareció que las ventas de productos por catálogo sería la más ideal.  Ella realiza visitas a sus amigos, familiares y amigos, para mostrarle la oferta de prendas de vestir, calzado, perfumes, cremas corporales y demás artículos del catálogo y tan pronto como logre la meta de ventas realiza el pedido, sin embargo su capital es insuficiente para cumplir oportunamente con las entregas de pedidos, para mitigar esta situación está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará encargos de sus clientes; ropa, calzado, colonias y demás.  Su meta a futuro es continuar ofreciendo bienestar a sus hijos y adquirir un local comercial.
texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and lives with her partner and children in a house located in the town of Soledad.  She searched for a business opportunity that would allow her to help out with household expenses, and found selling products through a catalogue ideal. 

She visits her friends, relatives and their friends, offering clothing, footwear, perfumes, body creams and other articles from the catalogue. As soon as she meets her sales goal she orders the goods.

However she can't deliver her orders promptly because she lacks enough capital to order stock in advance.To mitigate this problem she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to to buy clothes, footwear, shoes and so forth to full fill orders for her clients. 

Her goal is continue to provide for the welfare of her children and in future purchase a commercial premises.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, shoes and so forth to fulfill orders for her clients.

loans.name: 1 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE MAYO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yaqueline  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CDs, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos y gelatina. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yaqueline es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CDs; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, aprendiendo de un familiar que le enseño a realizar este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra CDs por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de Desaguadero y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “1 DE MAYO” loan group will begin its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Pamamericana. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Yaqueline is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are CD sales, blanket sales, food sales, and snack and jelly sales. 

The loan that they will get out will benefit the small business owners, of whom Yaqueline is one. She says that five years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a staff member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling CDs, she says that she began this business some years ago, leaning from a family member who taught her how to do this business. 

The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (purchase CDs in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in Desaguadero and later will sell in the fairs in the city of El Alto. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase CDs in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.es:
La Sra. María es una mujer luchadora, vive en unión libre tiene hijos pero son mayores de edad e independientes, vive en el Recinto Tulipe  barrio las Islas perteneciente a la Parroquia de Nanegalito está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha, su gente es muy trabajadora. 
Doña María viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual solo tiene estudios primarios a pesar de esto salió adelante trabajando junto a su esposo en una finca del sector como cuidadores y realizando trabajos varios, actualmente desean emprender en el negocio de crianza de toros de carne, sus jefes les apoyan en  el negocio con los potreros para el ganado, cuentan con el espacio suficiente para esta actividad, aprendieron de este negocio gracias a sus Padres ya que ellos también trabajaban con ganado.
La Sra. María tiene muchos sueños por cumplir como lo es tener su gran negocio de crianza y engorde de ganado y dedicarse solo a eso y dejar de trabajar para otras personas. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Doña María y a su esposo a mejorar su calidad de vida, agradecen a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como ellos que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is a determined woman, she is in a common-law marriage and has children but they are adults and independent. She lives in Tulipe precinct, Las Islas neighborhood, which is part of Nanegalito parish, located in the northwest of Pichincha province, where the people are very hard-working. 

María comes from a low income family, so she only finished primary school. Despite this, she got ahead working with her husband on a farm in the area as caretakers and doing various jobs. Currently, they want to undertake a business raising beef cattle, their bosses support them in their business with the pasture for the cattle, they have sufficient space for this work. They learned this business thanks to their parents since they also worked with cattle. 

María has many dreams to realize, such as having a large business raising and fattening cattle and working only in this and stopping working for other people.

This loan will help María and her husband to improve their quality of life, they are grateful to Kiva for the support it is offering to people like them who, due to lack of opportunity, haven't been able to carry out their dreams.

loans.use: to undertake her business of raising and fattening cattle and to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Ticuyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE TUCUYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lorenza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ganado, venta de carne de res, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lorenza es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  ayudando a su mamá hace diez año ya que con el pasar del tiempo y con el ahorro de un capital decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente a la elaboración comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “VICUÑITAS DE TUCUYO” loan group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is made up of ten members and is led by officers, of whom Lorenza is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are milk sales, cattle sales, beef sales and blanket sales. 

The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners, of whom Lorenza is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer as part of a massive promotion by the institution. Currently, she has a business selling blankets, she says that she learned this business by helping her mother ten years ago and with the passing of time and with her savings, she has decided to open her independent business.

The loan that she is now getting out is to increase her capital (purchase wool in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in El Alto to later make and sell them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Nelson Alejandro

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable, sus fiestas de Cantonización las celebran en el mes de julio, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, como la cascada del amor y varias hosterías su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando conciertos y bailes populares.
En este Cantón vive el señor Nelson un hombre emprendedor de 30 años, viene de una familia humilde, decidió seguir la carrera de Policía, actualmente presta sus servicios en un Recinto de este Cantón su esposa pasa en los Bancos no tienen hijos y son un hogar muy unido.
El señor Nelson desea emprender en el negocio de producción de cerdos, junto a su esposa  se dedicaran al negocio pero él estará al frente cuando tenga días libres aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia, en la casa donde vive cuenta con el espacio y la infraestructura suficiente le dedicarán un promedio de 3 horas diarias a esta actividad.
Don Nelson con este préstamo espera que su situación económica mejore y pueda darle a su esposa un mejor futuro, el señor Nelson agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a warm and humid climate, the people are very friendly and they celebrate their founding festival in the month of July. This canton has various tourist attractions such as the love waterfall and various inns. The people are happy and like to enjoy all their festivals, organizing concerts and popular dances. 

Nelson lives in this canton. He is a 30-year-old enterprising man. He comes from a humble family and decided to work as a police officer. Currently he works in a precinct of this canton. His wife is from Los Bancos, they don't have children and they are a very close-knit household.  

Nelson wants to undertake the business of pig production, with his wife he will work in the business but he will be at the lead when he has days off. He learned this business through his own initiative. At the house where he lives, he has the space and sufficient infrastructure, they will work an average of 3 hours each day at this business. 

Nelson, with this loan, hopes that his economic situation will improve and he will be able to give his wife a better future. Nelson is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and help offered.

loans.use: to undertake a business raising pigs and in this way be able to give a better future to his wife and to grow together.

loans.name: Cristian Giovanny

texts.es:
Cristian, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el negocio que tiene desde hace tres años es atender una peluquería, es una persona reconocida por su honestidad y responsabilidad, por el momento no representa dificultades.
El capital le servirá para comprar equipo para cortar cabello, de esta manera pretende atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos para resarcir deuda.
Su visión es mantener el crecimiento de su negocio, ser una persona que ayude a cambiar la sociedad y dar a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Cristian lives with his wife and children. The business that he has had for three years is running a barbershop. He is a person well-known for his honesty and responsibility, and for the time being doesn't have any difficulties.

The loan will serve him to purchase tools to cut hair, in this way he plans to attract new customers, improve his services, and increase his income to pay off his debt.

His vision is to maintain the growth of his business, be a person who helps to change society, and give his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase tools to cut hair, in this way he plans to attract new customers.

loans.name: Bleidis Johana

texts.es: Bleidis de 26 años es una polifacética mujer que ha alcanzado el éxito gracias a su dinamismo, compromiso y dedicación, ella reside en el municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos y cuenta con siete años de experiencia ofreciendo servicio de manicure y pedicure y ventas por intermedio de catálogos especializados.  Ella buscó oportunidades de negocio con la intensión de aportar a los gastos en el hogar y diariamente está disponible para ofrecer sus servicios a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.   Como su capital es insuficiente para responder a los encargos de sus clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar productos del catálogo; cremas, perfumes, accesorios y demás.  Bleidis considera que esta inversión permitirá acortar los tiempos de entrega y con ello su flujo de efectivo.  Su meta a futuro es tener casa propia y continuar ofreciéndole estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bleidis, 26 years old, is a multifaceted woman who has achieved great success thanks to her dynamism, commitment and dedication. She lives in the municipality of Barranquilla with her spouse and children and has seven years of experience offering manicure and pedicure services and selling from specialized catalogs. She sought business opportunities with the intention of contributing to the household expenses and very day she is available to offer her services from 7am to 8pm. As her capital is not sufficient to respond to her customers' orders, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase catalog products: creams, perfumes, accessories, and more. Bleidis thinks that this investment will allow her to reduce the delivery time and, with that, her cash flow. 

Her goal for the future is to have her own house and continuing offering her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase products from catalogs: creams, perfumes, accessories and more.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 12 años que estudian en universidad y colegio y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para conseguir sus propios recursos y así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, ella es comisionista de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, cremas, perfumería y bisuterías). Tiene  más de 120 personas a  su cargo a las mismas que ella tiene que surtir de productos de acuerdo a sus ventas, ella también vende en sus ratos libres y así se gana algo extra. Ella lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la misma que espera seguir mejorando y más con la ayuda de los créditos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cosméticos, cremas  y otros productos. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y necesarios. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio loan group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches that are highly visited all year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Maria lives in this place. She is 44 years old, married, and in this relationship has two children, ages 20 and 12, who are university and secondary school students and still live in her house. Her husband is a security guard.

María is a woman who likes to help herself to get her own resources and in this way help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education, so she works in sales. She is a Avon commission agent (beauty products, cosmetics, creams, perfumes, and costume jewelry). She has over 120 people under her, who she has to stock with products according to their sales. She also sells in her free time and in this way earns something extra. She has been doing this work for more than 8 years, which she hopes to continue improving and more with the help of the loans. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in the loan group for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are quick and needed. Her dreams are to continue improving her life and giving her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Taque Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAQUE CHUYMA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa para bebé, venta de materiales escolares, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de videos, venta de chompas de lana, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para bebé; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa para bebé por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Taque Chuyma communal bank will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center. It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors. Sonia is the president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied and among them are selling baby clothes, selling school materials, transportation service, selling clothes, selling videos, selling wool sweaters, and selling food. The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Sonia is a member.

She says that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago. She joined by invitation from a friend, who is a client of the institution. Sonia now has a business selling baby clothes. She says that she set up this business several years ago, and she learned on her own incentive.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy baby clothes wholesale), which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will later sell the clothes at the fairs in the city of El Alto. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is in a common-law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani, who is in his mid 30's, is married with one kid who is still at school. He has been running a retail shop for seven years now. He works from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a decent monthly profit.

This will be Ramadhani's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items in his shop and buy new items. He has successfully paid back all his loans. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profits to pay school fees, to repay the loans, bought a TV set and a plot of land, reinvested in his business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to expand and upgrade his retail shop. He dreams of improving his shop.

Ramadhani will share this loan with his loan group, Manzese B, which has two members. Each will hold the other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand and upgrade his retail shop.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. Gertrudes is married and has a "buy-and-sell" used clothing business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Gertrudes has been in this business for five years now.

Gertrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Silpa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Silpa works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a laundry shop. Silpa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials like clay, sand, etc. for her pottery-making business.

Silpa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay, sand, etc. for her pottery-making business.

loans.name: Jeorre Ann

texts.en:
Jeorre Ann is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Jeorre Ann has borrowed and paid back 2 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Jeorre Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosemarie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 4 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicks and feed in order to raise chickens for food.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 59-year-old woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has 10 adult children. 

To earn a living, Virginia and her husband are engaged in a fishing business, and have been doing it for 41 years. Aside from fishing, Virginia’s husband is a carpenter. They work hard for their family. With this, Virginia is asking a loan to buy a new fishing net to improve their livelihood. In the future, she wants to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Isagani Jr.

texts.en:
Isagani Jr. is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his piggery business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family.

Recently, he availed himself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from his project of additional concrete pig pens, he thought of adding some head of pigs for commercial sale.

Someday he hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.
