loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
John Virgel is 19 years old. He is the third of five children in the family. His mother, Marjorie, is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon. She supports her family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

John Virgel is studying for a Bachelor of Secondary Education (BSED) Major in Filipino and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Marjorie is borrowing 3,900 PHP to pay for her son's tuition fees for the semester.

When he graduates, John Virgel plans to be gainfully employed and help his parents to earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rita Trinidad

texts.es: Rita es una ama de casa que decidió emprender su propio negocio desde la comodidad de sus vivienda, ella analizo que los fines de semana sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector que suelen departir, se reúnen a consumir cervezas y refrescos, entonces Rita no dudó ni un instante que su negocio seria todo un éxito y hoy en día cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes  que continuamente compran esta bebidas.  Su demanda cada vez es mayor y su capital insuficiente para responder, por esta situación está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en canastas de cervezas y gaseosas.  Con esta inversión logrará incrementar las ventas y podrá acercarse a su meta de negocio; climatizar el salón que tiene disponible para atender a sus clientes.  Así mismo continuará apoyando a sus cuatro hijos mayores de edad.
texts.en:
Rita is a housewife who decided to open her own business from the comfort of her home.  She realized that on the weekends neighbors and pedestrians, who normally leave, meet to consume beer and soda.  Rita didn't doubt for a moment that her business would be a success, and today has a great number of customers who continually buy these beverages.

Demand is greater every time, and her capital insufficient to respond.  Because of this situation, she is applying her first Kiva loan (through the intermediary Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to invest in cases of beer and soda.  With this investment, she will be able to step up sales and will be able to get closer to her business goal of air-conditionaing the room available to assist her customers.  Likewise, she will continue helping her four adult children.

loans.use: invest in cases of beer and soda.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 60 years old and has managed a sari-sari store (convenience store) for more than 20 years. She is known in Tudela, Misamis Occidental for this type of business. Her store sells a variety of consumable goods commonly used by ordinary households. 

Felicisima has had good fortune through this business. She took the opportunity to sign up for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access its financial assistance to expand her business. Felicisima successfully repaid all of her loans without records of default. 

Currently, she requests another loan to purchase additional inventories of consumable goods like coffee, noodles, milk, sugar, canned goods, and others.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of consumable goods like coffee, noodles, milk, sugar, canned goods, and others.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 56-year-old widow with four adult children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

Teodora is engaged in farming corn and her children assist her in cultivating their land. To augment their corn production, Teodora needed additional capital to finance labor costs for land preparation, and to buy fertilizers for a good harvest. Thus, she became a member of Paglaum MPC after learning about it from her neighbors who are members of the cooperative. 

Teodora is grateful to the cooperative because she can now cultivate the nearby land. Recently, she availed a loan of 9,000 PHP to pay for plowing, harrowing and additional bags of fertilizers in order to prepare her land.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, harrowing and additional bags of fertilizers in order to prepare her land.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 43 years old, married, and has two children of school age. She is a resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

She has been engaged in livestock raising for more than ten years. She raises cows, carabaos, goats, and pigs. This livestock-raising business provides her income that supports her family's needs.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional head of livestock to grow and sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional head of livestock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is 27 years old and one of her children is in school.

Gemma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maymouna

texts.en:
Maymouna is a 53-year-old married mother of four children. 30 years ago, she started tailoring clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Maymouna is a hard worker with professional skills in this domain. She is well known among her region and has loyal customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's Field Partner, Al Majmoua, to develop her business. She will buy a car which will facilitate her work and allow her to transport goods and deliver items to her customers.

Maymouna hopes to expand her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport goods and deliver items to her customers.

loans.name: Eteva

texts.en:
Eteva is a 66-year-old mother with nine children. She is still fit and strong to run her business of selling taro and banana at the market with the help of her children. 

Eteva requested a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves. These items will help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Oscar Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es un  hombre muy luchador, de estado civil soltero pero tiene dos hijos de 8 meses y 2 años de edad los mismos que viven con la mamá, vive en el Recinto San Tadeo ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha, su gente es muy trabajadora y unida. 
Don Oscar viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por lo que tuvo que salir a buscar trabajo actualmente vive y trabaja en una granja avícola de este sector, desea emprender en la crianza de pollos broiler aprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia cuenta con la experiencia suficiente tiene listos los galpones les dedicará un promedio de 4 horas diarias a esta actividad   debido a que deben limpiar y estar pendientes de que todas las aves se encuentren  en buenas condiciones ya que son animales de mucho cuidado. 
Don Oscar tiene muchos sueños por cumplir uno de ellos es tener su negocio propio y dedicarse solo a esta actividad para poder lo necesario a sus hijos. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Oscar a mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos que es su razón de luchar día a día, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como él que por falta de oportunidades y recursos económicos no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oscar is a very determined man. He is single but has two children who are eight months and two years old and live with their mother. Oscar lives in the rural community of San Tadeo, located in the northwestern part of the Pichincha Province. The people there are very hard working and united.

Oscar comes from a family with few financial resources, which caused him to leave in search of work. Currently he lives and works at a poultry farm in this sector. He wants to start raising his own broiler chickens. He learned this business through his own initiative and has the necessary experience. His chicken coops are ready, and he will dedicate an average of four hours a day to this work. Since he must keep them clean and make sure that they have everything they need to stay in good condition, they are animals that require a lot of care.

Oscar has many dreams that he wants to achieve. One of them is to have his own business and to work at it as his sole occupation so that he can provide for his children. This loan will help Oscar improve his quality of life and give his children a better future. This is what he fights for every day. He is thankful to KIVA for the support that they are providing to people like him, who haven't been able to fulfill their dreams because of lack of opportunity and financial resources.

loans.use: to start his own business raising poultry so that, with this income, he can continue to provide for his children.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a sari-sari store owner from Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 61-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver of a passenger boat, and they work hard for their livelihood. Her children are already grown up and have their own families. 

Eva is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, spices, toiletries, eggs, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and powdered chocolate drinks. In the future, she wishes to expand her business to better their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, toiletries, eggs, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and powdered chocolate drinks.

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa is a 54-year-old mother with six children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living.

Palepa requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business.

She will expand her business using her profit and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast.

loans.name: Sui

texts.en:
Sui is 18 years old and single. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printed material at the market to earn a living.

Sui requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers to assist her in running the business.

She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a married woman with four children. She is 36 years old and three of her children are in school.

Rosenie is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a purified water retail business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more purified water to resell.

Rosenie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more purified water to resell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in business for three years now.

Amy requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice. In the future, Amy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married with one child. She lives in an urban community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Mary makes and sells shell money (traditional money) at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Mary needs a loan to buy bags of sea shells, string, nylon rope and a hand drill for her business. She hopes to cover her family's weekly expenses with the profits she makes.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of sea shells, string, nylon rope and a hand drill for her business.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Meswalehe has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. In addition, she also operates a grocery business. She faces major challenges of seasonality and keeping perishables that lead to losses.

With the 8,500 KES, Meswalehee wants to purchase a solar light to use in her business at night. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light to use in her business at night.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SOLIDARIAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Catalina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de libros, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Catalina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, de sus padres, con el pasar del tiempo y un pequeño capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Solidarias" will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch regional office. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board where Catalina is the President. The businesses that are carried out by the members of the group are varied, among them are: cosmetic sales, book sales, vegetable sales, food sales, and clothing sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Catalina is a member She mentions that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant that is part of the institution. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She mentions that she learned this trade many years ago from her parents, and with the passing of time and a little capital she decided to start an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now will increase her capital to buy vegetables at wholesale. She will obtain them from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training workshops and the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Crescila

texts.en:
Crescila is a 51-year-old woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has four adult children. Her husband is a fisherman, and Crescila runs a sari-sari store business. She has been in business for six years. 

To improve their livelihood, Crescila is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as chips, biscuits, spices, candies, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drinks and juice. In the future, she wants to expand her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, spices, candies, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drinks and juice.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Aiza has been in this business for two years now. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials. In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Xy-Za

texts.en:
Xy-za is married and works hard to support her family.

She has an Internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Xy-za is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy new computer supplies for her Internet café business.

Xy-za has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new computer supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 68-year-old widow, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Myrna requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a 40-year-old mother with eight children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

To assist her run the business, Donna requested a loan to buy plastic bags, sacks of flour and rice, and boxes of chicken, tinned fish, vegetable oil, milk, and sausage. She will expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, sacks of flour and rice, and boxes of chicken, tinned fish, vegetable oil, milk, and sausage.

loans.name: Temis Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Temis, tiene  46 años de edad, es  divorciada y de esa relación tiene 4 hijos, 2  mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en un colegio de la localidad, actualmente ella mantiene una relación de unión libre y su esposo tiene un taller mecánico.
Doña Temis es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su labor ayudar a su marido a salir adelante, ella tienen un negocio en su casa, allí vende aceites, líquidos de frenos, compresores, tubos, llantas, aros y otros repuestos de carros, ella aprovecha que su esposo tiene un taller al lado de su negocio y su marido recomienda lo que ella vende y así vende mucho mas, a ella le encanta su negocio ya que se gana algo por el bien de su familia y pasa bastante tiempo con su marido lo cual le gusta mucho.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar aceites, liquido de frenos, compresores, llantas y tubos. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños es que su negocio sea más grande y surtido.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited all year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Temis lives. She is 46 years old and divorced. From that relationship, she has 4 children, 2 who are grown and 2 who are 17 and 12 and in the local high school. Right now, she is in a common law marriage and her husband has a mechanic's shop. 

Temis is a woman who likes to work, and she works to help her husband get ahead. She has a business in her house where she sells oils, brake fluids, compressors, tubes, tires, rims and other replacement parts. She takes advantage of the fact that her husband has a shop next to her business and her husband recommends what she sells so she sells more. She loves her business because she earns something for the good of the family and she spends a lot of time with her husband, which she really likes.

She is going to use this loan to buy oils, brake liquid, compressors, tires and tubes. She has been in the credit group for 3 cycles and she likes it because the loans are quick and don't have so many requirements. Her dream is for her business to be bigger and well stocked.

loans.use: to buy oils, brake fluid, compressors, tires and tubes.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 22 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Aiza has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Aiza requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, chips, bread, spices, etc. She borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, chips, bread, spices, etc.

loans.name: Los Manguitos Group

texts.es:
En cierta comunidad mexiquense rodeada por extensos campos llenos de maíz se integró el grupo Los Manguitos. Los habitantes tienen un profundo respeto y cariño por la tierra ya que ésta les proporciona alimento y bienestar. Las tradiciones son de gran importancia por lo que acostumbran hacer fiestas con mucha música, colores, adornos y alimentos tradicionales.
   Nayeli es una persona extremadamente alegre y trabajadora, desde hace 10 años  ha compartido su vida con Cesar y juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos de los cuales uno estudia la educación primaria. En el mismo momento en que decidió formar una familia también inició con la cría de cerdos para aportar ingresos en el hogar. Dicha actividad fue inspirada por su suegra, "cuando yo llegue a vivir con mi suegra ella ya criaba muchos cerditos y los vendía muy bien por eso decidí hacerlo por mi cuenta" comentó entusiasmada. Actualmente compra los animales desde pequeños y cuida de ellos hasta que alcanzan un peso ideal para después venderlos con clientes de la comunidad. Con el préstamo podrá comprar bultos de alimento ya que suelen subir de precio constantemente.
   Adicionalmente a su actividad, se dedica a vender recipientes de plástico desde hace tres años, en un inicio solo era vendedora informal pero actualmente es promotora y a su cargo tiene a 20 personas por lo que sólo trabaja tres días a la semana. "Me encanta tener contacto con las personas sobre todo ahora que tengo un equipo de trabajo que debo apoyar para que cumplan sus metas" agregó Nayeli. Por ahora la meta que tiene en mente es terminar de construir su casa y por ello tiene planeado invertir el préstamo en mejorar sus actividades.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Amanda, Brigida y Don Pedro quienes invertirán en sus la cría de cerdos; Monica Janeth, en sus borreguitos y Blanca Angélica en tortillas.
*La fotografía muestra a Nayeli quien se encuentra en cuclillas y viste un suéter café.
texts.en:
The Los Manguitos group was organized in a Mexican community surrounded by huge cornfields.  The residents have deep respect and feeling for their land, which provides them food and wellbeing.  Traditions are of great importance so they often have fiestas with a lot of music, color, and traditional food and dress.  Nayeli is a very happy, hard-working person.  She has shared her life with Cesar during the past 10 years and together they have formed a family of two children, one of whom is in primary school.  At the time they decided to start a famly they also begin growing pigs to earn income at home. 

  Nayeli's mother-in-law  gave her the idea for this work, "When I came to live with my mother-in-law she already was caring for many pigs and getting good sales, so I decided to do the same on my own, " Nayeli says with enthusiasm.   She now buys the animals when they are small and raises them till they reach an ideal weight for sale to customers in her community.  With the loan she will be able to buy food in bulk which keeps going up in price.  

   In addition to this work, Nayeli has been selling plastic containers for the past three years.  At first she just sold them informally but now she promotes them and is in charge of 20 other people, so only works three days a week.  I love to work with people above all now that I have a means of work that I can support so they fulfill their goals, " added Nayeli.   For now,  the goal she has in mind is to finish building her house, and she has planned to invest the loan in improving her activities.   The most recent members of the group are Amanda, Brigida and  Pedro, who will invest in her care of pigs;  Monica Janeth, in her small items made of sheepskin and Blanca Angelica in tortillas.  The photograph shows Nayeli, crouching, wearing a  dark colored sweater.

loans.use: buy feed for animals in bulk

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, El Oro

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 21 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de su abuelita que es como su mamá. 
Doña María es una joven mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse lo propio y con sus recursos poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su abuelita con los gastos de la casa, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a vender tres o cuatro días por semana en horarios variados ya que no cuenta con horarios fijos, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 2 años con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited all year around and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where María lives. She is 21 years old, single and lives in her grandmother's house. Her grandmother is like her mother.

María is a young woman who likes to work to earn her own living and with her resources get ahead and help her grandmother with the household expenses. She is a merchant who sells all kinds of clothing and shoes door to door. She goes out to sell three or four days a week with a varying schedule and has no set times. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has had this business for 2 years and it allows her to get ahead.  

This loan is to buy clothes and shoes. She has been in the credit group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Desde hace 27 años, Pastora estableció un cafetín para poder combinar su talento en la cocina con buenos ingresos para su familia, negocio que al tiempo sirvió para sustentar a sus cuatro hijos luego de quedar viuda. A sus 69 años de edad, esta emprendedora se siente más que unida a su familia, por lo que cada día sueña seguir siendo un ejemplo para ellos, a pesar que ya son independientes.
Pastora cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y con unas remesas que vienen desde el exterior, por lo que se siente segura de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar las tuberías de aguas negras de su cafetín y así tener una mejor proyección de su local y mejorar la calidad de su atención. En sus planes está que en un futuro pueda seguir haciendo mejoras en su negocio, pero también en su hogar, principalmente en las tuberías también.
texts.en:
Twenty seven years ago, Pastora opened a cafe to combine her cooking talents with good income for her family. This business served her to support her four children after she was widowed. At 69 years old, this entrepreneur feels more than close to her family and she dreams of continuing to be an example for them, despite them being grown and on their own. 

Pastora has the support of her children and some remittances from abroad. That is why she feels secure in continuing to invest in her business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy sewage pipes for her cafe so she can improve her locale and improve the service. Among her plans for the future are to continue making improvements on her business, and also in her home, mainly with the plumbing as well.

loans.use: to buy sewage pipes.

loans.name: Concepcion Amparo

texts.es:
El olor de la masa tostándose en el comal, hace una ruta de entrada a la producción de tortillas de Concepción, una mujer de 52 años de edad que desde hace más de 17 años vende nacatamales los fines de semanas y tortillas diariamente. Siendo madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos menores de edad, sirven de inspiración y de apoyo, junto a su esposo, para salir adelante con su negocio.
Ahora siente que es el momento de invertir de lleno en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y bolsas para aumentar su producción y obtener grandes ganancias. Su sueño es tener más clientes y llevar a cabo la pulpería que siempre ha querido tener.
texts.en:
The aroma of masa toasting on the comal makes an entry route to the Concepción's tortilla business. She is a 52 years old and for more than 17 years she has sold nacatamales on the weekends and tortillas every day. She is the mother of five children, two of whom are minors. They are her inspiration and support, along with her husband, for her to get ahead in her business. 

She feels now is the time to invest fully in her business and so she is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood and bags to increase production and make better profits. Her dream is to have more customers and open a store like she has always wanted to do.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Alicia has been in this business for 18 years now. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La pulpería de Luz ha ido creciendo a medida que pasan los años. Especialmente, en el último año, esta emprendedora de 53 años de edad decidió hacer un préstamo significativo, con el que pudo comprar más granos básicos y otros productos que tanto piden sus clientes, y con el que pudo ampliar cada vez su venta.
Por esta razón Luz se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le apoyaron con ese crédito y ahora quiere volver a extender su mano para el apoyo de una segunda ayuda con la que pretende comprar más arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, café, pasta de dientes, entre otros productos de gran demanda. Con esto podrá ahorrar dinero, ya que comprará por mayor y obtendrá descuento que podría invertir en su hogar. En sus planes está hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Luz's grocery store has been growing over the years. Specially this last year, this enterprising 53 year old woman decided to take out a big loan with which she was able to buy more basic grains and other products that are in demand from her customers and with which she was able to expand her sales. For this reason, Luz is very grateful to all the people who supported her with this loan, and now she wants to ask for support for a second help. With it, she wants to buy more rice, beans, sugar, sweets, coffee, toothpaste, among other high demand products. With this, she will be able to save money, because she will buy at wholesale prices and get a discount that she will be able to invest in her household. One of her plans is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, sugar, sweets, coffee, toothpaste, among other products.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailer business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Amie has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Amie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: To earn a living, Nerissa is selling dry goods in the community of Carles, Iloilo. She is 46 years old and has six children. Two of them are still attending school. Nerissa’s husband is deceased, so she is working alone to provide for the needs of her children. Nerissa is aiming to increase her livelihood to provide for the basic needs of her family. For that, she needs additional capital to buy assorted goods such as slippers, shoes, shirts, and pants, and to buy school supplies such as assorted papers, crayons, paste, watercolors and scissors.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, shirts, pants, assorted papers, crayons, paste, watercolors and scissors

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is 36 years old with 8 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Epenesa requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013. She will use her profit for home improvement and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Teuila

texts.en: Teuila is a 43-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs and operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and a box of sausage for her business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and a box of sausage

loans.name: Igilio

texts.es: Igilio tiene 63 años de edad vive en la comunidad Pungul es casado y tiene tres hijos el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia para la producción de leche, solicita el credito para comprar una vaca para obtener mayor producción de leche y hacer quesos para vender cada semana en Guaranda, gracias al crédito podra mejorar su economia, el sueño de el es que sus hijos sean unas buenas personas y sepan valorar la vida, los desafios a los que se enfrenta son la falta de servicios basicos en la comunidad. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Igilio, 63, is married and has three children.  He lives in Pungul and has a farming and dairy cattle business.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy another dairy cow.  He will use the extra milk the cow produces to increase his milk sales and to make cheese that he will sell in Guaranda.  The investment will generate more income for supporting his family.  
Igilio's greatest hope for the future is that his children know how precious life is and become good men and women.  His greatest challenge is the lack of basic services here.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, está acompañada y su pareja es empleada, trabaja en un taller de mecánica y tienen dos hijos que están estudiando y con ellos vive su suegro.

Alba, se dedica al comercio de antojitos desde hace dos años y lo aprendió por medio de su tía, su horario de trabajo es de 2:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una plancha y construir un cafetín para vender pupusas y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Su sueño es construir su propia casa, además quiere tener su propia pupuseria y las ganancias las invertirán en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alba and her partner have two children, both in school.  Her partner is a mechanic and works for a local garage.  Her partner's father lives with the family.  

Alba has operated a food sales business, making and selling pupusas, for two years.  Her aunt had a similar business and taught her everything that she needed to know to start her own business.  She works from 2:00pm to 5:00pm.

Alba is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to build a stand from which she can sell the food she makes.  She will use the rest to buy equipment for making pupusas.  The investment will help her to bring in the money she needs to provide for her children's schooling.  

Alba tells us that she hopes to build a house one day.

loans.use: to build a stand and buy equipment for her food sales business.

loans.name: Maria Elina

texts.es: Elina, una madre soltera que tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, Esta mujer luchadora desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida y comenta que tiene muchos clientes que visitan su restaurante, Elina  saco adelante a sus hijos por medio de su negocio, Elina solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  productos para preparar almuerzos, desayunos, comidas rápidas y entre otros productos que ofrece en su restaurante. En la actualidad Elina  vive con 2 hijos que ya son independientes ya que trabajan pero cuando tienen  tiempo le apoyan a su madre en su local de comida. La aspiración de Elina es continuar con su negocio de toda la vida y luchar hasta que pueda y asi tener una vejez digna.
texts.en:
Elina is a single mother who has three adult children. Since she was very young, this feisty woman has worked in selling food, and she has many customers who visit her restaurant. Elina used her business to give her children a good life. 

Elina requests this loan to invest in buying products to prepare lunches, breakfasts, and fast foods among other products that she offers in her restaurant. Currently, Elina lives with two of her children who are already independent since they work. But when they have time, they support their mother in her business. 

Elina’s aspiration is to continue her business for the rest of her life, work hard while she can, and that way live well into old age.

loans.use: to buy products for preparing meals

loans.name: Teletita

texts.en:
Teletita is an 18-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printed materials at the market to earn a living.

Teletita requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, and elei designs to assist her in running the business.

She hopes to expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, and elei designs.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a cashew nuts business for the past 15 years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Roya

texts.en:
Roya is a 40 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children, all of whom are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider, and she doesn't work. She cares solely for the home and family.

Currently, with the aim of paying her child's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her child and this is her only target.

loans.use: to pay her child's study fees.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 55 years old and married with three children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elvira aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analine

texts.en:
Analine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like a restaurant.

Analine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Julia Bersabe

texts.es:
Julia, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, estudio hasta sexto grado y está soltera.
Julia, tiene una venta de comida desde hace más de 20 años, que logró colocar con el apoyo de su mamá, una sobrina y su mamá le ayudan en la preparación de la comida, además del comedor tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación.  

El préstamo que Julia, está solicitando será invertido para reparar las mesas y sillas de su comedor, porque se le han dañado y quiere atender mejor a sus cliente, también necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería para su tienda, porque están cerca las fiestas patronales de su pueblo y quiere aprovechar para surtir el negocio y tener productos varios para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Julia, quiere seguir trabajando como lo ha venido haciendo hasta ahora y como no tiene hijos planea dejarle la herencia del comedor a la sobrina que le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Julia, 52, is single.  She left school after the sixth grade and has worked hard to build her own food sales business.  She and her mother started the business more than 20 years ago.  Her mother still helps make the food they sell and they count on other help from one of Julia's nieces.  Julia runs the canteen from a space in her house and operates a small general store there, as well.  

Julia is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to refurbish the tables and chairs that she uses for the canteen.  The refurbishment will ensure that her customers are more comfortable.  She will use the rest of the loan to stock her store with merchandise that her customers will want for the town's upcoming festival.  

Julia hopes to continue working, just as she has done for these many years.  She has no heirs, but she wants to leave a going business to her niece.

loans.use: to refurbish the tables and chairs she uses for her food sales business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 28-year-old single young man from Gaza city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Omar is a student at the university where he studies Graphic Design. He wants to complete a BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Omar took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fermin is 49 years old, and her child is in school.

Fermin has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Fermin has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Arlyn works hard to support her family. She has a selling rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Arlyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her selling rice grains business.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, que ha luchado por sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella no estudio, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, actualmente vive con su mamá y sus dos hijos que están estudiando.  

María, vende enchiladas, pasteles de carne, empanadas, entre otros y pero también vende pupusas tres veces por semana en su casa y los domingos va a vender al campo de futbol con sus hijos. 

El préstamo que está solicitando será invertido para comprar maíz, carne, tomates, plátanos, entre otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus productos, pero también necesita repara el local que tiene en la cancha de futbol, porque tiene algunos daños y tiene que repararlos.

María, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales universitarios y que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades que las que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
María, 50, is a single mother with two children, both in school.  She lives with her children and her mother.  María never went to school, but she has managed to build her own food sales business, making and selling enchiladas, meat pies, empanadas and other prepared foods.  She normally runs the business from her house but on Sundays she and her children operate the business from her food stall at the local soccer fields.  

María is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy the supplies she needs--meat, maize, tomatoes, etc.--to make the foods she sells.  She will use the rest of the loan to make repairs to her food stall.

María's greatest hope for the future is that her children go on to college and have the opportunities to get ahead that she herself never had.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and buy the supplies she needs to carry on her food sales business.

loans.name: Roeurm's Group

texts.en:
Roeurm is 44 years old and a married mother of four dependent children, one of whom is under school-age and needs her support. She lives in Pursat province, where she has been growing rice for 24 years on four hectares of farmland to earn her main source of income. In addition, she fishs to get more additional income. The crops were threatened by drought and rats. This really affects her family’s income.

Now Roeurm is leading a group of two members to apply for a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan enabled her to upgrade the standard of living and buy more household supplies.

As the group leader, Roeurm will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crops well. She hopes she can earn more income from her business to start a new business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crops well.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For the past four years she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers shop. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Josefina has a footwear sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional footwear to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional footwear to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Hace nueve años, María se vio inspirada en emprender su propio negocio y aportar en los ingresos del hogar junto a su esposo, por esta razón compró cosméticos y ropa con sus ahorros, para poder obtener ganancias y seguir apoyando a sus dos hijos en su crecimiento académico.
Esta emprendedora de 34 años de edad se siente muy motivada por seguir creciendo junto a su familia, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa y cosméticos para seguir ofreciendo variedad y calidad a sus clientes de su vecindario y de la zona franca cercana. En un futuro se mira en su propio tramo en un mercado capitalino para llegar a más gente y tener un lugar estable.
texts.en:
Nine years ago Maria was inspired to start her own business and bring additional income into the household along with her husband's. She bought cosmetics and clothing with her savings and then sold them to support her two children through school.

This 34-year old entrepreneur feels motivated to continue moving forward along with her family. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy clothing and cosmetics to continue offering variety and quality merchandise to her customers in the vicinity and nearby free zone.

In the future Maria sees herself in her own permanent premises in one of the markets in the capital city where more people can access.

loans.use: buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años de edad ella es soltera vive solo y se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para engordarla y luego venderla, ella compra y vende el ganado en el mercado de Guaranda,su sueño es tener mas ganado para la producción de leche y hacer quesos para tener otra fuente de ingreso para sus gastos, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer y hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en:
65-year old Rosa is single and lives alone. She is a farmer and buys and sells livestock. She is seeking a loan to buy a cow which she will fatten and then sell. 

Rosa buys and sells in the Guaranda market. Her dream is to have more cows and produce more milk and make cheese. Then she will have another source of income. In her spare time she enjoys knitting and doing communal labour in the community.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
El último préstamo de Petrona fue de gran ayuda para el incremento de ingresos de esta emprendedora, que lleva más de 22 años en la elaboración de zapatos, puesto que con este pudo comprar cuero, pegamentos ebillas, entre otros materiales para para realizar su trabajo. Por esta razón, ella quiere agradecer a todas las personas que ayudaron con ese crédito que la ayudado a crecer. 
Ahora a sus cincuenta años de edad, Petrona desea volver a invertir, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para comprar suelas, cuero, y pegamento para zapatos. Con esta materia prima para elaborar calzado, le permitirá hacer una producción de calidad y aumentar sus ventas. Al cancelar este crédito, desea seguir invirtiendo para aumentar aún más su producción.
texts.en:
Petrona has been making shoes for 22 years and says that a past loan was a huge help to her business.  This enterprising woman used that loan to buy the supplies she needed--buckles, soles, glue, etc.--for making shoes and, because of the investment, saw her income increase.  She wants her lenders to know that she is grateful for their support and that she was able to use their loans to grow her business.

Petrona, at 50-years old, wants to continue investing in her business.  She is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy leather, glue, soles and other supplies for carrying on her business.  The investment will allow her to make good-quality shoes and increase her sales.  She adds that she hopes to use future loans to continue expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shoe manufacturing business.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Ana realiza el crédito para ayudarle su esposo el cual tiene un taxi y necesita ciertos repuestos y arreglos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella lleva más de 8 años dedicada  a esta activ idad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos y refacciones para carro, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son mejorar su vida y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much frequented all year long and for being a city with unmatched beauty and many tourist attractions.

58-year old Sra. Ana lives here. She is married and has four adult children, two of whom still live at home. Her husband is a driver. Ana needs a loan to help her husband whose taxi needs repairs so he can provide a better service to his customers. As well as helping her husband Ana has a business selling clothing from a catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works three days a week two to three hours a day. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has done this activity for more than 8 years and it is going well for her. 

This loan will be used to buy spare parts and repair the taxi, as well as perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. This is Ana's fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to improve her standard of living and have good health.

loans.use: buy spare parts and repair the taxi, as well as perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Pasa

texts.en:
Pasa is 21 years old and single. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Pasa requested a loan banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima, who is in her late 30s is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 3pm to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jemima's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of drinks and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, repaid the loan and covered the household expenses. She will use this loan to start selling airtime. She dreams of building her own house.

Jemima will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to start selling airtime.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Letecia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, expand her business and support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Estebana

texts.es: Estebana es una mujer de 64 años de edad que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de elaboración y venta de vestir, además presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 28 años por días lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Estebana vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 26 años de edad a los que logro sacar adelante como madre soltera a base de mucho esfuerzo, y ahora ellos le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. La vivienda en la que vive Estebana se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que ella desea cambiar las láminas de las paredes y techo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas de las paredes y techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Estebana is a 64-year-old woman who strives to get ahead every day through her business making and selling clothing.  She also has offered domestic services for the last 28 years which allow her to obtain better income.  

Estebana lives with her two children, 22 and 26 years old, who she managed to support as a single mother with much effort.  They now help her with the costs of home.  

The house in which Estebana lives has deteriorated, so she wants to change the sheets on the walls and roof.  For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to change the metal sheets of the walls and roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to change the metal sheets on the walls and roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fishing net, torch, containers, ice bags and a canoe.

loans.name: Namngom Group

texts.en:
Phone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Phone and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Phone and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Phone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Chomthong Group

texts.en:
Lianxay understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Lianxay knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Lianxay purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Lianxay is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and has two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice bran for her pigs. Cecile has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and rice bran for her pigs.

loans.name: Houeylek Group

texts.en: Hong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  ]Hong and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits. Hong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within these 2 years, filter users, like Hong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so that they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Susana is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nanjok07-15-21G Group

texts.en:
Nang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Nang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Nang and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Nang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Nang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Daokhar Group

texts.en:
Kerd understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for the families of her fellow group members. Kerd knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Kerd purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal as well as decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  

Kerd is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so that they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Sokkea's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Pursat province, Sokkea, who is 27 years old, is married and has two dependent children. Growing rice has been her main business for 20 years, but it has been under danger due to drought and other natural disasters. Since she could not earn good income to support her business and family’s living as before, now she is leading a two-member group to take out a Kiva loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is her first loan cycle. 

Sokkea, the leader, will use her loan to buy a motorbike for the business purpose of her daily commute from home to her rice field. She hopes to improve her living condition and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the business purpose of her daily commute from home to her rice field

loans.name: Kongkham Group

texts.en:
Khamdeng is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.
  
Khamdeng and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs supplies used to treat local water.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Khamdeng and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Khamdeng and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamdeng and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so that they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Georgina Damaris

texts.es:
Georgina, es una ama de casa de espíritu emprendedor, desde su hogar ha incursionado en distintos negocios, que la han hecho convertirse en una comerciante en ascenso. Ella fue beneficiada con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, con el cual pudo comprar ropa y calzado, además gano muchos clientes. 
Dado lo bien que le fue vendiendo ropa y calzado, Georgina ha decidido invertir nuevamente en esto, por eso ha solicitado otro préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar nueva variedad de ropa y calzado, ella cree fielmente que si sigue vendiendo de esta manera pronto podrá abrir una pequeña tienda. Tiene muchos sueños, uno de ello es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos, además de convertirse en una gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Georgina is a housewife with an entrepreneurial spirit. From her home she has tackled different businesses that have made her into a rising businesswoman. She benefited from a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito with which she could buy clothing and footwear; she also gained a lot of customers. 

Since the clothing and footwear sold so well, Georgina decided to invest in that again. That’s why she has requested another loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy a new range of clothing and footwear. She faithfully believes that if she keeps selling this way, soon she will be able to open a small store. 

She has many dreams; one of them is to improve the quality of life of her loved ones and another is to become a great shop owner.

loans.use: to buy a new range of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is a 33-year-old mother with 3 children who runs a small transportation business. Fetu requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint, a car seat, and an air conditioner to provide good service. She will buy another taxi with her profits. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, a car seat, and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Phonsee Group

texts.en:
Kongsee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink unless it has been boiled.  Kongsee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan, it is now affordable.  

Kongsee and her villagers also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years and the  families will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters..

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 29-year-old single woman from a small village near Jinan city. Her father is an employee and earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs.

Muna is a student in the university working on her master's degree. she wants to find  a job to help her family.

Muna took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop. Muna will be able to do her home work and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is 26 years old and married. She lives in small village near Jinan city with her family and  three children. 

Amira raises sheep and lambs in her own yard to sell in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.
She has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed to improve her business and move forward.

Amira is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve a successful  business.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed.

loans.name: Eva Bela

texts.en:
Eva Bela is 42 years old and married with nine children.

Eva Bela works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 17 years and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell.

Eva Bela has previously borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF and earns an income growing rice and raising livestock.

Eva Bela aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is married with three  children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a cosmetic shop. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

She will use the loan to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotion. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotion.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a 42-year-old mother with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business to sell elei printing materials at the market. She hopes to expand her business, but needs a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, a paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, a paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Nuzha

texts.en:
Nuzha is 47 years old and married. She lives in small village near the city of Hebron  with her family and  five children. 

Three years ago, Nuzha started raising sheep and lambs to sell in the local market.  It is a good business but still needs a lot of improvement.
She has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed to help her improve her business.

Nuzha is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with  five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business and additional income selling rice. Clarita is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, shampoo, eggs, and canned goods.

Clarita has  sustained her business through 5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 58 years old and married with three children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 20 years and requests  29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mercy has previously borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF and earns additional income growing sugarcane.

Mercy aspires to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old married mother of four children who has been working in agriculture and her cattle farm since eleven years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is a hard worker and sacrificing mother, as she tries desperately to provide her beloved children with better living conditions. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house especially the bathroom to provide her children with healthy place. 
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house especially the bathroom to provide her children with a healthy home

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Angela who is in her early 40s is married with one child who is still in school. She has been running a pub business for three years now.  She works from 11am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Angela's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the choice of drinks in the pub and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving drinks in her pub.  She dreams of restarting to sell wood again.

Angela will share this loan with her loan group  MAENDELEO which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving drinks in her pub.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 40-years old; she is the mother of five children.
Her son owns a firewood shop, in which he sells pieces of wood and charcoal. He sells firewood mostly to the chefs who cook meal for ceremonies and events. He purchases wood and cuts into pieces through splitting and makes charcoal for reselling purpose. In his area lot of short fall of gas occurs for domestic usage. This is the reason people like to use firewood and charcoal for cooking.

Now the winter season is going to be start and demand for firewood as well. Nowadays; he wants to buy charcoal in bulk so he can sell it to the brick makers, restaurants and to the common people on daily basis.

Therefore, GULNAZ requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to earn maximum profit in this winter season.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal in bulk for her son's firewood selling shop.

loans.name: Layale

texts.en:
Layale is a 33 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Layale and her husband are the main income sources in the family in order to enhance their way of living. She works as a teacher in local school with the aim to provide support for them. 

Today, she hopes to help her child with his education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of the study fees.  In the future, she will be more than happy to see him graduating and achieving his master’s degree. She plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering his study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of the her son's primary school fees

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer humilde y de sonrisa sincera, ella trabaja todos los días muy duro para que su negocio de venta de tortillas salga adelante, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y de su esposo, quienes desean verla siendo una comerciante exitosa. Poco a poco ha logrado comprar insumos de su negocio, como maíz, leña y cal. 
En estos momentos, María, necesita surtirse de materiales primordiales para su venta, por eso solicita un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le permita comprar maíz y leña, dado que en este tiempo de invierno, se pone escaso y muy caro. Ella en su negocio también oferta especias y otros sazonadores de comida. En un futuro desea poner una pulpería.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble woman with a sincere smile.  She works very hard every day so that her business selling tortillas will succeed. She has the support of her daughter and her husband, who hope to see her be a successful businesswoman. 

Little by little she has been able to buy supplies for her business, such as rice, wood and lime.
