Currently Maria needs to stock basic materials to sell. This is why she is seeking a loan from Kiva along with MiCrédito, which will allow her to buy corn and wood since at this time of winter, they become scarce and very expensive. Her business also offers spices and other seasonings for food. 

In the future she would like to open a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fetusiai

texts.en:
Fetusiai is 68 years old with 7 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living with the help of her children. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fetusiai requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2008, and hopes to use her  profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Kava

texts.en:
Kava is a 54 year old mother with 6 children and she runs a small business of providing a good services to people by taxi transportation. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Kava requested for a loan to buy new wheels, paint color, car seat, air conditioning, to help her maintain the good services. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint color, car seat, air conditioning,

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 24-year-old single lady and a Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She learned hairdressing in a specialized institute. Three years ago, Samah started her own hairdressing business inside her house, which helped her to prove herself as a professional in this domain. 

Today, she is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to open her own beauty salon and fully equip it. She is well-know among her region and has her loyal customers. 
She hopes to succeed in her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon and fully equip it

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 64 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa desde hace 36 años, cuando con mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir para ofrecer a sus hijos un lugar adecuado donde vivir, ahora sus hijos tiene hogares propios. José no pudo estudiar por lo que desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar la tierra, pero desde hace 29 años su principal ingreso proviene de prestar sus servicios de seguridad. José desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que actualmente este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar el techo y brindar protección a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose, 64 years old, is a hard-working man who has lived in his own home along with his wife since 36 years ago, when with much effort they were able to buy it in order to offer their children an adequate place to live. Now their children have their own homes. 

Jose was unable to go to school, so from a very young age he learned to cultivate the earth. For the last 29 years though, his main income has been from providing security services.

Jose would like to improve the roof of his home as soon as possible, since it is currently deteriorated.  He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof and offer shelter to his wife.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof and offer shelter to his wife.

loans.name: Zawadi Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Mussa, who is in his early 40s is married with six children, five are still in school and one is still small.  He has been running a transportation business for three years now. He works from 05am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from  Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to service his motorcycle in order to make many trips smoothly.  He dreams of buying another motorcycle.

He will share this loan with his loan group ZAWADI KIGOGO which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle in order to make many trips smoothly.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a business lady who was born in northern part of Tajikistan in to the family of workers. She is living in village with her family. She is widow and is responsible, hardworking and bright person. More than 17 years she does business with sewing women dresses at home. She likes tailoring traditional dresses and serving women. 

She has a child who is sick now and wants to treat him at hospital. She is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON to treat her child at hospital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her child at hospital

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 39-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of four children. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a cobbler and very expert in his profession. He has been making shoes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes through machine, after that attached its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way he is generating income for his family. 

He has been making shoes at home, now he established a shop to continue his business on wide level. But he does not have cash in hand to buy initial raw material for making shoes.
Therefore, Salma requested a loan for her husband so he can buy initial raw material for making shoes.

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy initial raw material for her husband's newly set up shoe making shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband manufacturing business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maiyashi Village. Hamza joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Hamza suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hamza will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hamza now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Amaar

texts.en:
Amaar is 27 years old and married man. he lives in Khan younis city in Gaza strip with his family and he has four children. a few years ago, Amaar started raising sheep and lambs in his own yard to sell as meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

He has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed; this will help his a lot to improve his business and take steps forward in this field.
Amaar is very grateful to everyone who helps his achieve success in his business with this loan. Amaar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed;

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial living conditions of Palestinians in Lebanon, he started eight years ago working in the construction field specialized in Gypsum decor to cover his needs and expenses. 

Ahmad is trying hard to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions. Today, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will help him transport materials and move to his workshops in an easy way. 

Ahmad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport materials and move easily to his workshops

loans.name: Janik

texts.en:
In the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region lives Janik who already once managed to have Kiva partnership. Janik is a farmer and although he worked as a driver for several years he gave it up and farming now is the main and the only occupation as well as the only source of income for his family. 

On the farm Janik has cows, calves, piglets and chickens. Janik’s wife helps him to sell a cheese, milk, butter, meat and eggs. Janik also has a rich orchard full of apple, pear, apricot and plum tree and this harvest Janik sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. 

Now with his second partnership with Kiva Janik wants to buy again fodder for his farm cattle and for his second loan Janik is thankful.

loans.use: to buy again fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children . She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food .

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is the age of 41, living in Lahore, with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He provides services for hair cutting, hair color, groom makeover, shaving etc. Mostly on holidays the customers come for hair cutting. Due to a rush, sometimes he feels difficulties due to bad seating arrangements. He does not have proper place of new customers to wait. This is the reason he wants to furnish his barber shop so his customer can wait till their turn in comfort.

This is the reason she has requested a loan so her husband can furnish his salon and to buy an additional salon equipment “hair steamer machine”. His dream is to convert his barber shop into salon, so he can attract more customers for services.

Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in furnishing his barber shop and to buy a hair streamer machine.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Micro Finance limited , a low income earner and very hard working client. He has decided to acquire a loan of UGX2,000,000 (Two million shillings) to renovate his rentals in the city outskirts of the city.

The purpose of the loan is to  purchase cement, sand, gravel and hard core, paint to raise the housing standards of his tenants. His biggest challenge is tenants that do no want to pay their rent on time and others that flee in the night having spent many months of non payment. 

His future prospect is to set up a commercial building to increase his source of income since he has a large number of dependents. The increased income will be instrumental in helping him to meet his family financial obligations adequately. 

Pictured is Denis and the UGAFODE credit officer(left to right).
He appreciates the services offered to starting enterpreneurs.

loans.use: To renovate his rentals

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old married mother of two children. Three years ago, she opened a grocery shop in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who has a good reputation in her region.

Today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests.

Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new requested items and products

loans.name: Junfang

texts.en:
Junfang is 58 years old woman. She has two children who are both working far away from home. Junfang and her husband began feeding pigs for 3 years . The couples are honest and hardworking and their income also increased in those years. Unfortunately, last year, because of the plague inflection, almost all of their pigs died, which caused great losses for them.  Junfang and her husband had no choice but to stop raising pigs.
 
Junfang lives in a village by the river and the ecological environment is very good, which attracted many tourists to visit. Junfang asked worker to rebuild their old house and to make it a place to offer a small bed and breakfast services for tourists. Redecorating house is a big project, which spent almost all her savings.
 
Junfang request 20,000 from Microcred to purchase furniture and equipment for this project. Her dream is to generate her house into a leisure centre to make it more attractive in the future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and equipment

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from the village of Ba'awa in Kaduna, Nigeria. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to provide a better life for his children. In the past, Ibrahim  suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ibrahim has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare – double the national average in Nigeria – and earn an income of up to $2,000 per hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Ibrahim can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase better quality farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Kizilgul

texts.en:
Kizilgul was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has two children. She works at human resource department in government agency. She is hardworking, capable and generous person that supports and helps any time. 

She wants to get the course of treatment at medical clinic. She feels herself bad. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to be treated at medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to get the course of treatment at medical clinic

loans.name: Toetu

texts.en:
Toetu is 22 years old and single. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Toetu became a member of SPBD in 2015. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags for her business. Toetu will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mercedes works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns income from rice farming and general store businesses.

Mercedes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya and his nice family live in Kapan city of Syunik region and but farming Hrachya runs in a nearby village Tsavi. Hrachya has higher economical education. Now he works as a locksmith at the local combine. Hrachya’s wife is a teacher at the local school. Their two children are school-aged and they attend the school where their mother works. 

Hrachya is engaged in beekeeping and also gardening. He has a lot of bee hives and also perfect honey, which his bees make from various flowers in the wild and in this way producing honey of unbelievable taste, color and quality. 

Hrachya also has nice vegetable and fruit garden; on his plot of land he cultivates potato, beans, garlic and he also has apple, fig and plum trees. Near all the goods he also has a flower garden where grow flowers of different types and colors which nicely decorates the whole farm and on which the bees can feed.

Now this loan Hrachya asks as he has some work connected with his bee keeping.  With this loan amount he will buy several beehives, also wax papers and frames.

loans.use: with this loan amount he will buy several beehives, also wax papers and frames for his bee keeping

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron's raw material such as welding rods, soldering rods and iron's rods for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 30 years old and she lives with her husband, who is a driver and 6 years old daughter in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Regina graduated Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Pedagogy and Pedagogical Methodology. Regina now works of her specialty at the city school and here she works with underdeveloped children and she helps them to become engaged in educational process, to have contact with the surrounding and their classmates. 

She mentions that she does her work with care and love, and each underdeveloped child in her group if manages to have success in education and contact in school or out of the school, she considers it as her and her pupil’s victory, which gives chance to each of them to become integrated in the society like other people. 

Regina also works with these children at her house helping them with their lessons and makes them to overcome hardships in their education. So this loan of 150.000 Armenian drams Regina asks for the purchase of special literature of pedagogical-methodology that she needs very much in her working process with underdeveloped children.

loans.use: for the purchase of special literature of pedagogical-methodology

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 40-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. 
He manufactures the motor bike spare parts, door and windows which usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld the broken accessories.

Few days ago his welding plant has become out of order due to overheating and need to be replacement with new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have cash in hand left due to lots of household expenses. 

Therefore, Saima has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy welding plant for manufacturing. She thanks Kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for her husband's iron accessories manufacturing business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province, Ny is 42 years old and widowed with no children. The main source of her income is from rice cropping. Sometimes, she grows cassava to earn more income. She has been involved in these businesses for 22 years. Destroyed by insects, her crops couldn’t produce high yields.

This is Ny’s first time with VisionFund, and she is taking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her business. She hopes this year's crop yields will be higher so that she can sell it for a higher price, which enables her to save sufficient capital to support her business in the next years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost her clothing business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 37-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee. He started fifteen years ago working in repairing cars to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Ibrahim is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business, thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary updated tools which will help him facilitate his business and provide his customers with better service.
 
Ibrahim hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary updated tools to provide his customers with better service

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en:
Tagisia is a 52 year old mother with 2 children. She runs a business of chicken farm in her village to earn a living. 

Tagisia requested for a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, rope, water tank, to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business using her profit. Tagisia became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knife, rope, water tank,

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Yvonne has been in this business for ten years. Yvonne earns more income from farming rice.

Yvonne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat, 35, is a farmer living in a one bed room house locating in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district and a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and third one is under school age. To support her family’s living condition, she has been growing rice for around sixteen years. Meanwhile, her husband is working as a labor fee in Thailand to earn additional income. 

This is Yat’s first time to take a Kiva loan of 4,000,000KHR via VisionFund. She will get her entire loan in addition to her savings to buy a proper house to accommodate her big family as the kids grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy a proper house to accommodate her big family as the kids grow bigger.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Bolin

texts.en:
Bolin is a 46 year old single man. His wife abandoned him three years ago due the poor family situation, leaving him alone to take care of his elderly father. 

Bolin was a truck driver and operated a business for 20 years. For a long time working outside, he has no time to be with the family members. Bolin quit the job, and to went to find a job in a public transport company.  In 2012, when the income was meager, which could not support the family, Bolin quit his job again and went back to his hometown to start a business by himself. 

He lives in the countryside, which has a lot of land for planting. Bolin planted rice and corn, also including many vegetables and fruits. His elderly father will help him sometime, while for his poor physical condition meant that he could do little. 

Bolin requested 20,000 from Microcred, he wants to purchase some fertilize for those crops. The rest of the money will be used to purchase a combine harvester later. Bolin has a dream of improving the family living standard, to make a better life for himself and also his elderly father.

loans.use: to purchase some fertilizer for his crops and then a combine harvester

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 57 year old mother with 8 children and had a small business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. 

Maria requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
This nice lady is 25 years old and she lives with her parents in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Her name is Marine and she graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Pedagogy and Methodology. She has been working for 5 years at the kinder-garden. 

At her house she also helps some school-aged children to prepare their lessons. Marine is very clever and patient teacher and she likes her work with small children very much. 

Marine asks this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer which she will use to be aware any new innovations in the teaching  sphere.

loans.use: to buy a computer which she will use to be aware any new innovations in the teaching profession

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bakutaje Village. Idris joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Idris will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  

This season, Idris has grand plans to harvest 30 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Idris now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Doka Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  

In the past, Iliya suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Iliya has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. 

With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Iliya can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Mamikon

texts.en:
Mamikon lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Started from 1983 till today Mamikon works as teacher of physics at the nearby village Ddmashen. As he mentions, the experience of the past years shows that usually pupils at the beginning are a little bit afraid of the difficulties of the subject, but slowly they become interested in it and many of them manage to have good results at the end of each semester.
 
Mamikon is married and he lives with his wife and son. Now this loan he needs for the purchase of computer, a desk for it and also professional literature for self-development.

loans.use: purchase a computer and professional literature to help his physics teaching at school and also at home

loans.name: Anjie

texts.en:
Anjie is 21 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anjie has a general store business in the Philippines. Anjie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anjie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anjie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ilich

texts.en:
Ilich is 43 years old and he lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. For several years he worked as a driver and now he is engaged only in farming. Ilich is married and he lives with his wife and daughter. Their son is now at the army doing his military service. 

On the farm, Ilich has cows, bulls, a calf, goats and chickens. With the great help of his kind wife, Ilich has good assortment of farm products for sale. He sells milk, (milk of cows and goats, which is very useful and healing), macun (national dairy-product), cheese and curd and he also sells his farm’s meat and eggs. 

Ilich has no hay field and so he always has great needs for animal fodder purchase. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials and tools for embroidery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She has a green grocery business and has been in business for 7 years. She will use the loan to buy more stock of cabbages, vegetables, tomatoes and onions so as to make more income and support her family. 

She will use the generated profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to expand her grocery and make more income to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cabbages, vegetables, tomatoes and onions so as to make more income and support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new and used shoes for his stall.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Many people find handwritten notes and love letters as more romantic than cellphone texts, online chats or social media messages. Likewise, many still prefer printed photos as sentimental memorabilia than soft copies in USBs or discs, especially in the provinces. 

Nenita, 47, operates a photo studio near a public market in Prosperidad, Agusan Del Norte. Her location is strategic for her business and she can cater to both customers who prefer hard copy or soft copy of photos. She matches her photo printing with selling of photo frames to increase her income. She’s been running this business for thirteen years already and she is paying one employee to help her. There are times when customers line up to wait for their finished orders, and Nenita sees the urgency to procure one more photo printer to meet their needs. She humbly requests for a PHP 15,000 loan for this purpose. Her goal is to put up another branch two to three years from now, and subsequently establish additional business, perhaps a lotto outlet.

Nenita draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and to draw strength the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to procure a photo printer

loans.name: Arcie

texts.en:
Arcie, 36, from Oton, Iloilo drives his tricycle for income. Basically he earns enough to support his family’s basic needs such as food and meager school allowances for his four children, two of whom are in college and the other two are in high school. His wife raises hogs in their backyard but it requires considerable amount of capital for feeds, vitamins and medicines before she can enjoy its profit. Arcie is contemplating on how to expand his livelihood. He aims to buy another unit that he can rent out to his friend to augment his income.

 For now, he desires to buy spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting. He wants to prepare for sudden mechanical problems and to avoid damage in his tricycle that will make it idle for days. He implores your kindness for a loan worth PHP 20,000 for the above purpose. Part of it will be used to buy feed for his hogs. He is determined to enhance his business and operate more units of tricycle someday. This will somehow ensure the future and education of his children.

Arcie meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a widow and she lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region with her younger son (he is still school-aged). 

Marieta’s eldest son now works in the Russian Federation and sends money for his family's needs, while Marieta is busy with the care of her cute farm, where she has several cows and calves. 

The assortment of Marieta’s farm products is limited, and she sells milk, cheese and also some meat. For all these items she has her regular customers who like her farm products and buy only from her. 

Marieta mentions that she would like to make her farm larger and buy some more cattle, but still she cannot realize this plan. Now her farm cattle lack fodder, which is also an urgent problem that needs a solution. So, with this Kiva loan, she wants to buy fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Analy has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ishak

texts.en:
Ishak is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bakutaje Village. Ishak joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ishak suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase his farmland. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ishak will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ishak now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 24 years old, is an accountant who has been working for 4 years in a reputable company. Mona is planning to get married and she is currently furnishing her apartment. 

In order to do that, and since her monthly salary isn’t enough to cover her home furnishing needs, Mona is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. 
This  loan will also allow her to prepare her wedding arrangements.

loans.use: to furnish her apartment to get married soon

loans.name: Roberto Isaac

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 44 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 12 años y una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la carpintería y comercio de madera.
Él es buen padre, constante, paciente, detallista, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘La merced’ donde se encuentra la terminal de buses con destino al norte de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con fuertes vientos que provienen de la cordillera. 
Roberto es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la carpintería y comercio de madera; el realiza muebles de interiores como; mesas, sillas, adornos de pared y otros, “la presentación de un mueble es esencial cuando lo fabricamos para nosotros mismos ya que al tener una apariencia agradable, hará que nuestros momentos sean mejores cuando estamos en ese sitio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene temporadas de ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de madera para trabajar. Su sueño reforestar la tierra y devolver a la naturaleza lo prestado, él desea realizar la compra de madera por mayor para continuar trabajando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera por mayor para fabricar muebles de interiores.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 44-year-old single man who has two sons, ages 11 and 12, and a 3-year-old daughter. He is in the carpentry and lumber sale business.

He is a good father, persevering, patient, detail oriented, responsible, and very hardworking. He works in the 'La Merced' area, where there is a terminal with buses that head to the north of the city. The climate is cold and dry with strong winds from the mountains.

Roberto has a tan complexion, dark eyes, short black hair, short stature, and an average build. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish because of the general cultural and because of his business. He spends time with his children. The older children go to school and the youngest is still not of school age. They live in a home that belongs to the family. It was built with brick and cement, and has a corrugated iron roof, wooden floors, running water, electricity, and sewage. 

He is in the carpentry and lumber sale business. He makes indoor furniture like tables, chairs, wall decorations, and others. He says that "when we make furniture for ourselves, the appearance is essential because because when it looks nice, it makes the moments that we spend in that area better."

His business' advantage is that there are seasons with constant sales. The drawback is not having capital to purchase wood to work. His dream is to reforest the world and return to nature what we borrowed. He wants to purchase wholesale wood to continue working. This is his first loan with the institution in the nine years that he has been in this business. 

Because of these reasons Jose is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale lumber to manufacture indoor furniture.

loans.use: to buy wholesale lumber to manufacture indoor furniture

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 28 year old married woman with two children,living with her husband who is the main income provider in the family. He owns a cattle farm.  She is dedicated only for her home and family.

In order to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her purpose is to help them to achieve high educational levels and being always able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school educational fees

loans.name: Carole

texts.en:
Carole, 24 years old, is a middle-school teacher. Carole lives in a very remote village in Southern Lebanon, and the school she works at is very hard to reach without a car. That’s why she needs a car for her daily transportation to her work, but her limited monthly income is barely enough to take this step forward. Thus for this reason, Carole is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary requested car.  

This support will allow her to buy a car, which is necessary for her transportation.

loans.use: to buy a car to reach isolated schools

loans.name: Davlatyor

texts.en:
Davlatyor was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1958. He is living in village. He is an agrarian. He works at a medical clinic looking after the garden. It is his first time applying to IMON to get a loan. 

He wants to treat his son at hospital. His son has health problems and needs to be treated quickly. He is requested a loan to treat his son at hospital. He awaits Kiva kindness

loans.use: to treat his son at hospital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old. She is married and they have two children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for 15 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy shampoos, lotions, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon. 

She will use profits from the business to do home repairs.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, lotions, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 56 year old and lives with his beloved wife in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Suren has a specialty of veterinary but he never worked of his profession and many years till today he works as a driver. Suren’s wife is very active and cheerful person and she is running her own small business.

Suren now is a little bit worried as his wife feels some weakness and unhealthy. This loan of 400.000 Armenian drams Suren needs, as he wants to solve his nice wife’s health problem as soon as possible.

loans.use: to solve his nice wife’s health problem as soon as it is possible

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал, 33 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей, старшей дочери - 7 лет, сыну  - 1 год. У Гулжамал среднее образование, работает в школе учителем английского языка, в данный момент она в декретном отпуске. Гулжамал занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У нее есть 2 коровы, на 1,0 Га земли выращивает картофель и клевер для реализации. Деятельность Гулжамал приносит около 29,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров с целью увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность отремонтировать ее дом.
texts.en:
Ghulzhamal is 33, married, and she has two children. Her daughter, the oldest, is 7 years old. Her son is 1. Ghulzhamal has a secondary education and works in a school as an English teacher. At the moment, though, she is on maternity leave.

Ghulzhamal is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture. She has two cows, and she also grows potatoes and clover for resale on one hectare of land. She makes about 29,000 som (KGS) per month, which helps her cover food expenses and the daily needs of her family. In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and increase her cattle headcount. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business, which will eventually allow her to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Melida Ondina

texts.es:
Melida, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive junto a su nuevo compañero de vida, porque se divorció de su primer matrimonio con el cual tuvo 2 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y ya formaron su propia familia.  
 
Melida, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y además hacen pan horneado para vender, ella hornea pan dos veces por semana y este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, quien le enseño el trabajo y la venta de ropa la realiza desde hace 10 años, decidió iniciar el negocio por iniciativa propia y lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal.
 
El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar ropa para su negocio, porque quiere comenzar a surtirla porque en un mes estaremos celebrando el mes de la independencia del país y la venta de ropa incremente, es por eso que necesita surtir su negocio.
 
Melida, sueño con seguir trabajando de esa manera y poder tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old and is a very hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who studied up to the ninth grade. She lives with her new life partner because she divorced her first husband, with whom she had two children who are now adults and have formed their own families.

Melinda has a business selling clothes, in addition to baking bread to sell twice a week. She learned this business from her mother, who taught her how to work and sell clothing, which she has done for 10 years. Through her own initiative, she decided to open a shop, which is located in the municipal marketplace.

She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes for her business because she wants to stock it with clothes. Next month, they celebrate the country's independence month and clothing sales increase. For this reason she needs to stock her shop.

Melida says that she dreams of continuing working this way so that she can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a bright woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a big town with her big family. She is married and has four children. She manages her business, retailing grocery products at the domestic market. 

She is proud to have a clever son who recently started studying in Malaysia at the Technology University in IT.  She has not enough money to make payments for his education. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to pay her son’s education costs. She hopes to be supported and thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: to make payment of her son's university education in IT in Malaysia

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
This is Jovita, 65 years old and a widow. She’s a survivor of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 together with her children. 

Jovita runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Oton, Iloilo and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Its stability is also shaken by some of her neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes several days or weeks before they pay. She is a kind-hearted person who cannot refuse her neighbors because she understands that there are times when it’s really hard to earn money. 

Because of this, she needs additional capital to make her business more stable. She plans to buy more stocks and she is requesting for PHP 12,000 loan. With this, she would be able to boost her income and savings. She’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to her. It will surely go a long way. 

Jovita dreams that all her children can obtain a stable job and have a better life in the near future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her variety store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 51, is from Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato, and her husband Virgilio had to leave her and their children to seek for a more decent wage abroad. He’s been away from them for several years already. It’s difficult for Teresita to accompany and guide their growing up children alone but she keeps on. She has to endure the situation and pursue the completion of her children’s studies so as to pay off the sacrifices of her husband abroad. 

Instead of feeling lonesome due to the absence of her husband, Teresita focuses her attention on her business. Her once small sari-sari (variety) store is slowly developing into a grocery store. As soon as she’s able to complete and stabilize her grocery store, she plans to put up an internet café adjacent to it. In this way, she would be shooting two birds with one stone because she could watch over her two businesses at the same time. 

For now, she would like to ask for PHP 50,000 additional capital to buy more stocks to fill in the vacant shelves of her store. She’s really working hard hoping that her income would be enough to support all their needs, so that her husband need not work abroad anymore. Praying that you could be God’s instrument to grant her request and contribute few steps to make her family whole someday. 

Teresita draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 44, looks after her “sari-sari” (variety) store located in Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato. Some customers buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 10:30pm; and she has to meet their needs or else her business will fail due to competition within the area. Her husband, Estelo, who works as checker during day time takes a turn in watching over her store after his work.

Ruth also rents out a tricycle for additional income. She has to maximize all their resources because she has children who are still studying in college. It’s not a joke to support the college expenses in the Philippines, because it’s really pocket-draining. Hence, Ruth aspires to obtain additional loan worth PHP 50,000 which she can use to buy more dry goods, grocery items and soft drinks to enhance her inventory. Hopefully it can ease up her family’s financial burden with the expected increase on her sales and profit.

Ruth is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods, grocery items, and softdrinks to enhance her inventory

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old. He is married and has 3 children. 

He sells motorcycle spare parts and has been in business for 15 years.  This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Francis will use the loan to buy stock of assorted spare parts for sale. 

Francis will use profits from expanded business to pay college fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of assorted spare parts for sale

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 33-year-old married mother of one child. She started, almost a year ago, selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Nisrine is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' needs. Nisrine hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes.

loans.name: Jibo

texts.en:
Jibo is a Babban Gona farmer from Maiyashi Village who joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since becoming a member, Jibo no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jibo will have access to top quality farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will help him to increase his income considerably. This season Jibo has ambitious plans to harvest 60 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jibo now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Francisca Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina, es una mujer trabajadora, estudio hasta cuarto grado, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando educación básica y su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos.  

Etelvina, tiene negocio de destazo de carne de res y de cerdos desde hace más de 10 años, junto a su esposo viajan todos los Lunes hacia el tiangue en busca de los animales para la venta, el negocio lo realiza en su casa y solo les avisa a sus clientes el día que va a destazar y ellos llegan a su casa a comprar el producto. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar cerdos y reces, porque tuvo problemas de salud y realizar gastos médicos que la dejaron sin capital para continuar con su negocio, también será utilizada una parte del dinero para pagar el alquiler de terreno donde siembra su esposo. 

Etelvina, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a hardworking woman who studied up to the fourth grade. She lives with her children and her husband. Her children are in elementary school  and her husband works farming staple grains.

Etelvina has a butcher shop where she has sold beef and pork for more than 10 years. With her husband, she travels every monday to a small market where she finds animals to sell. She runs her business from her home and lets her clients know when she is going to butcher the animals. Clients go to her home to purchase the product.

The loan will be used to purchase pork and beef. Because she had health problems, she had medical costs that left her without capital to continue with her business. Part of the money will also be used to pay rent for the lot where her husband farms. 

Etelvina dreams of seeing her children graduate with college degrees.

loans.use: to purchase pork and beef

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children. She has had a green grocery business for 1 year.

She will be using the loan to buy vegetables and tomatoes for selling and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to support her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income, be able to pay school fees for her children and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and tomatoes for selling to serve more customers and make more income to support her family

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past five years, Rukia has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells textile clothes. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more textile clothes to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits and enroll her son in boarding school. Rukia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a machine to sew ladies' clothes. 

Rukia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more textile clothes to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 26 years old. She is married and they have four children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for six years.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy shampoos, lotions, weaves, etc. for the beauty salon.

She will use profits from the business to expand her beauty salon and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, lotions, weaves, etc. for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en:
Jana is a 27-year-old married woman. She started working as a make-up artist and selling cosmetics six years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Jana is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is well-know among her region for her professional skills. Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying necessary make-ups and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Jana hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy make-ups and cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 34-year-old married man, with one child. He sells clothing, and has been in business for 3 years. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

Daniel will use the loan to buy clothing to sell. He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his child. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fideris

texts.en: Fideris is 39 years old. She is married and they have two children. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to sell and make more income to provide for her family's needs. She will use the generated profits from the expanded business to open a mobile phone money transfer business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to sell and make more income to provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en: Jamilu is a Babban Gona farmer from Magami Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Jamilu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Jamilu has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Doris Amparo

texts.es: Doris tiene 26 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para engordarla, producir leche y quesos, ya que quiere tener otros ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, garcias a este crédito podra mejorar la calidad de vida, en su tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos.
texts.en: Doris is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She makes a living in agriculture. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow to fatten, and produce milk and cheese. She wants to have another income to support her children. Thanks to this loan she will be able to improve her quality of life. In her free time she likes to go out for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 53 years old. She is married and they have 2 children.  She operates a hair salon and has been in the business for 4 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy hair treatment chemicals, lotions, weaves and other salon materials. Annah will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big salon.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment chemicals, lotions, weaves and other salon materials

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer con 50 años de edad, dedicada a sus hijos los cuales adora con todas sus fuerzas.
Su trabajo es la preparación y venta de comidas, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos ante la ausencia de un padre.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual comprara comida como harina, aceite y arroz, mesas para su negocio, desechables como cucharas, platos y vasos.
Su sueño es formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.

Sabe que con el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 50 year old woman dedicated to her children, whom she adores with all her might.

Her job is the preparation and sale of food, a means by which she has managed to get ahead with her children in the absence of a father. 

She is requesting a loan with which she will buy food such as flour, oil and rice, tables for her business and disposables such as spoons, plates and cups. Her dream is to formalize her business and to leave it to her children in the future.

She knows that with the support of Interactuar and the Kiva website collaborators, that her dreams will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy food such as flour, oil and rice, tables for her business and disposables such as spoons, plates and cups.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: This young and handsome man is 27 years old and his name is Armen. He lives with his mother in Sevan city of Gegarkunik region. Armen graduated from the State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Pedagogy and Psychology. It has already been two years that he has been working in his profession in the local military unit. Here he works as a military psychologist. He is happy to be engaged in his beloved profession. Armen also feels happiness as he is going to get married. He has a very beautiful bride and they dream of a nice and cheerful wedding party. Armen is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy nice presents for his bride and also to organize an original wedding party for both of them.

loans.use: to buy nice presents for his bride and also to organize an original wedding party for both of them.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Compared to other animals, goats are easier to raise. They’re not choosy in terms of food. They just need some hay or grass. No complicated housing, just a fence to keep them together.

Zeny raises goats in her backyard in Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato. She serves them with hay and sometimes pastures them on grassy land. After several months, she sells them to gain the return of her investment. It’s a practical endeavor that supplies food for the community. Zeny has been running this business for eight years now and she is paying two workers. Her income extends help to her workers’ families, in addition to the support it gives to her own family. Her farmer husband, Victorino, is always there to guide her in this endeavor.

Now that Zeny aims to buy more kids (small goats) to raise, she aspires to obtain additional capital worth PHP 20,000. She intends to expand her business little by little not only for her family but most especially to help others. It’s her way of living justly in the sight of God. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more kids (small goats) to raise

loans.name: Janik

texts.en:
Janik, along with his wife and two children, lives in Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. He is 30 years old. Janik is now in his fifth year of studying in the distance learning department of the Yerevan State Agricultural Academy. Simultaneously, he works as a contractual military serviceman.  

Janik is a very active and laborious young man, and he is also a skilled farmer. On his farm he has cows, calves, heifers, pigs, sheep and chickens. Janik also has large plot of land on which he has established a rich vegetable garden. He has large assortment of farm products, such as milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese, meat, eggs, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, greens, and cabbage. Janik sells all of these at the city’s wholesale market, hiring a truck for taking the produce to the market. Janik is asking for this loan to buy a truck so that he will no longer have to pay to transport his produce.

loans.use: to buy a truck, so that he will no longer have to pay for transporting his products to market.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, estudio hasta quinto grado, vive junto a su esposo, sus 2 hijos y su mamá, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos reciclables, dos de sus hijos se encuentran en la escuela estudiando educación básica.

Ana, trabaja como empleada doméstica para sus vecinos y dentro de sus funciones es hacer la limpieza del hogar y cuidar a unos ancianos, trabajo que realiza de Lunes a Viernes y los fines de semana sale con su esposo a comprar y vender los artículos reciclables. 
 
El préstamo que está solicitando será invertido para reparar el vehículo en donde salen a comprar los artículos reciclables y lo demás será capital de trabajo para seguir trabajando en su negocio y de esta manera seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para su familia.  
 
Ana, sueña con que sus hijos menores logren culminar sus estudios y se gradúen de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who studied up to Grade 5. She lives with her husband, her two children and her mother. Her husband works buying and selling recyclable material and her two children are in school studying basic education.

Ana works as a domestic employee for her neighbors and amongst her functions is cleaning the house and caring for some old people. She does this work from Monday to Friday and Saturday and Sunday she goes out with her husband buying and selling recyclables.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in repairing the vehicle they use to buy the recyclable material and another part will be working capital to continue working with her business and in this way continue generating the resources needed for her family.

Ana dreams of her younger children managing to complete their studies and graduate from university.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle she uses to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Reinaldo Rafael

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Reinaldo desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Sahagún.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con su esposa y su hijo de años.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera; cumpliendo así su sueño de ser independiente.
texts.en: With lots of drive and perseverance, Reinaldo wants to start a business breeding and raising pigs in his home, located in the town of Sahagún. This idea came about from the need to generate some good earnings to help with the upkeep of the home where he lives with his wife and his son. He is a happy and very cooperative man, which are qualities that have gained him the affection and respect from the people of the village. With this loan, he will be able to give his business a start. The money will be invested into buying small pigs and materials to build a garage. This completes his dream of being independent.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and materials to build a garage.

loans.name: Ana Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila, es una mujer trabajadora, estudio hasta quinto grado, luego se dedicó a ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y a cultivar granos básicos junto a su padre y sus hermanos, actualmente vive junto a sus padres y un hijo, porque es madre soltera.  

Bertila, tiene un puesto de comida desde hace 6 años, este negocio lo realiza gracias a su mamá, quien fue la que le enseño todo lo que sabe sobre la cocina y a darle el toque especial a las comidas que prepara para sus clientes, el negocio está ubicado a medio kilometro de su casa y se levanta a las 3:00 de la mañana a comenzar a preparar los alimentes para vender el desayunos y tiene una empleada que le ayuda.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para colocar una mini-tienda, porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo y lo que comprara principalmente es arroz, frijoles, pan y café, pero además reparara el techo del negocio porque ya está deteriorado, de esta forma estará generando fuentes de empleo y mejorar sus ingresos.

Bertila, sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida que su hijo estudie en una universidad para que aprovechen las oportunidades que a ella se le negaron.
texts.en:
Bertila is a working woman. She went to school until 5th grade and later started helping with the household chores and growing basic grains with her father and siblings. Now, she lives with her parents and a son because she is a single mother. Bertila has had a food stall for 6 years. She has this business thanks to her mother, who was the one that showed her everything that she knows about a kitchen and how to give a special touch to the foods that she makes for her customers. The business is located half of a kilometer from her house. She wakes up at 3:00 A.M. to begin to get the food ready to sell breakfast and she has an employee who helps her. 

The loan that she is asking for is to set up a mini-store because she does not have enough money to do it and she will mainly buy rice, beans, bread and coffee. She will also repair the roof of the business because it is deteriorating. This way, she will be generating a source of employment and improving her income. Bertila dreams of having a well-stocked store, and that her son studies in a university so that he can take advantage of the opportunities that she had been denied.

loans.use: to set up a mini-store with products such as rice, beans, bread and coffee, and to repair the eatery roof.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 47 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells secondhand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to increase on her stock, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and set up another business of produce. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life and see her other business growing up. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to increase on her stock

loans.name: Bardha

texts.en:
Bardha, a 38-year-old married mother, has been photographed with her two adorable kids whose ages are nine and six. She has been practicing agriculture/livestock for the past two years. In her possession, are two dynym (an area of land about two tenths of a hectare) of agricultural land where she plants seasonal veggies mostly and has some orchards as well. She also has two goats of a good breed and two sows and twelve chickens. Out of all, she sells only baby goats and piglets.

Here is her statement to the loan officer during the interview: "It is very hard living on such a small budget and especially when you've got little kids. Their needs are almost never fulfilled. This is how I feel. My kids don't have what others have and this makes them alienate themselves, unfortunately." Bardha's husband does labour work. He is called occasionally by other villagers to help them out in their agricultural activities and gets paid $15 per 10 hours of work.

loans.use: to dig a well and build an irrigation system

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 24 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a motorcycle business for five years.

He will be using the loan to complete payment for another motorcycle and hopes this will help him expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to complete payments for another motorcycle to help him expand the business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, a sus 23 años de edad, es padre de 1 hija de 9 meses. 
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, esto lo llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, un taller de soldadura.

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de un juego de pistolas para soldar, mascaras y guantes.

De esta forma, Joel espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia y poder ofrecer a su hija una mejor educación, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un negocio bien acreditado, que le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar a mediano plazo sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Joel is 23 years old and the father of one 9 month old daughter. Due to the lack of work opportunities, he has gone through a very difficult economic situation. This has led him to look for options to get ahead and he wants to set up his own business, a welding shop. For this reason, he is encouraged to ask for the loan, which he will invest into buying a set a welding guns, masks and gloves. This way, Joel hopes to be able to receive the needed resources to get ahead with his family and to be able to offer his daughter a better education. This will also serve as momentum to move towards fulfilling his main dream, which is to have a well-accredited business that gets him good earnings to improve his living conditions mid-term.

loans.use: to purchase a set of welding guns, masks and gloves.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a Babban Gona farmer from Maimai Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Joshua no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house or move into a bigger home.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.

This season Joshua has ambitious plans to harvest 60 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Joshua now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Afisa is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Afisa has been working hard to manage her bar business, which deals in soft drinks, wine, soda and beer.

To help expand her business, Afisa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more drinks as mentioned above to attract her customers, and will help Afisa to generate greater profits and employ more workers in her bar to ease her work.
