Afisa hopes that in the future she will be able to rent a bigger place for her business.

Afisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Afisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire more drinks like beer, spirits and soda to attract her customers.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, es un joven de veintisiete años de edad, emprendedor y entusiasta. Desde hace un par de años, con el apoyo de sus padres, puso una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado, ha trabajado duro para hacer que su negocio funcione. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, logro introducir en su tienda marcas de ropa que antes no tenía, lo que incrementó notablemente sus ventas. 
El, ha vuelto a recurrir a un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, esta vez para comprar productos de calzado de hule, dada las características del lugar donde él vive, zona alta en agricultura, las botas de hule son muy demandadas. En un futuro el desea poder acondicionar una bodega, además de invertir en un automóvil y seguir creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
Francisco is an enthusiastic and enterprising 27 year old youth. A few years ago with the support of his parents he opened up a store selling clothing and footwear and he has worked hard to make his business work. Thanks to his first loan from Kiva in conjunction with MiCrédito, he managed to introduce new brands of clothing he didn't have before and his sales have increased notably.

He has come back to get another loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, this time to buy rubber footwear products. Given the characteristics of the area he lives in, a highly agricultural area, rubber boots are very much in demand. In the future he wants to upgrade a store, invest in an automobile and continue to grow as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy rubber footwear products.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Badamasi Village. Lawal joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Lawal suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Lawal has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 13 bags of maize this year, Lawal can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es:
Sandra, estudio hasta tercer grado, vive solo junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad, porque es madre soltera, su hijo se encuentra estudiando.    

Sandra, tiene una tienda de productos básico desde hace 1 año y seis meses, decidió colocar su propio negocio cuando en la empresa donde trabajaba hubo recorte de personal y ella tenía que sacar a sus hijos adelante y fue su mamá quien la incentivo a poner su negocio, pero además de eso se dedica a la venta de lociones por catálogo casa por casa. 

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para surtir más su tienda con productos como arroz, frijoles, pan, frijoles, café, jabón, entre otros, porque tiene poca mercadería. 

Los sueños principales de Sandra, son ver crecer a su hijo y que logre culminar sus estudios universitarios y además quiere que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Sandra went to school until 3rd grade. She lives only with her 11 year old son because she is a single mother. Her son is in school. Sandra has had a commodity store for 1 and 1/2 years. She decided to set up her own business when there was a downsizing in the company she was working for. She had to support her children and it was her mother who encouraged her to set up her own business. Along with that, she sells lotions from a magazine door-to-door. 

Sandra needs the loan to better supply her store with products such as rice, beans, bread, coffee and ham, among others, because she has little merchandise. Sandra's main goals are to see her son grow up and that he manages to fulfill his college studies, along with wanting her business to keep growing.

loans.use: to better supply her store with products such as rice, beans, bread, coffee and ham.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka is a 60 year old mother with 10 children, who is strong and healthy running her business of selling tuna sandwiches and other toasted sandwiches in her community with the help of her children. 

Repeka requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, container, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profits. 

Repeka became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, container, butter,

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-years-old single man from Deir Al-balah city, located in the Gaza strip He lives with his family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in the Gaza strip, he wants to open his own business, which is a mobile phone store, as he has experience from his previous job about selling mobiles and providing maintenance, and he has an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell. This will make him independent.

Mohammad appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell

loans.name: Suma Cusisiña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA CUSISIÑA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas,  venta de ropa, venta de coca, venta de calzados, venta de verduras, venta de juguetes.  

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años y lo aprendió de su hermana.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de Patacamaya y Achacachi. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, el área de salud, ahorro y las reuniones de pago que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Suma Cusisiña” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as part of the German Busch regional office. It is made up of ten members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Rosa is President. The members of the communal bank are engaged in a range of businesses, including selling shawls, clothing, coca leaves, footwear, vegetables and toys. 

The loan they will take out will benefit a group of small micro-enterprises of which Rosa is a member. She says that five years ago she joined Pro Mujer by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling shawls, which she learned from her sister and began several years ago. 

Rosa's loan will be for increasing her capital (purchasing fabric wholesale), which she will get from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then after making shawls she will sell them in the markets in Patacamaya and Achacachi. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is in a common-law marriage and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training, the health center, the savings, and the repayment meetings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been running a genge for eight years now.  She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Hadija's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the genge stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in her genge.  She dreams of buying a plot of land.

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group  HIARI YA MOYO which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in her genge.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Josephine aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre trabajador y humilde, presta el servicio de trasporte de personas en una motocicleta compartida con un amigo en el municipio de Cañasgordas.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar una moto, la cual sea totalmente propia y de esta forma sus ingresos no sean divididos.

Así podrá tener un negocio sostenible, rentable, y lo más importante, propio.
texts.en: Felipe is a working and humble man. He loans his services to transporting people on a shared motorcycle with a friend, in the town of Cañasgordas. He works every day for 8 hours a day. He is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle, which will be completely his and this way his income will not be shared. He will also be able to have a business that is sustainable, profitable and most importantly, his own.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport people to work.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Clemantine is a group leader; aged 35 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 2 and 18 years.3 of them of them go to school. The group is called TWISUNGANE means “COME TOGETHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of children and to imp[rove her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Shilingi

texts.en:
Shilingi is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of cereals,cooking oil and sugar for her business. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business

loans.use: to purchase stock of cereals, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos y vive en Pachuca, Hidalgo. Ella trabaja como empleada en una agencia gubernamental, es una mujer muy trabajadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y con un gran ímpetu por darle lo mejor a su hijo. Ella además de su empleo se dedica a rentar cuartos para personas desde hace más de 3 años, ella se está expandiendo y actualmente construye 3 cuartos más. Con un préstamo de MXN 15,000 ella podrá hacer los terminados del cuarto como puertas, ventanas y cerraduras. María es una mujer activa, le gusta aprender cosas nuevas siempre y en su tiempo libre le gusta bailar o hacer actividades al aire libre. Es una persona muy responsable y asegura que no decepcionara a ningún prestamista y además agradece mucho a las personas que la ayudaran a terminar de construir sus  cuartos.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She is a widow, has two children and lives in Pachuca, Hidalgo. She works as an employee in a governmental agency. She is a very hard-working woman with a lot of desire to get ahead and with great momentum to give her sons the best. Along with her job, she has also made a living renting rooms to people for more than 3 years. She is expanding and currently building 3 more rooms. 

With the loan of 15,000 MXN, she will be able to finish the rooms with doors, windows and locks. María is an active woman. She always likes to learn new things in her free time. She likes dancing and outdoor activities. She is a responsible person and she says that she will not disappoint any lender. She is also very thankful to the people that will help her to finish building her rooms.

loans.use: to finish the rooms with doors, windows and locks.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Siem Reap province, Saron is 48-year-old and a mother of six children. The main source of her income is from rice farming and cows-raising is a secondary source of income. Each day she could save around 15,000KHR after offsetting expenses. 

After successfully she repaid all her previous three loans, Saron has request for the fourth loan from VisionFund. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying fertilizers and seedlings hoping to grow good quality of crops so that she can sell them for a good profit.

loans.use: To spend on buying fertilizers and seedlings hoping to grow good quality of crops so that she can sell them for a good profit.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marina Rosibel

texts.es:
Marina, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su dos hijas y dos hijos, tres de ellos se encuentran estudiando, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y también tiene una tienda en la comunidad.

Marina, tiene una tienda desde hace 12 años y la implemento junto a su esposo con el objetivo de generar mayores ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia. 
   
Marina, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad, para el mejoramiento de su tienda y para la compra de fertilizantes para la producción agrícola. 

Marina, tiene como visión que su hijos obtengan una estabilidad familiar y que cumplan sus objetivos de estudio, para el desarrollo de cada uno de ellos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marina is 23 years old and went to school until sixth grade.  She lives with her two daughters and two sons, three of whom are in school. Her husband grows basic grains and they also have a small store in the community. 

Marina has had a store for 12 years and started it with her husband with the goal of generating more income to support their family. 
   
Marina needs the loan to purchase staples to improve her store and to purchase fertilizers for agricultural production. 

Marina has a vision that her children will have familial security and that they will achieve their educational goals for their own future development.

loans.use: to purchase staples to improve her store and to purchase fertilizers for agricultural production.

loans.name: Maria Umbelina

texts.es: María es una persona que trabaja en la agricultura hace mucho tiempo atras, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sus sembrios de papas y habas, garcias al ccrédito podra mejorar sus sembrios y obtener mejores ingresos, su sueño es comprar pollos para criar y luego venderlos, las compras realizara en Guaranda, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who has worked in agriculture for a long time. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies for her plantings of potatoes and broad beans. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her plantings and obtain better income.

Her dream is to buy chickens to raise and then sell. 

She makes her purchases in Guaranda. In her free time she likes to go for walks with her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married with four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Rhona has been working hard to manage her beauty salon where she is a hairdresser. 

Rhona is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more hair braids and relaxers to help expand her business. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and improve her family’s living standards. Rhona  hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rhona who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair braids and relaxers for her beauty salon

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be reliable. 

Hellen operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, fruits, and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a productive place, and her primary customers are the general public. 

Hellen describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm supplies. Her business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is Hellen's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm supplies

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be honest. 

Peris operates a farm where she grows tea and coffee. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in  a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Peris will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm supplies. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Bertilda Rosa

texts.es:
Bertilda a sus 38 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de comidas que estará ubicado su casa.

Ella desea ofrecer en su negocio desayunos, almuerzo y otros comestibles, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Bertilda es una señora trabajadora, pujante, emprendedora, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos como pipeta de gas, estufa, utensilios de cocina e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Bertilda, at the age of 38, was motivated to become independent and obtain income on her own due to the lack of employment opportunities and out of economic necessity. For this reason, she wants to begin a food business that will be located in her house.

In her business, she wants to offer breakfasts, lunch, and other foods. With this she hopes to obtain the resources necessary to satisfy her basic needs.

Bertilda is a hard-working person, thriving, and entrepreneurial. She is applying for the loan for help in order to invest it in the purchase of fixed assets such as a gas cylinder, stove, cooking utensils, and supplies to make food (fried meats, oil, arepas [filled corn cakes], plantains, and soft drinks) in order to have available a variety of products that will satisfy the tastes of all her customers. In this way she will be able to have a better quality of life and well-being.

Thanks to the support of Interactuar Corporation and the Kiva lenders, she will be able to set up this business and achieve being independent.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as a gas tank, stove, cooking utensils, and supplies to prepare food (fried meats, oil, arepas, plantains, and soft drinks)

loans.name: Mirembe Nsozibiri Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mirembe Nsozibiri Group, and is located in a rural area. It consists of 11 members who are both men and women: Sarah, Micheal, Peter, Fred, John, Pheobe, Fred, Alisi, Dick, Caroline, and Samuel. Group members work in different areas including retail, charcoal trading, groceries, farming, teaching, local brewing, and running business stalls.

Fred is a 35-year-old married man with four children, three of whom are attending school. He is a farmer and also teaches as a side business. Fred started his farm in 2000 and works seven days a week, 15 hours per day. He started his business because it was profitable and required less capital to start. Fred’s clients are residents of Nsozibiri and Lubungu as well as people from nearby villages. His business challenge is the lack of capital. Fred describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

Fred is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as organic fertilizer to help improve the quality and size of his yields. He and his group appreciate UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for their unwavering support.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

Susan operates a retail business where she sells cereal. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her primary customers are locals. Susan will use the 35,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereal. She will use the anticipated profits to add more variety of cereal.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereal

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en:
Munkaila  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Karsawa Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Munkaila suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children’s school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Munkaila has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare which is double the national average in Nigeria. He is able to earn an income of up to 2,000USD per hectare. 

Munkaila is requesting a loan through Babban Gona to have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Munkaila can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bazai Village. Rabi joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

Through Babban Gona’s loan, Rabi will have access to the best farm supplies in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds, that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rabi now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income, and use her additional earnings to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm supplies that will increase the yield of her farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Margaret operates a farm, where she grows tea. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient water for domestic use. Margaret will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. 			
.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Mary operates a farm where she keeps cows, and also grows crops. Her primary customers are locals. Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy connection pipes for water, to enable her to irrigate.

loans.use: buy connection pipes for water, to enable irrigation

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de restaurante en su casa en el municipio de Montería, con el cual planea obtener ingresos.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar materiales para la adecuación del piso en el que ubicara su restaurante, utensilios de cocina e insumos para la preparación de almuerzos y desayunos.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In her search for a brighter future and good opportunities to get ahead, Nubia decided to start a business which according to her will give her all she's ever dreamed of.

She will start a restaurant business in her house in the city of Monteria with which she plans to earn income. Her main challenge has been a lack of capital to work with.

To achieve this, she needs the help of a loan with the Interactuar Corporation. This will allow her to buy materials to improve the floor she'll locate her restaurant on, cooking utensils and inputs to make lunches and breakfasts.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Colombian woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the floor her restaurant will be located in, cooking utensils and inputs to prepare lunches and breakfasts.

loans.name: Naziru

texts.en:
Naziru is a Babban Gona farmer from Bakutaje Village. He joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Naziru is requesting a loan through Babban Gona to have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds. His loan will help him increase his yields up to 30 bags of maize per hectare which is double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Naziru would like to use the extra earnings from his loan to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 33 years old and married. She lives in small village near Hebron with her family and she has four children. Three years ago, Iman started raising sheep and lambs in her own yard to sell as meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

She has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed which will help her a lot to improve her business and take steps forward in this field.
Iman is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan. Iman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en:
Launiu is a 41 year old mother with 5 children and she operates a small business of selling banana and taro chips in her community to earn a living.

Launiu requested for a loan to buy a sack of taro, banana, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags, container, to assist her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member  of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, banana, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon and plastic bags, container,

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. Elizabeth earns more income from seaweed vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like can goods, egg, soap, shampoo, etc for her general store business.

Elma has been in this business for 5 years. Elma earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like can goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Monico works hard to support his family.

He has a tobacco retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Monico is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of tobacco to offer for sale.

Monico has been sustaining his business activities through his past 22 loans from NWTF. Monico hopes that his hard work will help him to attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tobacco to offer for sale.

loans.name: Miladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miladis, una mujer de 38 años, vive en el municipio de San Pelayo, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Esta madre de 3 hijos de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de venta de comida como pescado.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Miladis podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de pescado al por mayor.

Colabora a una mujer emprendedora, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Miladis, a 38 year old woman, lives in the city of San Pelayo, a small city where the opportunities to get ahead are difficult and business competition is pretty tough.

She is the mother of three children and has an enterprising mind and big wishes to get ahead. Her project is to start a business selling food like fish.

With the help of a loan, Miladis will be able to achieve her dream of being independent and being able to earn her own income, which she'll use to pay for household expenses. The loan will be invested in buying a stock of fish in bulk.

Collaborate with an enterprising woman who has a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Khoeuy's Group

texts.en:
Khoeuy is 29 years old a married with two dependent children who are under school age, living in Siem Reap province. Rice farming is the family’s prime source of income. Moreover, she raises chicken for sell and works for others for a labor fee to get extra income to support the family. For some years, her businesses did not grow well as the chicken got sick and crops were destroyed by insects. 

Khoeuy is new to VisionFund and as a group leader she will spend her loan portion on rice seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes this first loan will enable her to grow good quality of rice so as to sell it for good profit and thereby allow her to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To spend her loan portion on rice seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor fees to grow good quality of rice so as to sell it for good profit

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira is a 43-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along her family and is the mother of five children, one of them goes to school and one of his sons helps her in cattle farming.  Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells it at a local market. He has to feed the calf till one or two years until it grown up and healthy, which is very lengthy and expensive procedure.
 
She wants to buy a heifer to keep constant the breeding procedure but he already invest his all savings into his current cattle farm.
 
Therefore, Sabira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy bull calf and heifer for cattle farming.
 
The fetal diseases are the major challenges for him. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on due time. With the profit amount he will buy fodder for cattle and cure against diseases.
She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf and heifer for her husband's cattle trading business.

loans.name: Alfredo Vinicio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su  gente es muy amable, sus fiestas de Cantonización las celebran en el mes de julio, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, como la cascada del amor y varias hosterías su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando conciertos y bailes populares.
En este Cantón vive con su esposa el señor Alfredo un hombre emprendedor viene de una familia humilde, trabaja como guardia de seguridad, su esposa pasa en los Bancos tienen un hijo de dos años son una familia muy unida.
El señor Alfredo desea iniciar su negocio de lavado y secado de ropa, su esposa estará al frente del negocio y él le ayudará los días que tenga libres aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia, le dedicarán un promedio de 8 horas diarias a esta actividad.
Don Alfredo y su esposa con este préstamo espera que su situación económica mejore y puedan darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, el señor Alfredo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel do los Bancos is a canton with a warm, humid climate. Its people are very friendly. They celebrate their founding festivals in the month of July. This canton has various tourist attractions, such as the waterfall of love, and various inns. Its people are happy and like to enjoy all their festivities, organizing popular concerts and dances.

Señor Alfredo, an entrepreneurial man who comes from a humble family, lives with his wife in this canton. He works as a security guard. His wife stays in Los Bancos. He and his wife have a two-year-old son. They are a very united family.

Señor Alfredo wants to begin his business of washing and drying clothing. His wife will be in charge of the business, and he will help her on the days he has free. He learned this business on his own initiative. They will spend an average of eight hours daily at this work.

With this loan, Don Alfredo and his wife hope that their economic situation will improve and they can give their son a better future. Señor Alfredo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and help offered.

loans.use: to begin his business of washing and drying clothing. With this investment he hopes that he will improve his economic situation and give his son a better future.

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola is 40 years old with 6 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sikola requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2004, and she will use her profit for home improvement and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en:
Sarona is a woman of 36 years old with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. 

Sarona requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in rural area with her family and is married and has one child. She is a business lady. She does business of retailing vegetables and grocery products at domestic market. She is polite and gentle with customers and has regular clients each day. She tries her best to ensure and help her family. 

Her mother is sick and she wants to treat her at a medical clinic, but has not enough money. She is requesting a loan to pay her mother’s treatment at a medical clinic. She hope hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her mother’s treatment at medical clinic

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en: Tolotea is 28 years old with 2 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tolotea requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2007, and she will expand her business using her profit.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, milk and other items. Her business goal is to have a mini supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, milk and other items

loans.name: Federman Enrique

texts.es:
Federman es un agricultor que habita en la zona de San pedro de Urabá, un lugar rodeado por agricultores pujantes, luchadores, trabajadores, como él que con su negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su hogar conformado por su pareja y 3 hijos todos ellos menores de edad.

Federman aprendió de su padre todo lo relacionado con la agricultura, desde joven se ha hecho cargo de los cultivos y espera que cuando llegue el momento indicado uno de sus hijos tomé las riendas del negocio familiar.

Su propósito central con su cultivo no es formar a sus hijos para que continúen realizando las mismas actividades, quiere brindarles la oportunidad de estudio, para que con criterios y excelentes ideas lleven este negocio a un siguiente nivel.

Por ello para Federman es muy importante mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, ampliar su cultivo, pues tendrá capital para pensar que pagar la educación de sus muchachos si es posible.

Federman pensando en una expansión aspira a tener un apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, abonos, riegos, crear canales de cultivo, comprar purina de engorde para el ganado, y pagar los jornales para un nuevo terreno de cultivo.

Todo ello ligado a su estrategia, Federman espera un aporte tuyo, se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y demostrar gratitud teniendo éxito en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Federman is a farmer who lives in the San Pedro de Urabá zone, a place surrounded by thriving, striving and hardworking farmers like him. With his business, he earns the income he needs to support his family, made up of his wife and three children who are all minors.

Federman learned everything about agriculture from his father. Since he was young, he's been taking care of crops and is waiting for the moment to begin teaching his children to take the reins of the family business.

His main purpose with his crop is not to train his children to continue doing the same activities. He wants to provide the opportunity to study so they can take this business to the next level with great criteria and ideas.

As a result, it's very important for Federman to improve his sales, increase his customers and expand his crop so he will have funds to be able to pay for the education of his children if it's possible.

Federman is thinking about an expansion and aims to have financial support for the purchase of agricultural inputs like seeds, compost, irrigation, creating crop canals, buying fattening food for livestock and pay day workers for new cropland.

With everything linked to his strategy, Federman hopes for your support. He promises to be punctual with his payments and demonstrate gratitude for having success in his projects.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds, compost and irrigation, and to create canals for crops and buy fattening food for livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cassava,beans and banana for sale.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is 38 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Sadaf thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc. for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 50 years old and married with four children. All of them are sent in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelfa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Adelfa has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is 32 years old, a married woman and mother of one child. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Saba has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do some engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.
SABA gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband so he can fix his rickshaw.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles says, "I just want to switch from cooking with expensive and Inconvenient fuels ie. charcoal and firewood to clean and efficient biogas system from Takamoto biogas. What I like about the biogas system from Takamoto biogas system is its flexible repayment system that is convenient for small dairy farmers like me." 

Please help Charles to fulfill his dream of owning a biogas system!

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean cooking for his family

loans.name: Laufofoga

texts.en:
Laufofoga is 42 years old with 5 children. She runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Laufofoga requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2009, and she will use her  profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 49 year old married woman of five children, still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family. He owns a minimarket in his town for many years and as for her, she doesn’t work and she cares only for her home and family. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children educational fees. She states that she is thankful for Kiva that allowed her to ensure them to continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees

loans.name: Moila

texts.en:
Moila is a 41 year old mother with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. 

Moila requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil, container, to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year and she will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil, container,

loans.name: Fedilyn

texts.en:
Fedilyn is 35 years old, married with nine children, five of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Fedilyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Gulanda

texts.ru: Гуланда успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав свой кредит по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Гуланды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 7 овец, лошадь. На 1,90 Га собственного и 2,0 Га арендованного земельного надела выращивает арбузы, дыни, кукурузу и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гуланда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян для посадки кукурузы и удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Доходы от кредита Гуланда планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса и строительство дома.
texts.en:
Gulanda has successfully repaid her loan having used the funds as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to all who have helped her with financing. Thanks to Gulanda's hard work at present she has four cows, seven sheep and one horse on her farm. She also grows watermelons, melons, corn and barley on 1.9 ha [4.7 acres] of own land and 2.0 ha [4.9 acres] of leased land. Her monthly  revenue is  11,500 KGS. 

In order to develop her farm further, Gulanda has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat her soil and grow environmentally clean produce. Gulanda plans to use the resulting revenue for a further business growth as well as home construction work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of corn and fertilizers for growing organic products.

loans.name: Frrok

texts.en: Frrok, this very poor villager, previously added olive seedlings with your loan.  Now with this loan, he is requesting to add seven beehives to the the ones he already has.

loans.use: to pay for seven beehives to add to his smallholding

loans.name: Tungteeya - Kpatari-Bugu Group

texts.en:
Meli is a hard-working 35-year-old woman from Kpataribogu in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married with five children. She is the person squatting with both hands placed on the basin of shea nuts in the group picture. 

Meli is a member of a shea nuts processing group whose members have been processing shea nuts over the past four years. Their group is called ‘Tungteeya - Kpatari-Bugu’ Women Group. Meli and her group have a ready market for their products. She and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve ways of processing quality nuts for both home and export markets. 

Meli and the group have asked for another loan of GHS 6,100.00 after they successfully paid off their previous loan. Her share of the loan is GHS 400.00 which would help her to process six more bags of shea nuts. By doing so, she would earn more income and hence pay back this loan and also support her children. Meli thanks her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To process six more bags of shea nuts.

loans.name: Abeeda

texts.en:
Abeeda is a 30-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a tailor and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession. His sewing machine has become out of order and need to be replacement with new one but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy new sewing machine.

Therefore, Abeeda has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new professional sewing machine.
Her family has to do hard work for generating income for huge family. 

She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Mavlyudahan

texts.ru: Мавлюдахан, 54 года, замужем. У нее - средне-специальное образование, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Мавлюдахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 4 овцы. На 0,42 Га земли она выращивает овощи, арбузы и лук на продажу. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). Мавлюдахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на сбор ее экологически-чистой продукции. На полученные средства она приобретет сетчатые мешки для сбора и хранения урожая, заплатит наемным работникам и за транспортировку. Доходы от кредита позволят Мавлюдахан развить ее бизнес и приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en:
Mavlyudahan is 54 years old and married. She has finished a technical school. Since 2010 she has been working in agriculture and supporting her family in this way. Thanks to Mavlyudahan's hard work, she now has two cows and four sheep on her farm. She grows vegetables, watermelons and onions for sale on a field of 0.42 ha [1 acre]. Her monthly business revenue is about 7,000 soms (KGS).

Mavlyudahan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to harvest her environmentally clean produce. She will use her loan to stock up on  mesh bags to harvest and store her produce and pay the costs of hired labor and transportation. The revenues from this loan will allow Mavlyudahan to keep developing her business as well as to purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase bags and cover the cost of labor needed to harvest  her eco-friendly onions.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 41 year old married woman, living with her husband and two children. She cooperates with her husband in order to fulfil their family needs. She owns a grocery store since 2012. Her shop is situated next to her house where she welcomes customers from different areas and villages to buy her fresh goods. 

Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her store’s inventory. She said that the loan will surely help her extend her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store’s inventory

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Marco desea montar un negocio de comidas en el municipio de Cerete.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que tiene de salir adelante y ser prospero. Aunque el siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 carrito de comidas, sillas, mesas, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de un hombre colombiano!
texts.en:
With the dream of getting ahead and excelling, Marco wants to set up a food business in the municipality of Cerete.

This idea comes from his motivation to succeed and be prosperous. Although he has always wanted to be independent, he never had the courage to take the risk and start a business. But now he feels the strength and ability to do it. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase all the necessary items to set up his business, such as a food cart, chairs, tables, supplies and ingredients for food preparation.

With these items he will be able to start this project and he will be able to achieve his dream. 

With the support of this loan you will be sponsoring the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian man!

loans.use: to purchase all the necessary items to set up his business, such as a food cart, chairs, tables, supplies and ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is a 54-year-old married mother of five children. Fifteen years ago, she started her own bakery. She is a hard worker who is well known in her region with her special baked bread, Manakish and pastries.

Raafat is always trying hard to develop her business, thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain her oven which will help her provide delicious bread for her customers.

Raafat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her oven to provide delicious bread for her customers

loans.name: Feliuai

texts.en: Feliuai is a 47 year old mother with 3 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Feliuai requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 43 year old Lebanese married woman for four children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He owns a small minimarket in his town. Khadija at this period is in a real need of a little help from kiva. 

For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children educational fees to register them with the coming school year.  She said that she is happy that she will be able to pursue her children education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees and register them for the coming school year

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 24 years old. She is single and has one child. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for five years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon. She will use profits from the business to purchase food for the family. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her salon to make it bring enough income.

loans.use: to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 63 years old, married with ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Felicidad has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buy and sell personal products like bags and slippers.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Felina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Vaiana

texts.en:
Vaiana is a 39 year old mother with 4 children and she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Vaiana requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Musab

texts.en:
Musab is 25 years old and married man. He lives in small village near Hebron City with his family and he has little daughter.  

A few years ago, Musab started raising sheep and lambs in his own yard to sell as meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.


He has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed; this will help his a lot to improve his business and take steps forward in this field.
Musab is very grateful to everyone who helps his achieve success in his business with this loan. Musab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed;

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with six children who go to school. She lives in a four bed room house in Bamenda in the North-West Region of Cameroon.

The fact that she has faced many challenges in life, which are the death of her parents, sickness, and disappointment in her marriage, has made life so difficult for her. She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2003. She has successfully borrowed and repaid loans six times.

With this new loan she is going to buy plantains, bananas, cocoa yams, cassavas, Irish Potatoes, piglets, chicks, feed, and drinkers.

She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for so long, others have been succeeding, and she will buy quality food stuff and has a good business site. With this business activity, the community will benefit from quality food stuff, moderate prices, reduced distance to market, and manure for cultivation at a cheap price.

The profit from this loan helps her pay for her children's school fees and provide some basic food for the family, to pay for the family’s medication, to plough back some of the profit, and to buy a plot to build a house for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rate and convenient terms of repayment.

loans.use: to buy plantains, bananas, cocoa yams, cassavas, Irish Potatoes, piglets, chicks, feed, and drinkers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Recel Grace is 22 years old and is 2nd of 3rd children in the family. Her mother Jocelyn who is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and supports her family through her farming sugarcane business in the Philippines.

Recel Grace is studying Bachelor of Science in Information System and is currently in the 1st of this 1 year-course.

Jocelyn is borrowing Php 6000 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Recel Grace for the 1st semester.

When she graduates, Recel Grace plans to be gainfully employed and help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees in IT

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gemma has been pig fastening for 2 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with seven children, one of whom in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. Yahaya joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields.

loans.name: Hugo Alfredo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 27 años de edad y vive soltero. 

Actualmente se dedica a laborar como jornalero agrícola. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos, él desea iniciar su propio negocio, pues con el salario que gana en su actual empleo no le alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar; es por ello que comenzará a trabajar con un criadero de ganado porcino.

Esto lo motiva a solicitar un crédito, el cual será invertido en la compra de cerdos y materiales para la construcción de una cochera, con lo que podrá dar inicio a su proyecto emprendedor. 

Hugo es un hombre pujante y luchador, además es consciente que debe trabajar arduamente para lograr los objetivos que se propone con este nuevo negocio. 

Esto le da la posibilidad de seguir adelante, luchando por cumplir su principal sueño que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hugo is 27 years old and lives alone. He currently works as agriculture labor. With the intention of improving his income, he wants to start his own business. With his salary he earns from his present employment he can't manage to cover all his household expenses.

For this reason he has started to work with a pork producer. And it is his motivation in requesting a loan which will be invested in buying pigs and materials to construct a pigpen so that he can start his enterprise.

Hugo is a forceful man and a fighter. Besides he is conscious that he has to work hard to reach the objectives that he is proposing with this new business.

This gives him the possibility to get ahead, striving to fulfill his main dream which is to improve the condition of his house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and materials for a pigpen so he can begin an enterprise.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is the age of 30; she is the mother of a child, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband sews school bags.  He has two sewing machines for sewing school bags. He has been sewing bags on order now; he wants to sell his sewed bags directly into the market, so he can get maximum reward against his efforts. But he does not have initial capital to buy raw material for sewing bags.

Therefore, she has requested to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy raw material such as rexine, zipper, buckles, etc for sewing bags. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, zipper and buckles, for her husband's bags sewing business.

loans.name: Gladys Joy

texts.en:
Gladys Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish for her making dried fish business.

Gladys Joy has been in this business for 1 year. Gladys Joy earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Phalin

texts.en:
Phalin is 24 years old and a second year Business Administration university student. He is married with two children, works as a security guard at institution in a city, since 2014, earning around $4.8 per day. His wife is 22 years old, selling sweets earns approximately $ 8.66 per day. 

Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees for the third year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. 

After graduation, he dreams of saving money to run his own business, build his own house and support his children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees in Business Administration for the third year

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 45 years old, married and has two children, one of whom in school. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice barns and feeds for her pigs.

Glenda has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice barns and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, rope, gasoline, etc for her fishing business .

Iluminada has been in this business for 10 years. Iluminada earns more income from pump boat rental.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, rope, gasoline, etc for her fishing business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Marleny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer responsable, pujante, amable y carismática, tiene 55 años de edad, es felizmente casada y fruto de su matrimonio nacieron sus dos pequeñas adoraciones (hijos) de 12 y 13 años de edad, ella se dedica a preparar alimentos, con su negocio genera los ingresos suplementarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Su deseo de mejorar su negocio, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, superación personal, la llevaron a solicitar un préstamo el cual quiere destinar en la compra de insumos para la preparación de almuerzos, tales como: (aceite, carnes, arroz, plátano, yuca, papa, frijoles, entre otra variedad de productos).

Este aliento económico ayudara a Marleny a preparar mayor cantidad de alimentos, lo que generara un aumento en ventas y mayor utilidad que aportaran mucho en su hogar y en su sueño de pagar la educación de dos muchachos.
texts.en:
Marleny is a responsible, forceful, friendly and charismatic 55 year old. She is happily married and has two adorable children aged 12 and 13 years old as fruit from her matrimony. She works preparing foods and with her business generates the supplementary income to sustain her household.

Her wish to improve her business, offer her family a higher quality of living and excel personally has lead her to request a loan. She will use it to buy ingredients to prepare her lunches such as oil, meat, rice, plantain, yucca, potatoes and beans amongst a variety of other products.

This economic boost will help Marleny to prepare a greater quantity of foods, which will generate a boost in her sales and greater profits which will contribute greatly to her household and her dream of paying for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her lunches such as oil, meat, rice, plantain, yucca, potatoes and beans amongst a variety of others.

loans.name: Luzia

texts.en:
Luzia lives in Atsabe, she is married and she has one child. She has a business and she always sells everywhere, if there is a day in which the market is open she will also sell there. 

She started her business in 2007 with an initial capital of $500.00. So now she wants to requesting a loan of $1500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to be used to purchase items that will be sold like rice bowls, basins, thermos, floor mat, kettle, glass, colander and other things to sell. 

The hope with borrowed money, she could make her business a big plus.

loans.use: To buy rice bowls, basins, thermos, floor mats, kettles, glass, colander and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cerro Copeton Group

texts.en:
The Cerro Copeton group is composed of heads of family such as Gabriel, in the pasted thumbnail because he arrived late to take the group picture. He is a young peasant who wants to improve his living conditions. He and his neighbors live in a remote community of Mexico without electricity service and use candles to light by night. 

Now, with the third generation solar home systems they have decided to install, for example Gabriel can join his family for dinner. This loan is asked to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar systems for their houses.

loans.name: Angelia

texts.en:
Angelia is 39 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by vegetable farming in the Philippines. Angelia has been farming vegetable for 19 years and also earns additional income from selling fish.

Angelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married with three children and lives in a two bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, including the deaths of his parents who were very supportive to him and the family at large, sickness, and many other problems that almost took all the little money to use in his farm.

He has taken and successfully repaid his loan eight times and says with this new loan requested, he will buy Irish potatoes seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour. He has a positive view of his Irish potato production, succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time. With this farming activity, the community members will have enough food for consumption and hence offer temporal employment to the inhabitants.

With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three meals, pay for his family's medication, pay for his children’s' education, and provide them with other basic necessities. He will also put back some profits into the business and do repairs on his house. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Falla's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe à été crée depuis le 19 Septembre 2012, les membres de ce groupe habitent le même village et font activité le petit commerce, l'artisanat, l'agriculture. 
Collé emprunteuse en vedette est le responsable de groupe, elle est âgée de 25ans, marié et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 garçon. 
Elle fait du petit commerce de légume.Elle s'approvisionne dans un marché hebdomadaire qui est à 14 km du village pour le revendre dans village. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des légumes (carotte 5000f, navet4000f, aubergine et piment 6000f, oignon 6 sacs à 30000f et le reste sera le transport. 
Avec ses bénéfices elle va appuyer son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et géré ses affaires personnelles.
texts.en:
This group was created on September 19th, 2012. The members of this group live in the same village and work in retail, arts and crafts, and agriculture.

Collé, our featured borrower and the group leader, is twenty-five years old. She is married with two children, one of which is a boy.

She retails vegetables. She procures her supplies from a weekly market fourteen kilometers away, and retails in her village. With the loan, she will purchase vegetables (carrots for 5,000 XOF, turnips for 4,000 XOF, eggplants and hot peppers for 6,000 XOF, six bags of onions for 30,000 XOF); the rest of the money will be used to pay for transportation costs.

With her profits, she will help her husband with daily expenses and take care of her personal business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 55 years old, and she is married with 5 children.

Nida earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizers, and farming supplies.

Nida has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, though she also earns additional income from selling mangoes.

Nida is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizers, and farming supplies.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 21 septembre 2012.Les femmes habitent dans le même village et elles ont de bonne relation entre eux.

Mbingue,emprunteuse en vedette est âgée de 23 ans e.Elle est marié et mère 3 enfants dont 1 fille.

Elle a comme activité du petit commerce de savons,des condiments, de l'huile en détail,eau de javel,et du sucre en détail.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 20 litres huile à 12000, 2caisse de savons à 4000f chacun,des sachets eau de javel et le reste des condiments.

Les bénéfices sert à renforcer son épargne,payer ses intérêt et satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was created on September 21, 2012. The women live in the same village and have good relations with one another.

Mbingue, our featured borrower, is twenty-three years old. She is married with three children, one of which is a girl.

She retails soaps, condiments, oil, chlorine, and sugar. With her loan, she plans to purchase twenty liters of oil for 12,000 XOF, two boxes of soaps for 4,000 XOF each, pouches of chlorine, and condiments with the rest of the money.

Profits are used to increase her savings, pay her interest, and provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: John Vill

texts.en:
Fishing is one of the sources of income in most communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. John Vill is a 33-year-old man who is engaged in this business. He has been doing this business for 10 years. 

John Vill works hard to provide for the needs of his 3 children. His oldest child is 11 years old while his youngest child is one year old. 

John Vill is asking for a loan to both buy a fishing net and pay for the repair of his boat. He dreams of sending all his children to school in the future so they can earn degrees.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and pay for his boat repair.
