loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. 

Rose is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business. She has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 52-year-old woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 2 of her children are still attending school. Emily’s husband is a carpenter, while she buys and sells dried fish. 

Aside from selling dried fish Emily also sells frozen foods such as meat, hotdogs, and sausages. She has been working hard to improve their livelihood. 

Emily is requesting a loan to buy dried fish and frozen foods to sell. In the future, she wishes to increase her earnings to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and frozen foods.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be social. She operates a farm where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are tea factories. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Tabara's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée depuis le 21 mars 2013.Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même quartier et font comme activité principale le commerce et l'agriculture, elles ont une bonne attente.

Khady l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 57 ans.Elle est marié et mère de 3 filles, toutes majeurs et mariées.

Elle fait le petit commerce de légume et un peu de maraichage.

Avec son prêt, elle va investir dans son commerce les 25000f et les autres 2500f pour achat de fumier.

Avec les bénéfices,elle va renforcer son épargne e appuyer sa famille pour l'achat du sucre du petit déjeuner.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 21, 2013. The group’s members live in the same neighborhood; their main businesses are retail and agriculture. They have good relations.

Khady, our featured borrower, is fifty-seven years old. She is married and has three daughters, all over eighteen and married.

She retails vegetables and does some vegetable farming herself. With her loan, she will invest 25,000 XOF in her retail business, and the remaining 2,500 XOF to purchase manure.

With her profits, she will increase her savings and help her family to purchase sugar for breakfast.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and manure for farming.

loans.name: Isuwa

texts.en:
Isuwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. Isuwa joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isuwa  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isuwa  now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar systems for their houses.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is 41 and she is married. She lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells it in her locality. She has been doing this since 2005, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to upcoming festival and wedding season, the demand for clothing will increase as well. 

This is the reason she showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 23 Décembre 2014 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles ont une bonne entente et nouent des liens fort de solidarités et d’entre aide.

Madame Coumba (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 42 ans et  mère de 06enfants dont 01 fille et 05 garçons. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce et l’agriculture.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des habits d’un montant de 60000f à Dakar, payer un transport de 13000f à l’aller comme au retour pour venir le revendre dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales, surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants et aider son mari.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 23, 2014, on the day that their village financing association was inaugurated. The group includes a majority of women with solid experience in retail, which is also their main business. They get along well and maintain strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance.

Ms. Coumba (standing all the way to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is married, forty-two years old, and a mother of six—one girl and five boys. She is active in retail and agriculture.

This new loan will allow her to purchase clothes in Dakar, for a price of 60,000 XOF, and to pay 13,000 XOF in transportation costs (return trip so that she can resell the clothes where she lives).

The profits will allow her to participate actively to the household’s expenses, especially to the children’s school expenses, and to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy 60,000 XOF worth of clothes in Dakar and pay 13,000 XOF for return transportation to her resale area.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 35, is a farmer living in Battambang province, and she is the mother of 2 dependent children who don't yet attend school. 

Heang has been growing cassava as her main source of income, which she has been involved in for 6 years. She occasionally works as a paid worker to earn supplemental income. 

Heang lacks the capital to support her farming business, so she has applied for this Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is her first time with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers for her farmland and to increase her crop yields. 

Heang hopes to generate more income to both send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers for her farmland and to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cynthia is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cynthia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cynthia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cynthia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ferolyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ferolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Ferolyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Ferolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. Ummaru joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ummaru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ummaru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
A loan of IDR 10,000,000 helps Emanuel to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to the community.

Emanuel was born and raised in the town of Larantuka on the island of Flores in Indonesia where the majority of people work as fisherman. The solar lamps are useful for the fisherman to do night fishing, replacing the inconvenient, kerosene lamp which only produces dim light. The solar lamp is also popular with households that often experience power cuts at night.

Besides having a printing shop, Emanuel has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to subsidise his income from his small printing shop. He will use the loan to grow his business and save some money for his soon to be family as his wife is expecting their first child in December.

loans.use: A loan of IDR 10,000,000 will help Emanuel to introduce simple technology such as solar lamp, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Wonadia 2 Group

texts.fr:
Salmata est âgée de 50 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants, vendeuses de céréales (oignon) depuis 1999.
Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est la qualité des oignons. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter   100 000 f cfa d’oignon pour le mois de novembre et décembre.  L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour revendre au moment des fêtes. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plus de 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME
texts.en:
Salmata is fifty years old, married, and a mother of six. She has retailed vegetables (onions) since 1999.

Her business thrives because of the quality of the onions. She wants the loan to purchase 100,000 XOF worth of onions for the months of November and December. The loan is useful to purchase in sufficient quantities to resell during the holidays.

She has already been granted loans more than twice, and has repaid ACFIIME punctually.

loans.use: to buy 100,000 XOF of onions for the months of November and December.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita is very happy with the business that she practices every day. Because she sells in the market, many people come to buy her goods. 

Bendita is married, and she has 3 children. Volatility in business is very high, and even though she already has 3 children, she said she does not want to be too dependent on her husband. So now she is applying for a loan of 1000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

Bendita is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital and buy more supplies to keep in her store to sell, including cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, lighters, among other things. 

Bendita opened her business in 2013 with her own working capital of 500 USD.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to keep in her store to sell, including cooking oils, aqua, biscuits,  noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, lighters, among other things.

loans.name: Farishta

texts.ru: Фаришта уроженка района Кумсангир. Ей 41 лет и она замужем. У неё две дочки и два сына. Её муж мастер по ремонту домов. Фаришта простая женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она принимает заказы на дом. Дома ей легче работать, чем в ателье, потому что так она успевает работать по дому и кормить свою семью. Фаришта получает больше дохода от своей работы, чем её муж. К сожалению, в данный момент её швейная машинка сломалась и нуждается в ремонте. У Фаришта не достаточно денег, и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она намерена купить разные виды  тканей, нитки и другие необходимы вещи для шитья. Фаришта не хочет потерять источник своего дохода и очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Farishta is a native of the Qumsangir district. She is 41 years old, married, and has two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a home repairs expert. Farishta is a simple woman. She works from home sewing women's clothing to order. It is easier for her to work at home than in a workshop because it allows her the time to do housework and feed her family. Her work earns Farishta more income than her husband's. Unfortunately her sewing machine is currently broken and in need of repair. Farishta does't have enough money, so she is asking for a loan. She plans for the borrowed funds to go toward buying various types of cloth, thread, and other sewing necessities. She does not want to lose this source of income, and very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy various fabrics, thread, and other necessities for sewing
